COMT_IN300001CA

Add patient note request

Requests that the specified annotation be recorded against the identified patient

Message < ControlActEvent < Annotation >  > 
 
 

COMT_IN300002CA

Add patient note request accepted

Indicates that the specified annotation has been successfully recorded against the requested patient.

Message < ControlActEvent < ActEvent >  > 
 
 

COMT_IN300003CA

Add patient note request refused

Indicates that the request to record the annotation against a particular patient has been denied.

Message < ControlActEvent > 
 
 

COMT_IN300101CA

Deprecate patient note request

Requests that the specified patient annotation be marked as no longer applicable.

Message < ControlActEvent < ActEvent >  > 
 
 

COMT_IN300102CA

Deprecate patient note request accepted

Indicates that the specified patient annotation has been successfully marked as no longer applicable.

Message < ControlActEvent < ActEvent >  > 
 
 

COMT_IN300103CA

Deprecate patient note request refused

Indicates that the request to mark the specified patient annotation as no longer applicable has been refused.

Message < ControlActEvent < ActEvent >  > 
 
 

COMT_IN300201CA

Patient note query

Requests retrieval of the notes that have been recorded against a particular patient, potentially filtered by note type and/or date.

Message < ControlActEvent < ParameterList >  > 
 
 

COMT_IN300202CA

Patient note query response

Returns the notes that have been recorded against a particular patient, potentially filtered by note type and/or date.

Message < ControlActEvent < Annotation, ParameterList >  > 
 
 

COMT_IN301001CA

Add note to record request

Requests that the specified annotation be recorded against a particular record.

Message < ControlActEvent < Annotation >  > 
 
 

COMT_IN301002CA

Add note to record request accepted

Indicates that the specified annotation has been successfully recorded against the requested record.

Message < ControlActEvent > 
 
 

COMT_IN301003CA

Add note to record request refused

Indicates that the request to record the annotation against a particular record has been denied.

Message < ControlActEvent > 
 
 

COMT_IN400001CA

Change item masking request

Requests that an identified item, group of items (identified by act type, medication, indication) or all items for a particular patient should have their confidentiality code changed to the specified value.

Message < ControlActEvent < MaskableActType >  > 
 
 

COMT_IN400002CA

Change item masking request accepted

Indicates that the confidentiality code has been successfully revised for the requested identified item, group of items (identified by act type, medication, indication) or all items for a particular patient.

Message < ControlActEvent > 
 
 

COMT_IN400003CA

Change item masking request refused

Indicates that the requested confidentiality code change has been denied.

Message < ControlActEvent > 
 
 

COMT_IN500001CA

Broadcast Message

Sends a broadcast message to all or a subset of users of a given system; (Used for alerts regarding system outages or other urgent messages).

Message < ControlActEvent < InformEvent >  > 
 
 

COMT_IN600001CA

Retract action request

Seeks to have an identified ControlAct nullified, essentially reversing the record of the event.

Message < ControlActEvent < ActEvent >  > 
 
 

COMT_IN600002CA

Retract action request accepted

Indicates that an identified ControlAct has been nullified as requested, essentially reversing the record of the event.

Message < ControlActEvent < ActEvent >  > 
 
 

COMT_IN600003CA

Retract action request refused

Indicates that the request to nullify an identified ControlAct has been denied, leaving the original event in force.

Message < ControlActEvent < ActEvent >  > 
 
 

COMT_IN700001CA

Add issue management request

Requests that the specified issue be updated to include the identified management(s).

Message < ControlActEvent < DetectedIssueEvent >  > 
 
 

COMT_IN700002CA

Add issue management request accepted

Indicates that the specified issue has been successfully updated to include the identified management(s).

Message < ControlActEvent > 
 
 

COMT_IN700003CA

Add issue management request refused

Indicates that the request to update an issue with identified management(s) has been denied.

Message < ControlActEvent > 
 
 

MCCI_IN000002CA

Accept Ack

Sends HL7 Accept Acknowledgement

Message
 
 

MCCI_IN102001CA

Send Poll Transmission

Sends HL7 Poll Transmission to an HL7 interaction queue manager.

Message
 
 

MCCI_IN102002CA

Request Poll Queue Status

Requests an indication of the number and priority of outstanding interactions (if any) on the application's poll queue.

Message
 
 

MCCI_IN102003CA

Return Poll Queue Status

Returns an indication of the number and priority of outstanding interactions (if any) on the application's poll queue.

Message
 
 

POIZ_IN010020CA

Record immunization request

Requests that a particular immunization be added to a patient's record.

Message < ControlActEvent < Immunization >  > 
 
 

POIZ_IN010030CA

Record immunization request accepted

Indicates that the requested immunization information has been successfully added to the patient's record.

Message < ControlActEvent < ActEvent >  > 
 
 

POIZ_IN010040CA

Record immunization request refused

Indicates that the request to add an immunization to the patient record has been denied.

Message < ControlActEvent > 
 
 

POIZ_IN010070CA

Update immunization request

Request that information about a previously recorded immunization be changed.

Message < ControlActEvent < Immunization >  > 
 
 

POIZ_IN010080CA

Update immunization request accepted

Indicates that information about a change to a previously recorded immunization has been successfully recorded.

Message < ControlActEvent < ActEvent >  > 
 
 

POIZ_IN010090CA

Update immunization request refused

Indicates that the request to record a change to information about a previously recorded immunization has been refused.

Message < ControlActEvent < ActEvent >  > 
 
 

POIZ_IN010100CA

Retract immunization request

Asks that a previously recorded immunization should be ""removed"" from the record; (Information may be retained for audit purposes).

Message < ControlActEvent < ActEvent >  > 
 
 

POIZ_IN010110CA

Retract immunization request accepted

Indicates that a previously recorded immunization has been ""removed"" from the record as requested; (Information may have been retained for audit purposes).

Message < ControlActEvent < ActEvent >  > 
 
 

POIZ_IN010120CA

Retract immunization request refused

Indicates that the requested previously recorded immunization will not be ""removed"" from the record;

Message < ControlActEvent < ActEvent >  > 
 
 

POIZ_IN020010CA

Immunizations query

Requests retrieval of detailed information about a patient's immunizations, potentially filtered by time-range of the immunization, time-range the immunization was last updated, and/or type of immunization.

Message < ControlActEvent < ParameterList >  > 
 
 

POIZ_IN020020CA

Immunizations query response

Returns detailed information about a patient's immunizations.

Message < ControlActEvent < Immunization, ParameterList >  > 
 
 

POME_IN010010CA

Drug document query

Requests retrieval of a specific monograph or set of monographs for a particular medication (specified by identifier) or indication. The type of monograph (provider, patient, long, short, etc.) may be specified.

Message < ControlActEvent < ParameterList >  > 
 
 

POME_IN010020CA

Drug document query response

Returns one or more drug, protocol or contraindication monographs as text, HTML, PDF or CDA documents.

Message < ControlActEvent < Document, ParameterList >  > 
 
 

POME_IN010050CA

Drug product detail query

Requests retrieval of detailed information about a single drug product by product code.

Message < ControlActEvent < ParameterList >  > 
 
 

POME_IN010060CA

Drug product detail query response

Returns detailed information about a single drug product.

Message < ControlActEvent < Medication, ParameterList >  > 
 
 

POME_IN010070CA

Drug search query

Requests retrieval of a lists of candidate drugs based on various search criteria such as name, route, code, manufacturer, appearance, etc.

Message < ControlActEvent < ParameterList >  > 
 
 

POME_IN010080CA

Drug search query response

Returns a list of basic identifying and descriptive information about one or more medications.

Message < ControlActEvent < Medication, ParameterList >  > 
 
 

PORX_IN010060CA

Record refusal to dispense request

Requests that the specified ""refusal to fill"" note be recorded against the identified prescription.

Message < ControlActEvent < ActRequest >  > 
 
 

PORX_IN010070CA

Record refusal to dispense request accepted

Indicates that the requested ""refusal to fill"" note has been recorded against the identified prescription.

Message < ControlActEvent < ActRequest >  > 
 
 

PORX_IN010080CA

Record refusal to dispense request refused

Indicates that the request to record a ""refusal to fill"" against a prescription has been refused.

Message < ControlActEvent < ActRequest >  > 
 
 

PORX_IN010090CA

Revise assigned dispense responsibility notif.

Indicates that the responsibility for fulfilling the dispense portion of a prescription has changed.

Message < ControlActEvent < SupplyRequest >  > 
 
 

PORX_IN010100CA

Revise assigned dispense responsibility req.
Message < ControlActEvent < SupplyRequest >  > 
 
 

PORX_IN010110CA

Revise assigned dispense responsibility req. acc.

Indicates that the responsibility for fulfilling the dispense portion of a prescription has been changed to the requested facility.

Message < ControlActEvent < Prescription >  > 
 
 

PORX_IN010120CA

Revise assigned dispense responsibility req. ref.

Indicates that the request to change the facility responsible for fulfilling the dispense portion of a prescription has been refused.

Message < ControlActEvent < ActRequest >  > 
 
 

PORX_IN010300CA

Activate device prescription request

Requests that a device prescription be recorded against the patient's record.

Message < ControlActEvent < DeviceRequest >  > 
 
 

PORX_IN010380CA

Activate prescription request

Requests that a medication prescription be recorded against the patient's record.

Message < ControlActEvent < CombinedMedicationRequest >  > 
 
 

PORX_IN010390CA

Activate prescription request accepted

Indicates that a medication prescription has been recorded against the patient's record as requested.

Message < ControlActEvent < ActRequest >  > 
 
 

PORX_IN010400CA

Activate prescription request refused

Indicates that the request to record a medication prescription against the patient's record as been refused.

Message < ControlActEvent > 
 
 

PORX_IN010420CA

Prescription clinical pre-determination check

Requests the specified medication prescription proposal be reviewed, and any detected issues be identified.

Message < ControlActEvent < CombinedMedicationRequest >  > 
 
 

PORX_IN010440CA

Suspend prescription request

Requests that the specified prescription be suspended.

Message < ControlActEvent < ActRequest >  > 
 
 

PORX_IN010450CA

Suspend prescription request accepted

Indicates that the requested prescription has been suspended.

Message < ControlActEvent < ActRequest >  > 
 
 

PORX_IN010460CA

Suspend prescription request refused

Indicates that the request to suspend specified prescription has been refused.

Message < ControlActEvent < ActRequest >  > 
 
 

PORX_IN010520CA

Resume prescription request

Requests that the specified prescription be released.

Message < ControlActEvent < ActRequest >  > 
 
 

PORX_IN010530CA

Resume prescription request accepted

Indicates that the requested prescription has been released.

Message < ControlActEvent < ActRequest >  > 
 
 

PORX_IN010540CA

Resume prescription request refused

Indicates that the request to release specified prescription has been refused.

Message < ControlActEvent < ActRequest >  > 
 
 

PORX_IN010560CA

Abort dispense authorization request

Requests that a prescription be marked as ""no longer dispensable but still administrable"".

Message < ControlActEvent < ActRequest >  > 
 
 

PORX_IN010570CA

Abort dispense authorization request accepted

Indicates that the requests prescription has been marked as ""no longer dispensable but still administrable"".

Message < ControlActEvent < ActRequest >  > 
 
 

PORX_IN010580CA

Abort dispense authorization request refused

Indicates that the request to mark a prescription as ""no longer dispensable but still administrable"" has been refused.

Message < ControlActEvent < ActRequest >  > 
 
 

PORX_IN010630CA

Prescription clinical pre-determination not ok

Indicates that the specified medication prescription proposal was reviewed and no issues were detected.

Message < ControlActEvent > 
 
 

PORX_IN010640CA

Prescription clinical pre-determination ok

Indicates that the specified issues were found in reviewing the requested medication prescription proposal.

Message < ControlActEvent > 
 
 

PORX_IN010650CA

Prescription fulfillment request (no resp.)

Requests that the specified facility dispense the medication prescription transmitted by this interaction and does not expect a response interaction

Message < ControlActEvent < CombinedMedicationRequest >  > 
 
 

PORX_IN010720CA

Prescription renewal request

Requests that a prescriber issue a renewal prescription based on a previously existing prescription.

Message < ControlActEvent < ActRequest >  > 
 
 

PORX_IN010730CA

Prescription renewal request accepted

Indicates that the requested prescription has been renewed by a new prescription, referenced by identifier.

Message < ControlActEvent < ActRequest >  > 
 
 

PORX_IN010740CA

Prescription renewal request refused

Indicates that the request for the issuance of a prescription has been refused.

Message < ControlActEvent > 
 
 

PORX_IN010840CA

Abort prescription request

Requests that the specified prescription be aborted (further dispensing or administrative must cease).

Message < ControlActEvent < ActRequest >  > 
 
 

PORX_IN010850CA

Abort prescription request accepted

Indicates that the requested prescription has been aborted (further dispensing or administrative must cease)

Message < ControlActEvent < ActRequest >  > 
 
 

PORX_IN010860CA

Abort prescription request refused

Indicates that the request to abort specified prescription has been refused.

Message < ControlActEvent < ActRequest >  > 
 
 

PORX_IN010940CA

Device prescr. fulfill request (no resp.)

Requests that the specified facility dispense the device prescription transmitted by this interaction and does not expect a response interaction

Message < ControlActEvent < DeviceRequest >  > 
 
 

PORX_IN011040CA

Activate device prescription request accepted

Indicates that a device prescription has been recorded against the patient's record as requested.

Message < ControlActEvent < ActRequest >  > 
 
 

PORX_IN011050CA

Activate device prescription request refused

Indicates that the request to record a device prescription against the patient's record as been refused.

Message < ControlActEvent > 
 
 

PORX_IN020060CA

Record device dispense processing request

Requests that the device dispense processing (drug preparation, packaging and contraindication checking) for a particular quantity of devices against a prescription has been performed and the medication is awaiting pickup ne recorded.

Message < ControlActEvent < DeviceDispense >  > 
 
 

PORX_IN020070CA

Dispense pickup notification

Indicates that a previously processed prescription has now been picked up.

Message < ControlActEvent < SupplyEvent >  >

PORX_IN050020CA

Indicates the contraindications (if any) associated with a set of medications. Only includes drug-drug and duplicate therapy contraindications because that's all that is deducible based on a list of medications.

COCT_MT040205CA

COCT_MT040205CA.Person
classCode : "PSN" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "INSTANCE" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
name : PN.BASIC

Business name: A:Responsible Person Name

The name by which the responsible person is known

Used when contacting or addressing the responsible person. Because this will be the principle means of identifying the responsible person, it is mandatory.

ZPB3.13

PVD.050-01 (PartType = Family)

PVD.050-02 (PartType = Given - 1st rep)

PVD.050-03 PartType = Given - any rep other than the first)

PVD.050-04 (PartType = Suffix)

PVD.050-05 (PartType = Prefix)

PVD.100-01 (PartType = Family; author/performer when supervisor is also specified)

PVD.100-02 (PartType = Given - 1st rep; author/performer when supervisor is also specified )

PVD.100-03 PartType = Given - any rep other than the first; author/performer when supervisor is also specified)

PVD.100-04 (PartType = Suffix; author/performer when supervisor is also specified)

PVD.100-05 (PartType = Prefix; author/performer when supervisor is also specified)

D1a

Practitioner's Name

04.03

Prescriber.427-DR

Prescribing Physician Name

ProviderPreviewInfo.ProviderName

1Mand
COCT_MT040205CA.ResponsibleParty

Business name: Responsible Person

Describes a person (other than a health-care provider or patient) who is providing information and making decision on behalf of the patient, in relation to the delivery of healthcare for the patient. E.g. Patient's mother.

Important for tracking source of information for decision making and other actions taken on behalf of a patient.

classCode : "AGNT" (RoleClass)1Mand
id : II

Business name: B:Responsible Person ID

A unique identifier for the responsible person.

Allows a person to be uniquely referred to.

ZPB1.6 (Root)

ZPB1.7 (EXtension)

ZPB2.8 (Root)

ZPB2.9 (EXtension)

ZPB3.11 (Root)

ZPB3.12 (EXtension)

ZPB3.18 (Root)

ZPB3.19 (EXtension)

D60 (Root)

D61 (Extension)

D76

PVD.020-02 (Root)

ZDP.19.1 (Extension)

ZDP.19.2 (Root)

ZDP.10.2 (Root)

Provider.PproviderExternalKey (Extension)

Provider.providerKey (Extension)

Provider.wellnetProviderId (Extension)

ProviderRegistration.Identifier (Extension)

ProviderRegistration.IdentifierDomain (part of Extension)

ProviderRegistrationjurisdiction (part of Extension)

0-1Req
code : (x_SimplePersonalRelationship)

Business name: C:Responsible Person Type

A coded value indicating how the responsible person is related to the person for whom they have accepted responsibility.

May be important for understanding the authority to perform certain actions. E.g. A 'friend' may not be able to make consent decisions, but may be able to pick up dispenses.

0-1Req
addr : AD.BASIC

Business name: D:Responsible Person Address

The mail and/or physical address associated with a responsible person.

Used to contact the responsible person.

PVD.080-01 (PartType=SAL)

PVD.080-02 (PartType=CTY)

PVD.080-03 (PartType=CNT)

PVD.080-04 (PartType=ZIP)

D.1b

Shipping Address (PartType=SAL)

City PartType=CTY)

Province (PartType=STA)

Postal Code (PartType=ZIP)

Send care of(PartType=CARE)

0-1Req
telecom : SET<TEL.PHONEMAIL>

Business name: E:Responsible Person Phones and Emails

The phone number(s) and email address(s) by which a responsible person may be contacted.

Used to contact the responsible person.

PVD.090-01 (url)

PVD.090-02 (url.scheme)

PVD.090-01 (use)

D.1c

Fax #

Contact Fax #

Prescriber.498-PM

Prescroibing Physician Phone Number

0-5Req
agentPerson : Person1Mand
 
 

COCT_MT050202CA

COCT_MT050202CA.Patient

Business name: Patient

A person who is receiving or may receive healthcare services and has personal attributes (e.g. name, birth date). .

Information used to identify the patient and to support clinical decisions. This information applies to the person in the context of the associated action only, and should be stored separately. I.e. the address/phone/email only apply to the current prescription/dispense/lab order etc.

classCode : "PAT" (RoleClass)1Mand
id : II

Business name: A:Patient ID

Unique identifier assigned to a person by Federal, Provincial and Territorial jurisdiction for the purposes of uniquely identifying the person within the EHR.

The EHR will define which identifier to use within a jurisdiction.

Allows a patient to be referred to unambiguously. Because this is the principal mechanism for identifying humans, the attribute is mandatory. If an identifier is not known, it should be looked up using the 'client registry' capabilities of the EHR application.

C39 (Extension)

PTT.050.01 (Extension)

PTT.050.02 (Root)

A.1

PID.2

Patient.332-CY (Extension)

Patient.331-CX (Root)

Claim.330-CW

Health Card Number

PID.2

PID.4

ZDU.2

ZKW.3

Jurisdiction (Root)

Person.PHN (Extension)

1Mand
patientPerson : Person1Mand
COCT_MT050202CA.Person
classCode : "PSN" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "INSTANCE" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
name : PN.BASIC

Business name: B:Patient Name

The name by which the patient is known and which apply to a particular clinical action that has been reported or recorded.

Used, with other patient identity attributes, to confirm patient identity, as well as when addressing the patient. Element is mandatory because the patient's name is necessary for positive identification of the patient in the jurisdictional client registry.

ZPA.1 (partType=Given)

ZPA.2 (partType=Family)

ZPA.3 (partType=Given - all repetitions except first)

C37 (partType=Given)

C38 (partType=Family)

PTT.030-01 (partType=Family)

PTT.030-02 (partType=Given - 1st occurrence)

PTT.030-03 (partType=Given - subsequen occurrences)

PTT.030-04 (partType=Suffix)

PTT.030-05 (partType=Prefix)

patient Initials

PID.5

Patient.310-CA (partType=Given)

Patient.311-CB (partType=Family)

Recipient Name First (partType=Given)

Recipient Name Last (partType=Family)

PID.5

PID.9 (any name other than first repetition is an alias)

ZDU.3

ZKW.2

Person.givenName

Person.lastName

Person.middleName

Person.namePrefix

Person.nameSuffix

1Mand
administrativeGenderCode : (AdministrativeGender)

Business name: F:Patient Gender

Indicates the gender (sex) of the patient. Complex genetic genders are handled as observations if they are considered relevant.

Used to confirm patient identity. May affect dosing or therapy appropriateness.

Element is mandatory because the patient's gender is necessary for positive identification of the patient in the jurisdictional client registry.

1Mand
birthTime : TS.DATE

Business name: E:Patient Birth Date

Indicates the date on which the patient was born.

Used to confirm patient identity.

May also influence dosage and therapy appropriateness.

Element is mandatory because the patient's birth date is necessary for positive identification of the patient in the jurisdictional client registry.

1Mand
 
 

COCT_MT050203CA

COCT_MT050203CA.Patient

Business name: Patient

A person who is receiving or may receive healthcare services and has personal attributes (e.g. name, birth date). .

Information used to identify the patient and to support clinical decisions. This information applies to the person in the context of the associated action only, and should be stored separately. I.e. the address/phone/email only apply to the current prescription/dispense/lab order etc.

classCode : "PAT" (RoleClass)1Mand
id : II

Business name: A:Patient ID

Unique identifier assigned to a person by Federal, Provincial and Territorial jurisdiction for the purposes of uniquely identifying the person within the EHR.

The EHR will define which identifier to use within a jurisdiction.

Allows a patient to be referred to unambiguously. Because this is the principal mechanism for identifying humans, the attribute is mandatory. If an identifier is not known, it should be looked up using the 'client registry' capabilities of the EHR application.

C39 (Extension)

PTT.050.01 (Extension)

PTT.050.02 (Root)

A.1

PID.2

Patient.332-CY (Extension)

Patient.331-CX (Root)

Claim.330-CW

Health Card Number

PID.2

PID.4

ZDU.2

ZKW.3

Jurisdiction (Root)

Person.PHN (Extension)

1Mand
addr : AD.BASIC

Business name: C:Patient Contact Address

Physical address for the patient where they may be visited or found for the purposes of this particular action. Generally only specified when different from the addresses stored on the client registry. E.g. address on a prescription issued when a patient is temporary staying away from home.

Can be used to record a temporary address used for the purposes of this prescription.

Not intended for use to confirm patient identity.

ZPA2.1 (use)

ZPA2.2 (usablePeriod(IVL<TS).low)

ZPA2.4 (partType=UNID)

ZPA2.5 (DMODID - following DMOD=P.P.Box)

ZPA2.6 (partType=??)

ZPA2.7 (partType=??)

ZPA2.8 (partType=CTY)

ZPA2.9 (partType=CNT - populate mnemonic of SC)

ZPA2.10 (partType=ZIP)

ZPA2.11 (partType=SINST=PST)

ZPA2.12 (partTYpe=STA)

ZPA2.13 (partType=DMODID-followingDMOD=RR)

ZPA2.14 (partType=DIR)

ZPA2.15 (partType=STB)

ZPA2.16 (partType=BNR) BC:ZPA2.17 (partType=STTYP)

ZPA2.18 (usablePeriod (IVL<TS).high)

ZPA2.19 (Line demarked by carriage return)

PTT.060-01 (partType=SAL)

PTT.060-02 (partType=CTY)

PTT.060-03 (partType=CNT)

PTT.060-04 (partType=ZIP)

PID.11

Patient.322-CM (partType=SAL)

Patient.323-CN (partType=CTY)

Patient.324-CO (partType=STA)

Patient.325-CP (partType=ZIP)

PID.11

0-1Req
telecom : LIST<TEL.PHONEMAIL>

Business name: D:Patient Contact Phone and E-mails

Telephone, fax or e-mail addresses intended as the principal means of contact for the patient with regard to the current action. E.g. the phone number to reach the patient at regarding the results of an ordered test.

On a prescription, this enables the communication of patient contact information to the dispenser for the specific prescription. This can be a phone/fax number and/or email address

Can be used to record a temporary contact mechanism (phone, email) for the purposes of this action.

Not intended for use to confirm patient identity.

Important for following up with patient but not always available, and therefore only marked as 'populated'.

ZPA1.1 (Use and/or URL.scheme)

ZPA1.2 (usablePeriod (IVL<TS>).low) BC:ZPA1.3 (url.address - as per RFC2396)

ZPA1.4 (url.address - as per RFC2396)

ZPA1.5 (usablePeriod (IVL<TS>).high)

PTT.070-01

PTT.070-02

D99.03 (url.address - as per RFC2396)

patient.326-CQ

PID.13

PID.14

classCode : "PSN" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "INSTANCE" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
name : PN.BASIC

Business name: B:Patient Name

The name by which the patient is known and which apply to a particular clinical action being reported or recorded. For a prescription, this will be the name traditionally printed on the paper script or the name that appears on the patient's chart.

Used, with other patient identity attributes, to confirm patient identity, as well as when addressing the patient. Element is mandatory because the patient's name is necessary for positive identification of the patient in the jurisdictional client registry.

COCT_MT050303CA

COCT_MT050303CA.Animal
classCode : "ANM" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "INSTANCE" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
name :

Business name: B:Animal name

Name by which the animal patient is known.

Used, with other patient identity attributes, to confirm patient identity, as well as when addressing the patient. For animals, name is the primary identifier, and is therefore mandatory.

ZPA.1 (partType=Given)

ZPA.2 (partType=Family)

ZPA.3 (partType=Given - all repetitions except first)

COCT_MT050303CA.ContactParty
classCode : "CON" (RoleClass)1Mand
addr : AD.BASIC

Business name: Owner address

The mail and/or physical address associated with the owner or contact person for the animal.

Used to contact the owner or contact person

Business name: Owner Phones and Emails

The phone number(s) and email address(s) by which the owner may be contacted.

Used to contact the owner or contact person

COCT_MT050303CA.ContactPerson

Business name: Owner Person

Describes a person who is to be contacted regarding the delivery of healthcare to the animal.

Important for tracking responsibility for decision making and other actions taken on behalf of an animal patient.

classCode : "PSN" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "INSTANCE" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
name : PN.BASIC

Business name: Owner Name

The name by which the owner person is known

Used when contacting or addressing the owner person. Because this will be the principle means of identifying the owner person, it is mandatory.

1Mand
COCT_MT050303CA.Patient

Business name: Animal Patient

An animal that is receiving or may receive healthcare services.

Used when animal services are attached to a human patient record. E.g. narcotics prescribed for a pet may be attached to the owner's record for monitoring of abuse.

classCode : "PAT" (RoleClass)1Mand
patientAnimal : Animal1Mand
 
 

COCT_MT090107CA

COCT_MT090107CA.AssignedPerson

Business name: Provider

Describes a healthcare provider involved in the delivery of healthcare services. Encompasses both professional and non-professional members.

Important for tracking responsibility for healthcare events, as well as for identifying appropriate individuals to contact for further information or follow-up.

While an important piece of identifying information, not all providers will have identifiers, thus this attribute is only 'populated'.

classCode : "ASSIGNED" (RoleClass)1Mand
id : II

Business name: A:Provider Id

A unique identifier for a provider (e.g. the Prescriber on a new prescription).

Allows a provider to be uniquely referred to but will not always be known and is therefore 'populated'.

ZPB1.6 (Root)

ZPB1.7 (EXtension)

ZPB2.8 (Root)

ZPB2.9 (EXtension)

ZPB3.12 (EXtension)

1Pop
code : (HealthcareProviderRoleType)

Business name: Provider Type

A coded value indicating the professional category of a provider. This is usually the discipline of the provider (e.g. physician, pharmacist, dentist, etc).

Necessary for ascertaining providers' ability/competence in providing different types of health services.

0-1Req

COCT_MT090107CA.LicensedEntity

Business name: has

A legal permission to provide healthcare of a particular type in a particular jurisdiction.

Important to evaluating permissions.

classCode : "LIC" (RoleClass)1Mand
id : II

Business name: D:Provider License Number

The identifier of a professional license issued to the provider by a licensing body.

If a provider possesses multiple licenses, this is the license that applies to the current action.

Allows providers to verify/ascertain authority for clinical services.

License Number

COCT_MT090107CA.Person

determinerCode : "INSTANCE" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
name : PN.BASIC

Business name: B:Provider Name

The name by which the provider is known (e.g. the Prescriber on a new prescription).

Used when contacting the provider. Also used by others to recognize a provider and then evaluate the information provided by a particular provider. This is the one piece of provider information which should always be known and is therefore mandatory.

COCT_MT090302CA

COCT_MT090302CA.AssignedDevice

An identification of a system/application that can initiate an event to change the status of an object.

Allows an application to be uniquely identified.

Business name: C:Application Id

Unique identifier of an application or a system.

To uniquely identify an application/system.

Attribute is mandatory to allow for distinguishing different applications/systems.

COCT_MT090310CA

COCT_MT090310CA.AssignedDevice

Business name: EHR Repository

Identification of the EHR infostructure responsible for the storage and management of the record

Provides context about the record and its management.

classCode : "ASSIGNED" (RoleClass)1Mand
assignedRepositoryLocation : RepositoryLocation1Mand
representedRepositoryJurisdiction : RepositoryJurisdiction1Mand
COCT_MT090310CA.RepositoryJurisdiction
classCode : "STATE" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "INSTANCE" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
name :

Business name: Repository Jurisdiction Name

The name of the jurisdiction that is responsible for the EHR infostructure that contains and manages the record.

Establishes business context for determining custodianship, and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
COCT_MT090310CA.RepositoryLocation
classCode : "ENT" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "INSTANCE" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
name :

Business name: Repository Name

The name of the repository which is responsible for maintaining the record. E.g. "Ontario Health Respository #3"

Provides a human-readable name for the repository and is therefore mandatory

1Mand
telecom : TEL.URI

Business name: Repository URL

Identification of the electronic address for reaching the repository where the event is stored.

Allows direct access to the repository and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
 
 

COCT_MT120600CA

COCT_MT120600CA.Annotation

Business name: Notes

This is a list of comments made about the record by providers. Information captured here includes the provider making the comments; and excludes information that would render the record invalid. This information will only be seen when another provider reviews the record. Urgent or targeted messages should be sent using a different mechanism (e.g. phone).

Allows various Providers to attach comments to an existing record, and thus improving cross-provider communications.

Public Health requires all clinical notes to be 'verified' by a responsible party if not created by physician in charge. This model conveys the correct semantics, but is inconsistent with other uses of "author" participation in POIZ models. Any changes here will have to be reconciled with other projects using this same cmet.

classCode : "ACT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
text :

Business name: Note Text

Free text comments. Additional textual iinformation entered about an object.

Allows a provider to attach comments to objects for communication. This attribute is mandatory because there's no point in having a note class unless there's actually content in the note.

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
languageCode : (HumanLanguage)

Business name: Written in

A coded value denoting the language in which the note is written.

Allows providers to write notes in the language of their choice.

This attribute is marked as 'populated' because the language of the note must always be known/available or a null flavor must be specified.

1Pop
author : Author1Mand
COCT_MT120600CA.Author

Business name: *annotated by

Identifies the provider responsible for the content of the note.

Allows tracking of who made what comment. This attribute is marked as 'mandatory' because the provider posting a comment must always be known.

Possible RIM issue: the use of author participation in this model is inconsistent with author participations used in other models, e.g author participation in Immunization event model (POIZ_MT030050CA).

typeCode : "AUT" (ParticipationType)1Mand
time : TS.FULLDATETIME

Business name: Note Timestamp

The date and time at which the note was posted.

Identifies timing of the annotation for sorting and for audit purposes.

This attribute is mandatory because the time of creation of the annotation will always be known.

1Mand
assignedPerson : AssignedPerson1Mand
 
 

COCT_MT130001CA

COCT_MT130001CA.Author3

Business name: *changed by

Identity of the health service provider responsible for the change.

In an EHR integrated health services environment, it is important that other providers are able to query who is responsible for a given change. Also used by applications for auditing and sorting. The attribute is mandatory because the responsible provider should always be known.

typeCode : "AUT" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AP" (ContextControl)1Mand
time : TS.FULLDATETIME

Business name: Change Datetime

The date on which the change was made. Note that this may be earlier or occassionally later than when the change is actually effective.

Gives other providers the frame of reference in evaluating any post-change issues with the event. Also used for sorting and audit purposes. Time of change is always known and thus the attribute is mandatory.

1Mand
assignedPerson : AssignedPerson1Mand
COCT_MT130001CA.ControlActEvent

Business name: Version Information

This records the history of changes that have been made to the record, including why the changes were made, who made them and when.

Provides a record changes, providing deeper clinical understanding, particularly of past clinical decisions.

classCode : "CACT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: B:Change Identifier

A unique identifier for this particular change.

Allows referencing (and potentially undoing) a specific change. Every status change has an identifier, thus this attribute is mandatory.

1Mand
code : (HL7TriggerEventCode)

Business name: A:Change Type

Identifies what kind of change occurred.

This attribute is mandatory to ensure that change types are distinguishable.

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: C:Change Effective Date and End Date

The date on which the various changes of an event become valid and applicable and potentially when the change is supposed to cease.

Allows applications to sort and filter by time. The date on which a change is effective should always be known and thus is mandatory. The end date may be left unspecified if there isn't a specific targetted end date (e.g. with a suspend including a planned release date).

1Mand
reasonCode : (ControlActReason)

Business name: D:Change Reason

Denotes the reason the record was modified.

Ensures consistent terminology in capturing and interpreting reasons for change. Allows CWE because not all reasons will correspond to a pre-defined code.

0-1Req
author : Author31Mand
 
 

COCT_MT141007CA

COCT_MT141007CA.ClinicalDevice

Business name: Device

A catalog of devices (manufactured material) from which devices may be selected for prescribing/dispensing.

Provides a list of devices available for prescribing/dispensing.

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

classCode : "DEV" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "KIND" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
code : (ClinicalDeviceEntity)

Business name: A:Device Code

An identifier for a type of device.

Used to ensure clear communication by uniquely identifying a particular device product when prescribing or dispensing. This attribute is only marked as 'populated' because some devices will not have codes associated with them.

1Pop
name :

Business name: B:Device Name

The name assigned to a type of device.

First occurrence is preferred for display.

Names are used for human reference communication, to allow selection from dropdowns and for local searching. If a code is available, the name acts as a cross-check. If the code is not available the name acts as the primary identifier. The attribute is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
desc :

Business name: C:Device Description

A free form textual description of a device and its characteristics (e.g. size, shape, etc.). This is used when additional information must be conveyed that is not apparent by just specifying code and name.

Allows description of characteristics of the device not necessarily conveyed by the code or name.

0-1Req
asContent : Content0-1Req
COCT_MT141007CA.Content

Business name: packaged in

Information about how the device is packaged.

May influence prescribing quantities.

classCode : "CONT" (RoleClass)1Mand
quantity : INT.POS

Business name: F:Device Package Quantity

The quantity of devices contained in the package given or to be given to the patient.

Sometimes ordering and dispensing is by package rather than individual units, and package is important in calculating total amount supplied.

Attribute is marked as "mandatory" to ensure that quantity in a package is always known.

1Mand
containerPackagedDevice : PackagedDevice1Mand
COCT_MT141007CA.ManufacturedProduct

Business name: Device Product

A medical device product intended to be supplied and/or used by a patient. Encompasses supplies, aids, etc.

Allows devices to be clearly described and referenced. Also allows searching for and examining information about devices that can be or are being used by a patient.

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

classCode : "MANU" (RoleClass)1Mand
manufacturedClinicalDevice : ClinicalDevice1Mand
COCT_MT141007CA.PackagedDevice

Business name: Device Package

Describes the container in which a device can be or should be provided to the patient.

Used for informing dispenser of the need and authorization to dispense device in a clinically approved container. Aids patients in adhering to usage instructions. May also influence the quantity prescribed.

The empty class is mandatory for HL7 alignment and modeling reasons.

classCode : "CONT" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "KIND" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
 
 

COCT_MT220100CA

COCT_MT220100CA.Content

Business name: dispensed in

Information about how the dispensed drug is or should be contained

May influence prescribing quantities, and also allows conveying instructions with respect to special packaging such as compliance packaging.

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

Must specify at least one of Drug Package quantity and Drug Container Type

classCode : "CONT" (RoleClass)1Mand
quantity : PQ.DRUG

Business name: F:Drug Package Quantity

The quantity of the medication dosage form contained in the package given or to be given to the patient.

Sometimes ordering and dispensing is by package rather than individual units, and package is important in calculating total amount supplied.

ZDP.10.2.2

ZDP.9.2.2

0-1Req
containerPackagedMedicine : PackagedMedicine0-1Req
COCT_MT220100CA.Ingredient

Business name: drug contains

Identification of which ingredients are contained (or are not contained) in a drug, along with their respective quantities.

Useful to providers in deciding appropriate use instruction (dosage specification) for patients. Also important in checking for potential adverse reactions to non-active ingredients. For compounds, allows contraindication checking against ingredients of custom compounds.

classCode : "INGR" (RoleClass)1Mand
negationInd :

Business name: D:Drug Does Not Contain Indicator

An indication that a drug does not contain the specified ingredient (active or inactive).

Useful for filtering searches. Allows providers to search for drugs not containing a specific active ingredients or excipients. E.g. lactose-free, gluten-free, etc.

The attribute is 'mandatory' because the distinction between "does/must contain" and "does/must not contain" is essential.

1Mand
quantity : PQ.DRUG

Business name: C:Drug Ingredient Quantity

The quantity of the ingredient in a drug. This is represented/measured in various forms/units including: mg, mg/vol, %, etc.

Essential for evaluating appropriate dosage based on strength, as well as for creating custom compounds with proper composition.

CompoundIngredient.amount(numerator)

CompoundIngredient.proportionOfFinal(e.g. 10% = .1mg/1mg)

ZPC.4(quantity)

ZPC.5(unit)

ZPJ1.4(quantity)

ZPJ1.5(unit)

ZPJ1.6(e.g. 10% = .1mg/1mg)

ZCP.3

ZDU.4.3

ZDU.6.1.2

Compound.448-ED (quantity)

Compound.451-EG (unit)

0-1Req
ingredient : Substance1Mand
COCT_MT220100CA.Medication

Business name: Drug Product

A pharmaceutical product intended to be supplied and/or administered to a patient. Encompasses manufactured drug products, generic classifications, prescription medications, over-the-counter medications and recreational drugs.

Allows drugs to be clearly described and referenced. Also allows searching for and examining information about medications that can be or are being used by a patient.

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

classCode : "MED" (RoleClass)1Mand
player : Medicine1Mand
COCT_MT220100CA.Medicine

Business name: Drug or Compound

A catalog of drugs (manufactured material) from which drugs may be selected for prescribing/dispensing. This includes: TC - Therapeutic Class; GD - Generic Drug; GF - Generic Formulation; MD - Manufactured Drug; and CMP - Compound

Provides a list of drugs available for prescribing/dispensing.

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

classCode : "MMAT" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "KIND" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
code : CD (ClinicalDrug)

Business name: A:Drug Code

An identifier for a type of drug. Depending on where the drug is being referenced, the drug may be identified at different levels of abstraction. E.g. Manufactured drug (including vaccines), generic formulation, generic, therapeutic class, etc.

Used to ensure clear communication by uniquely identifying a particular drug product when prescribing or dispensing. This attribute is only marked as 'populated' because some custom compounds will not have unique identifiers Datatype is CD to support SNOMED CT(R) as well as translation between multiple code sets for drugs (e.g. DIN, GTIN, UPC).

DrugProduct.activeIngredientId

DrugProduct.ActiveIngredientGroupNumber

DrugProduct.DIN

DrugProduct.StandardProductId (Mnemonic)

DrugProduct.StandardIDType(Code System)

D56(use code system to distinguish different types)

ZPB2.1

ZPB3.1

ZPC.1

ZPC1.3

ZPD.1

ZPD1.1

ZPD.6(scoping a specialized kind of therapeutic equivalent)

MB.05.03B

ZPS.11

ZDP.3a(code system)

ZDU.4.1

ZDP.7

DRU.010-03(mnemonic)

DRU.010-04(code system)

DRU.010-08(mnemonic)

DRU.010-09(code system)

DRU.100-04 (mnemonic)

DRU.100-05 (code system)

Compound.488-RE (code system)

Compound.489-TE (mnemonic)

DUR/PPS.475-J9 (code system)

DUR/PPS.476-H6 (mnemonic)

Claim.436-E1 (code system)

Claim.407-D7 (mnemonic)

Claim.453-EJ (code system)

Claim.445-EA (mnemonic)

Claim.406-D6 (determined from code system)

RXA.5

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

1Pop
name :

Business name: B:Drug Name

The name assigned to a drug.

First occurrence is preferred for display.

Names are used for human reference communication, to allow selection from dropdowns and for local searching. If a code is available, the name acts as a cross-check. If the code is not available the name acts as the primary identifier. The attribute is therefore mandatory.

DrugProduct.Name (Search)

CoumpoundDrugProduct.name

Contraindication.interactingDrugName

DrugProduct.labelName(useCode=L)

ZPB2.2

ZPB3.2

ZPC.2

ZPD.2

ZPD1.2

ZPD.5

MB.01.03

Drug Name

ZDU.4.2

ZDU.6.1.1

DRU.010-02

RXA.TradeName

DRU.010-10->12

Brand Name

C.1a

Trade Name

Other Name

1Mand
desc :

Business name: C:Drug Description

A free form textual description of a drug. This usually is only populated for custom compounds, providing instructions on the composition and creation of the compound.

Allows description of compound ingredients and/or recipe in free text form.

DrugProduct.description

CompoundedDrugProduct.adhocSpecification

DRU.010-06

DIN Description

0-1Req
formCode : (OrderableDrugForm)

Business name: D:Drug Form

Indicates the form in which the drug product must be, or has been manufactured or custom prepared.

Must be recorded if the Drug Id does not specify the Drug Form.

Provides a constrained vocabulary for describing dose forms. The form of the drug influences how it can be used by the patient.

Prescription.dosageForm

DrugProduct.dosageForm

CompoundedDrugProduct.dosageForm

DispensedItem.dosageForm

D63

ZPC.3

ZPD.3

Drug form

ZDP.14.1

ZDP.3b

DRU.010-05

Compound.450-EF

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

Dosage Form

Dosage Form

0-1Req
asContent : Content0-1Req
ingredient : Ingredient0-50Req
COCT_MT220100CA.PackagedMedicine

Business name: Drug Package

Describes the container in which a drug product can be or should be provided to the patient.

Aids patients in adhering to administration instructions (e.g. snap caps). May also influence the quantity prescribed.

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

classCode : "CONT" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "KIND" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
formCode : (CompliancePackageEntityType)

Business name: Drug Container Type

A coded value denoting a specific kind of a container. Used to identify a requirement for a particular type of compliance packaging

Many insurance plans require that a prescriber specifically authorize the use of compliance packaging before it will be covered by the plan.

1Mand
COCT_MT220100CA.Substance

Business name: Drug Ingredients

A list of drugs, chemicals or excipients that may or may not be present in a manufactured drug or a custom compound.

Important for expressing strength of active ingredients within a drug product, for expressing compound recipes, and for identifying potential causes for adverse reactions.

Must specify at least one of Drug Ingredient Identifier and Drug Ingredient Name

classCode : "MMAT" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "KIND" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
code : (ActiveIngredientDrugEntityType)

Business name: A:Drug Ingredient Identifier

The unique identifier for the drug or chemical.

Allows un-ambiguous identification of the ingredients of a drug for performing various alert checking.

Also allows for the identification of antigens as class of ingredients in a vaccine.

CompoundIngredient.IngredientDrug.activeIngredientCode

CompoundIngredient.IngredientDrug.DIN

CompoundIngredient.IngredientDrug.hcAigNumber

CompoundIngredient.IngredientDrug.standardProductId(mnemonic)

CompoundIngredient.IngredientDrug.standardProductIdType(code system)

ZPB3.6(mnemonic)

ZPB3.7(print name)

ZPJ1.1(mnemonic)

ZPJ1.2(print name)

ZCP.2

0-1Req
name :

Business name: B:Drug Ingredient Name

The name of the contained drug or chemical.

Used for communication between and display to providers.

CompoundIngredient.IngredientDrug.drugProductName

0-1Req
 
 

COCT_MT220110CA

COCT_MT220110CA.Content

Business name: dispensed in

Information about how the dispensed drug is or should be contained

May influence prescribing quantities, and also allows conveying instructions with respect to special packaging such as compliance packaging.

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

Must specify at least one of Drug Package quantity and Drug Container Type;

classCode : "CONT" (RoleClass)1Mand
quantity : PQ.DRUG

Business name: F:Drug Package Quantity

The quantity of the medication dosage form contained in the package given or to be given to the patient.

Sometimes ordering and dispensing is by package rather than individual units, and package is important in calculating total amount supplied.

ZDP.10.2.2

ZDP.9.2.2

0-1Req
containerPackagedMedicine : PackagedMedicine0-1Req
COCT_MT220110CA.Ingredient

Business name: drug contains

Identification of which ingredients are contained (or are not contained) in a drug, along with their respective quantities.

Useful to providers in deciding appropriate use instruction (dosage specification) for patients. Also important in checking for potential adverse reactions to non-active ingredients. For compounds, allows contraindication checking against ingredients of custom compounds.

classCode : "INGR" (RoleClass)1Mand
negationInd :

Business name: D:Drug Does Not Contain Indicator

An indication that a drug does not contain the specified ingredient (active or inactive).

Useful for filtering searches. Allows providers to search for drugs not containing a specific active ingredients or excipients. E.g. lactose-free, gluten-free, etc.

The attribute is 'populated' because the distinction between "does/must contain" and "does/must not contain" is essential, however in some circumstances it is necessary to say "may contain".

1Pop
quantity : PQ.DRUG

Business name: C:Drug Ingredient Quantity

The quantity of the ingredient in a drug. This is represented/measured in various forms/units including: mg, mg/vol, %, etc.

Essential for evaluating appropriate dosage based on strength, as well as for creating custom compounds with proper composition.

CompoundIngredient.amount(numerator)

CompoundIngredient.proportionOfFinal(e.g. 10% = .1mg/1mg)

ZPC.4(quantity)

ZPC.5(unit)

ZPJ1.4(quantity)

ZPJ1.5(unit)

ZPJ1.6(e.g. 10% = .1mg/1mg)

ZCP.3

ZDU.4.3

ZDU.6.1.2

Compound.448-ED (quantity)

Compound.451-EG (unit)

0-1Req
ingredient : Substance1Mand
COCT_MT220110CA.ManufacturedProduct

Business name: manufactured by

Associates a drug product with the organization responsible for producing it.

May be important for tracing adverse events and for performing drug searches.

classCode : "MANU" (RoleClass)1Mand
manufacturer : Manufacturer1Mand
COCT_MT220110CA.Manufacturer

Business name: Manufacturer

Identity of the organization that manufactured the drug product.

Useful in distinguishing and grouping drug products

classCode : "ORG" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "INSTANCE" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
id : II

Business name: Manufacturer Id

An identifier denoting a specific drug manufacturer.

Allows sending of identifiers in place of manufacturer name. May be used in drug search where specific manufacturer is a criterion.

0-1Req
name :

Business name: Manufacturer Name

The name of the drug manufacturer.

Used for reporting.

The attribute is marked as "mandatory" because there will always be a name for an organization.

1Mand
COCT_MT220110CA.Medication

Business name: Drug Product

A pharmaceutical product intended to be supplied and/or administered to a patient. Encompasses manufactured drug products, generic classifications, prescription medications, over-the-counter medications and recreational drugs.

Allows drugs to be clearly described and referenced. Also allows searching for and examining information about medications that can be or are being used by a patient.

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

classCode : "MED" (RoleClass)1Mand
player : Medicine1Mand
COCT_MT220110CA.Medicine

Business name: Drug or Compound

A catalog of drugs (manufactured material) from which drugs may be selected for prescribing/dispensing. This includes: TC - Therapeutic Class; GD - Generic Drug; GF - Generic Formulation; MD - Manufactured Drug; and CMP - Compound

Provides a list of drugs available for prescribing/dispensing.

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

classCode : "MMAT" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "KIND" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
code : CD (ClinicalDrug)

Business name: A:Drug Code

An identifier for a type of drug. Depending on where the drug is being referenced, the drug may be identified at different levels of abstraction. E.g. Manufactured drug (including vaccines), generic formulation, generic, therapeutic class, etc.

Used to ensure clear communication by uniquely identifying a particular drug product when prescribing or dispensing. This attribute is only marked as 'populated' because some custom compounds will not have unique identifiers Datatype is CD to support SNOMED CT(R) as well as translation between multiple code sets for drugs (e.g. DIN, GTIN, UPC).

COCT_MT220200CA.Medication

Business name: Drug Product

A pharmaceutical product to be supplied and/or administered to a patient. Encompasses manufactured drug products, generic classifications, prescription medications, over-the-counter medications and recreational drugs.

Allows drugs to be clearly described and referenced. Also allows searching for and examining information about medications that can be or are being used by a patient.

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

classCode : "MED" (RoleClass)1Mand
player : Medicine1Mand
COCT_MT220200CA.Medicine

Business name: Drug or Compound

A catalog of drugs (manufactured material) from which drugs may be selected for prescribing/dispensing. This includes pre-manufactured drug products and previously prepared compounds.

Provides a list of drugs available for dispensing.

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

classCode : "MMAT" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "KIND" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
code : CE (ManufacturedDrug)

Business name: A:Drug Code

An identifier for a type of drug. Depending on where the drug is being referenced, the drug may be identified at different levels of abstraction. E.g. Manufactured drug (including vaccine).

Used to ensure clear communication by uniquely identifying a particular drug product when prescribing or dispensing. This attribute is only marked as 'populated' because some custom compounds will not have unique identifiers. Datatype has been retained as CE (Translatable Code) to support translation between multiple code sets for drugs (e.g. DIN, GTIN, UPC).

DrugProduct.ActiveIngredientGroupNumber

Compound.450-EF

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

Dosage Form

Dosage Form

0-1Req
lotNumberText :

Business name: E:Drug Lot Number

Identification of a batch in which a specific manufactured drug belongs.

Useful in tracking for recalls but may not always exist.

X0301

RXA.15

C.6

0-1Req
expirationTime : IVL.HIGH<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: F:Drug Expiry Date

Indicates either the length of time a drug product can remain viable (when talking about a drug in general terms), or the date on which the drug product is no longer considered viable (when talking about a specific medication that has been dispensed).

To indicate the length of time after opening a product remains viable, specify the 'Width' property. To indicate a specific end date for an actual dispensed product, specify the 'High' property

The potency, effectiveness and safety of drug products changes over time. When determining quantities to be supplied to a patient, one of the considerations is how long the drug will remain viable.

DispensedItem.expiryDate

Drug Expiry Date

C7

0-1Req
asContent : Content0-1Req
ingredient : Ingredient0-50Req
COCT_MT220200CA.PackagedMedicine

quantity : PQ.DRUG

Business name: C:Drug Ingredient Quantity

The quantity of the ingredient in a drug. This is represented/measured in various forms/units including: mg, mg/vol, %, etc.

Essential for evaluating appropriate dosage based on strength, as well as for creating custom compounds with proper composition.

CompoundIngredient.amount(numerator)

CompoundIngredient.proportionOfFinal(e.g. 10% = .1mg/1mg)

ZPC.4(quantity)

ZPC.5(unit)

ZPJ1.4(quantity)

ZPJ1.5(unit)

ZPJ1.6(e.g. 10% = .1mg/1mg)

ZCP.3

ZDU.4.3

ZDU.6.1.2

Compound.448-ED (quantity)

Compound.451-EG (unit)

0-1Req
ingredient : Substance1Pop
COCT_MT220210CA.ManufacturedProduct

Business name: manufactured by

Associates a drug product with the organization responsible for producing it.

May be important for tracing adverse events and for performing drug searches.

classCode : "MANU" (RoleClass)1Mand
manufacturer : Manufacturer1Mand
COCT_MT220210CA.Manufacturer

Business name: Manufacturer

Identity of the organization that manufactured the drug product.

Useful in distinguishing and grouping drug products

classCode : "ORG" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "INSTANCE" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
id : II

Business name: Manufacturer Id

An identifier denoting a specific drug manufacturer.

Allows sending of identifiers in place of manufacturer name. May be used in drug search where specific manufacturer is a criterion.

0-1Req
name :

Business name: Manufacturer Name

The name of the drug manufacturer.

Used in reporting.

The attribute is marked as "mandatory" because there will always be a name for an organization.

1Mand
COCT_MT220210CA.Medication

Business name: Drug Product

A pharmaceutical product to be supplied and/or administered to a patient. Encompasses manufactured drug products, generic classifications, prescription medications, over-the-counter medications and recreational drugs.

Allows drugs to be clearly described and referenced. Also allows searching for and examining information about medications that can be or are being used by a patient.

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

classCode : "MED" (RoleClass)1Mand
player : Medicine1Mand
COCT_MT220210CA.Medicine

Business name: Drug or Compound

classCode : "MMAT" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "KIND" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
code : CE (ManufacturedDrug)

Business name: A:Drug Code

An identifier for a type of drug. Depending on where the drug is being referenced, the drug may be identified at different levels of abstraction. E.g. Manufactured drug (including vaccine).

Used to ensure clear communication by uniquely identifying a particular drug product when prescribing or dispensing. This attribute is only marked as 'populated' because some custom compounds will not have unique identifiers. Datatype has been retained as CE (Translatable Code) to support translation between multiple code sets for drugs (e.g. DIN, GTIN, UPC).

DrugProduct.activeIngredientId

DrugProduct.ActiveIngredientGroupNumber

DrugProduct.DIN

DrugProduct.StandardProductId (Mnemonic)

DrugProduct.StandardIDType(Code System)

D56(use code system to distinguish different types)

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

1Pop
name :

Business name: B:Drug Name

The name assigned to a drug.

First occurrence is preferred for display.

Names are used for human reference communication, to allow selection from dropdowns and for local searching. If a code is available, the name acts as a cross-check. If the code is not available the name acts as the primary identifier. The attribute is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
desc :

Business name: C:Drug Description

A free form textual description of a drug. This usually is only populated for custom compounds, providing instructions on the composition and creation of the compound.

Allows description of compound ingredients and/or recipe in free text form.

DrugProduct.description

CompoundedDrugProduct.adhocSpecification

DRU.010-06

0-1Req
formCode : (OrderableDrugForm)

Business name: D:Drug Form

Indicates the form in which the drug product must be, or has been manufactured or custom prepared.

Must be populated if the Drug Id does not specify the Drug Form.

Provides a constrained vocabulary for describing dose forms. The form of the drug influences how it can be used by the patient.

Prescription.dosageForm

Dosage Form

Dosage Form

0-1Req
lotNumberText :

Business name: E:Drug Lot Number

Identification of a batch in which a specific manufactured drug belongs.

Useful in tracking for recalls but may not always exist.

X0301

RXA.15

C.6

0-1Req
expirationTime : IVL.HIGH<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: F:Drug Expiry Date

Indicates either the length of time a drug product can remain viable (when talking about a drug in general terms), or the date on which the drug product is no longer considered viable (when talking about a specific medication that has been dispensed).

To indicate the length of time after opening a product remains viable, specify the 'Width' property. To indicate a specific end date for an actual dispensed product, specify the 'High' property

The potency, effectiveness and safety of drug products changes over time. When determining quantities to be supplied to a patient, one of the considerations is how long the drug will remain viable.

DispensedItem.expiryDate

Drug Expiry Date

C7

0-1Req
asManufacturedProduct : ManufacturedProduct0-1Req
asContent : Content0-1Req
ingredient : Ingredient0-50Req
COCT_MT220210CA.PackagedMedicine

Business name: Drug Package

Describes the container in which a drug product can be or should be provided to the patient.

Aids patients in adhering to administration instructions (e.g. snap caps). May also influence the quantity prescribed.

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

classCode : "CONT" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "KIND" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
formCode : (CompliancePackageEntityType)

Business name: A:Drug Container Type

A coded value denoting a specific kind of a container. Used to identify a requirement for a particular type of compliance packaging

Many insurance plans require that a prescriber specifically authorize the use of compliance packaging before it will be covered by the plan.

1Mand
COCT_MT220210CA.Substance

Business name: Drug Ingredients

A list of drugs, chemicals or excipients that may or may not be present in a manufactured drug or a custom compound.

Important for expressing strength of active ingredients within a drug product, for expressing compound recipes, and for identifying potential causes for adverse reactions.

Must specify at least one of Drug Ingredient Identifier and Drug Ingredient Name

classCode : "MMAT" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "KIND" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
code : (ActiveIngredientDrugEntityType)

Business name: A:Drug Ingredient Identifier

The unique identifier for the drug or chemical.

Allows un-ambiguous identification of the ingredients of a drug for performing various alert checking.

Also allows for the identification of antigens as specific class of ingredients in vaccines.

CompoundIngredient.IngredientDrug.activeIngredientCode

CompoundIngredient.IngredientDrug.DIN

Used for communication between and display to providers.

COCT_MT240003CA

COCT_MT240003CA.Place
classCode : "PLC" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "INSTANCE" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
name :

Business name: B:Service Location Name

The name assigned to the service location.

Used for human communication, and for cross-checking of location Id and is therefore mandatory

PVD.070

Dispensing Pharmacy Name

Facility.name

1Mand
COCT_MT240003CA.ServiceDeliveryLocation

Business name: Service Location

An identification of a service location (or facility) where health service has been or can be delivered. E.g. Pharmacy, Medical Clinic, Hospital

Used for tracking service delivery responsibility, to provide contact information for follow-up and for statistical analysis. Also important for indicating where paper records can be located.

classCode : "SDLOC" (RoleClass)1Mand
id : II

Business name: C:Service Location Id

Unique identifier for a healthcare service location.

Allows for lookup and retrieval of detailed information about a specific service location. Also ensures unique identification of service location and is therefore mandatory.

The identifier is mandatory because it is the principal mechanism for uniquely identifying the facility.

PVD.020-01 (extension)

PVD.020-02 (root)

Dispensing Pharmacy number

Pharmacy Identifier

Facility.facilityKey

DispensedItem.facilityKey

1Mand
addr : AD.BASIC

Business name: D:Service Location Address

The information by which a service location may be contacted either physically or by mail.

Identifies the physical location of a service location and also allows for the location to be contacted.

The address is marked as 'populated' because it is considered a critical piece of information about the facility, but may not always be available or meaningful.

1Pop
telecom : SET<TEL.PHONEMAIL>

Business name: E:Service Location Phones and E-mails

The phone numbers and/or electronic mail addresses by which a service location may be contacted.

Allows a service location to be communicated with and is therefore important. Because a contact number won't always exist, the field is marked 'populated'.

1-5Pop
location : Place1Mand
 
 

COCT_MT470000CA

COCT_MT470000CA.ActDefinition
classCode : "ACT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "DEF" (ActMood)1Mand
code : (ActInformationAccessTypeCode)

Business name: B:Consent Information Types

The type of patient information that can be accessed or modified.

Different consents (or even keywords) may be needed to access different types of patient information (e.g. demographics, medications, allergies, lab results). Understanding the type of information the consent applies to is critical, and therefore the attribute is mandatory.

1Mand
COCT_MT470000CA.Author

Business name: b:consented to by

Indicates that the consent was provided by the patient or representative.

Consent can be provided by the patient or representative or the provider.

Authorization.Person

Authorization.signatory(PT)

typeCode : "AUT" (ParticipationType)1Mand
modeCode : (x_PhysicalVerbalParticipationMode)

Business name: Patient Consent Mechanism

Indicates whether the patient's consent is written or verbal.

Verbal consents may trigger a higher level of auditing.

0-1Req
signatureText :

Business name: Keyword

Indicates the keyword appropriate to the action being performed by the message.

Allows providers who know the keyword to access information protected by patient keywords.

0-1Req
Choice: consenter : Consenter1Pop
 »»  patient : Patient0-1Opt
 »»  responsibleParty : ResponsibleParty0-1Opt
COCT_MT470000CA.Author2

Business name: c:consent overridden by

Indicates that information access was approved by a provider rather than a patient. I.e. This is an override rather than an actual consent, and is used for the purposes of 'breaking the glass' only.

Clinical circumstances may demand that a patient's information be accessed without consent to ensure patient safety.

Authorization.signatory(PROV)

typeCode : "AUT" (ParticipationType)1Mand
assignedPerson : AssignedPerson1Pop
COCT_MT470000CA.ConsentEvent

Business name: Consent

Information pertaining to a patient's agreement/acceptance to have his/her clinical information electronically stored and shared.

The keywords will not be passed from prescriber to dispenser by the DIS.

Provides authorization to record and/or view patient information.

Indicates the consent or keyword used to authorize access or update, including a reason for access; May also be used to override access restriction to the information ('break the glass') on a message by message basis. May be required on a Prescription Request to indicate a keyword for DUR processing.

One and only one of author2 (Consenter) and author1 (Provider) must be specified.

If author1 (provider) is specified, reason code must be specified.

classCode : "CONS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: D:Consent Form Number

A unique identifier for a specific consent for a patient.

Provides a traceable audit link between a physical consent form and its electronic record

Authorization.formNumber

0-1Req
code : "INF" (ActCode)

Authorization.dataType

1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: C:Consent Effective and End Time

Indicates the time that the consent will expire. 'Low' is effective time and 'High' is end time.

Most consents are not open-ended, to ensure the patient retains a level of control.

Authorization.endTime (high)

0-1Req
reasonCode : (ActConsentInformationAccessReason)

Business name: E:Consent Override Reason

Indicates a reason for overriding a patient's consent rules.

Important for audit purposes

Authorization.reason (mnemonic)

Authorization.comment (original text)

0-1Req
subject1 : Subject1Mand
author1 : Author20-1Req
author2 : Author0-1Req
subject2 : Subject21Mand

Indicates that the consent or keyword has been provided by the patient themselves (rather than a representative.)

Distinguishing whether consent is granted by the patient or a representative can be important for audit purposes.

classCode : "PAT" (RoleClass)1Mand

COMT_MT300001CA

COMT_MT300001CA.Annotation

Business name: Comment

Identifies the comments to be recorded against a Patient's record.

Allows comments to be attached to a Patient record. A Patient record can pertain to demographic or clinical (Drug, Condition, Lab, DI, Immunization, etc) information.

classCode : "ACT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : (ActPatientAnnotationCode)

Business name: Patient Note Category

A coded value denoting the category of note being attached to a Patient's record. Categories of note include: General, Medication, Lab, DI, Immunization, etc

Allows patient notes of different purposes and use, to be attached to a patient. Attribute is mandatory to ensure that patient notes are categorized accordingly. This attribute may also be used by DISs to enforce different access control to different types of notes.

1Mand
text :

Business name: C:Patient Note Text

Free textual description of the patient note.

Allows a provider to attach comments to a patient as a whole or to the patient's profile (such as medication, lab. DI, etc). This attribute is mandatory because there's no point in having a patient note unless there's actually content in the note.

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
recordTarget : RecordTarget1Mand
COMT_MT300001CA.RecordTarget

Business name: *comment pertains to

Identity of the Patient to which the note pertains.

This relationship is mandatory because the Patient must first be identified before any annotation is applied to the patient's record.

typeCode : "RCT" (ParticipationType)1Mand
patient : Patient1Mand
 
 

COMT_MT300002CA

COMT_MT300002CA.ParameterList

Business name: Generic Query Parameters

Defines the set of parameters that may be used to filter the query response.

Root class for query definition

patientBirthDate : PatientBirthDate1Mand
patientGender : PatientGender1Mand
patientID : PatientID1Mand
patientName : PatientName1Mand
patientNoteCategoryCode : PatientNoteCategoryCode0-1Req
COMT_MT300002CA.PatientBirthDate
value : TS.DATE

Business name: Patient Birth Date

Indicates the date on which the patient was born.

Used to confirm the identity of the patient for the query and therefore mandatory.

1Mand
COMT_MT300002CA.PatientGender
value : (AdministrativeGender)

Business name: Patient Gender

Indicates the gender (sex) of the patient.

Used to confirm the identity of the patient for the query and therefore mandatory.

1Mand
COMT_MT300002CA.PatientID
value : II

Business name: B:Patient ID

Identifier of the patient who is the subject of the patient drug contraindication query. Filter the result set to include only those records pertaining to the patient with this Id.

Allows filtering of result set by patient Id. This is a mandatory field because a patient must be specified for the query to be valid

1Mand
COMT_MT300002CA.PatientName
value : PN.BASIC

Business name: C:Patient Name

The name of the patient who is the subject of the drug contraindication query.

Filter the result set to include only those records pertaining to the patient with this name.

Allows filtering of result set by patient name. This is a mandatory field because a patient name must match the patient Id for the query to be valid.

1Mand
COMT_MT300002CA.PatientNoteCategoryCode
value : (ActPatientAnnotationCode)

Business name: Patient Note Category Code

Indicates that the result set is to be filtered to include only those patient annotation pertaining to the specified annotation category.

Valid patient note categories include: General, Medication, Lab, DI, etc.

Allows for the retrieval of all patient notes pertaining to a specific note category.

1Mand
 
 

COMT_MT300003CA

COMT_MT300003CA.Annotation

Business name: Comment

Identifies the comments to be recorded against a Patient's record.

Allows comments to be attached to a Patient record. A Patient record can pertain to demographic or clinical (Drug, Condition, Lab, DI, etc) information.

classCode : "ACT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: B:Patient Note Id

Identifier of the patient note record.

Allows for the unique reference of a patient note and is therefore mandatory.

Allows for referencing of a particular patient note and thus allows for the removal of the note.

1Mand
code : (ActPatientAnnotationCode)

Business name: A:Patient Note Category

A coded value denoting the category of note being attached to a Patient's record. Categories of note include: General, Medication, Lab, DI, etc.

Allows patient notes of different purposes and use, to be attached to a patient. Attribute is mandatory to ensure that patient notes are categorized accordingly. This attribute may also be used by DISs to enforce different access control to different types of notes.

1Mand
text :

Business name: C:Patient Note Text

Free textual description of the patient note.

Allows a provider to attach comments to a patient as a whole or to the patient's profile (such as medication, lab. DI, etc). This attribute is mandatory because there's no point in having a patient note unless there's actually content in the note.

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand

responsibleParty : ResponsibleParty0-1Req
author : Author1Mand
location : Location1Mand
COMT_MT300003CA.Author

Business name: *b:annotated by

Identifier of the provider who created the patient note.

Allows other providers to communicator with the author of the note for follow-up enquiries. The author of an annotation must always be known and is therefore mandatory.

typeCode : "AUT" (ParticipationType)1Mand
time : TS.FULLDATETIME

Business name: B:Patient Note Date

The date on which the patient note was created.

Allows other provider to evaluate the currency of the information contained in the note.

The date of the note creation is always known and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
assignedPerson : AssignedPerson1Mand

Important for performing follow-up and is therefore mandatory.
