COMT_MT400001CA

COMT_MT400001CA.Diagnosis

Business name: Diagnosis

Conveys information about a diagnosis to be masked

Allows masking of items related to a particular medical condition.

If code is SNOMED, value must not be specified. Otherwise value is mandatory and code must be ‘DX’

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN.CRT" (ActMood)1Mand
code : (ActCode)

Business name: A:Diagnosis Type

Used to indicate that this observation is a diagnosis, and for SNOMED, provides details of what the diagnosis is.

Needed to convey the diagnosis information to be masked, and attribute is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
value : (DiagnosisValue)

Business name: B:Diagnosis

The diagnosis whose associated records should be masked.

Allows masking of all records (prescriptions, dispenses, encounters, lab tests, etc.) associated with the specified diagnosis. This element is optional because it is not used for SNOMED.

0-1Opt
COMT_MT400001CA.DirectTarget
typeCode : "DIR" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
role : Role1Pop
COMT_MT400001CA.EntityKind
classCode : "ENT" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "KIND" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
code : (MaskableMaterialEntityType)

Business name: Maskable Material

Indicates the materia (e.g drug) whose associated records should be masked.

Usually specified at the generic or therapeutic-equivalent level to ensure related medications are also covered.

Allows masking a drug, avoiding the requirement to mask each prescription and dispense individually.

1Mand
COMT_MT400001CA.MaskableActType

Business name: Maskable Record

A particular record or type of record for which masking is supported.

The root construct for masking and unmasking specific record or type of record.

classCode : "ACT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVNINT.CRT" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: C:Record Identifier

The identifier of the prescription, dispense, allergy, lab test result or other record for which the masking status is being changed.

In many systems, masking a 'child' may result in automatic masking of the parent. For example, masking a dispense record may cause the prescription to become masked as well.

Allows unique reference to a particular record to be masked or unmasked.

0-1Req
code : (ActInformationCategoryCode)

Business name: B:Record Type

Indicates a detailed type of record to be masked. E.g. All lab tests of a given type.

Allows automatic masking of a particular type of record rather than requiring each occurrence to be masked individually.

0-1Req
confidentialityCode : (x_VeryBasicConfidentialityKind)

Business name: A:Masked Indicator

Indicates the new value for the masking status of the item.

Forces the sender of the message to assert what the new value should be, rather than performing a 'toggle' and potentially ending up in the wrong state. Therefore, the attribute is mandatory.

1Mand
directTarget : DirectTarget0-1Req
recordTarget : RecordTarget1Mand
reason : Reason0-1Req
COMT_MT400001CA.Reason

Business name: has indication

Identifies indications whose associated records should be masked.

Allows for automatic masking of all records associated with a particular indication diagnosis.

typeCode : "RSON" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
diagnosis : Diagnosis1Pop
COMT_MT400001CA.RecordTarget

Business name: *masked for

Indicates the patient whose data is being masked or unmasked.

Essential to targeting the appropriate patient record, and therefore mandatory.

typeCode : "RCT" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "OP" (ContextControl)1Mand
patient : Patient1Mand
COMT_MT400001CA.Role
classCode : "ROL" (RoleClass)1Mand
playingEntityKind : EntityKind1Mand
 
 

COMT_MT500001CA

COMT_MT500001CA.InformEvent

Business name: Broadcast Message

Information being transmitted to proviers as a 'mass broadcast'

Allows conveying information such as stolen prescription pads, system availability information, etc.

classCode : "INFRM" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
text :

Business name: Broadcast Message

Contains the text to be displayed to the user of the system.

Allows conveying of system messages and other types of alerts. E.g. Planned outages, stolen prescription pads, etc.

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
 
 

MCAI_MT700210CA

MCAI_MT700210CA.Author

Business name: a:*created by

Indicates the person responsible for the event that caused this message.

Critical for auditing and for validating permissions and therefore mandatory.

typeCode : "AUT" (ParticipationType)

Value should always be AUT

1Mand
contextControlCode : "AP" (ContextControl)1Mand
time : TS.FULLDATETIME

Business name: D:Time of Creation

The time the person responsible for the event made the decision for it to occur. This may be different than the time the change became effective. (E.g. If a provider decides today to put a prescription on hold starting next Tuesday, the time of creation would be today and the change effective period would be next Tuesday.)

This date can be back-dated.

The time a change is made is a critical piece of audit information and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
modeCode : (ParticipationMode)

Business name: F:Information Received Method

Indicates how the person who recorded the event became aware of it.. E.g. Verbal, written, fax, etc.

May have ramifications for the audit trail and reliability of the information.

0-1Req
signatureText : ED.SIGNATURE

Business name: G:Digital Signature

Indicates the formal digital signature of the message content.

Digital signatures may be needed for authentication of message content. The attribute is marked as optional because it is not yet clear whether there is a use-case for this, or where it will be used.

0-1Opt
assignedPerson : AssignedPerson1Mand
MCAI_MT700210CA.ControlActEvent

Business name: Trigger Event

Identifies the action that resulted in this message being sent.

There may be constraints on the usage of the effectiveTime and reasonCode attributes in the definition of the interaction or the trigger events which are conveyed with this wrapper.

Key to understanding what action a message represents.

classCode : "CACT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: B:Event Identifier

A unique identifier for this particular event assigned by the system in which the event occurred.

Allows the event to be referenced (for undos) and also indicates whether multiple interactions were caused by the same triggering event. The attribute is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
code : (HL7TriggerEventCode)

Business name: A:Event Type

Identifies the trigger event that occurred.

This is mandatory because it is essential to understanding the meaning of the event.

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: C:Event Effective Period

Indicates the time the change should begin (and occasionally when it should end). If not specified, assumption is that the event occurred at the same time the message was constructed.

The time a change becomes effective may differ from the time the event is recorded. (I.e. it may be in the future or the past). For changes such as 'suspend', an intended end date may also be indicated.

0-1Req
reasonCode : (ControlActReason)

Business name: E:Event Reason

Identifies why this specific query, modification request, or modification occurred.

Allows identifying a reason for a specific action, such as 'reason for hold'. Also allows identifying reason for accessing information for a query.

0-1Req
responsibleParty : ResponsibleParty0-1Req
author : Author1Mand
dataEnterer : DataEnterer0-1Req
location : Location1Mand
dataEntryLocation : DataEntryLocation0-1Req
subject : Subject21Mand
subjectOf1 : Subject0-50Req
subjectOf2 : Subject30-1Req
MCAI_MT700210CA.DataEnterer

Business name: b:*entered by

Indicates the person responsible for recording the information into the system.

Used for audit purposes.

Used when different from the person responsible for making the decision.

This should only be specified if different from the author.

Important for audit information and determining permissions.

typeCode : "ENT" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AP" (ContextControl)1Mand
assignedPerson : AssignedPerson1Pop
MCAI_MT700210CA.DataEntryLocation

Business name: *b1:recorded at

Indicates the location where the record of this event was entered into the EHR.

This should only be specified if different from the location where the event was authored.

Indicates a potential location for written records, and may also be important for authentication purposes.

typeCode : "ELOC" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AP" (ContextControl)1Mand
serviceDeliveryLocation : ServiceDeliveryLocation1Pop
MCAI_MT700210CA.Location

Business name: *a1:created at

Indicates the facility where the event occurred.

Indicates where paper records may be located, and may be important to determining authorization. The association is therefore mandatory.

typeCode : "LOC" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AP" (ContextControl)1Mand
serviceDeliveryLocation : ServiceDeliveryLocation1Mand
MCAI_MT700210CA.ResponsibleParty

Business name: supervised by

Identification of the provider who was supervising the actions of the author.

Allows for the trail of responsibility for the action.

typeCode : "RESP" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AP" (ContextControl)1Mand
assignedPerson : AssignedPerson1Pop
MCAI_MT700210CA.Subject

Business name: d:caused

Identifies errors or warnings that were caused by the previous message or that are being managed as part of the current message.

Any trigger event can result in errors or may allow for errors to be overridden or managed.

typeCode : "SUBJ" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AP" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
detectedIssueEvent : DetectedIssueEvent1Pop
MCAI_MT700210CA.Subject2

Business name: f:refers to

Indicates the item(s) being acted upon by this trigger event.

If there are multiple subject items, the changes to all of them must be either accepted or rejected as a single action. I.e. One trigger event = 1 unit of work.

Provides information about the thing being created or modified.

typeCode : "SUBJ" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd :

Business name: Cascade Responsibility Indicator

Indicates whether or not objects of the trigger event are to be cascaded to the payload.

Cascading of trigger event objects allows different messages to employ consistent and common objects.

Attribute is mandatory to ensure that cascading will be specified one way or another.

On ‘creation’ interactions (where the state transition is null->active), this must be true otherwise it must be false.

1Mand
act : 1Mand
MCAI_MT700210CA.Subject3

Business name: c:authorized by

Indicates the consent or keyword used to authorize this access or update.

May also be used to override access to the information ("break the 'glass") on a message by message basis.

This will usually only be populated for queries, but could be used for updates if a jurisdiction requires consent before recording information in the EHR. (E.g. consent to participate in electronic data exchange.)

Important to tracking permission and managing patient consent.

typeCode : "SUBJ" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AP" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
consentEvent : ConsentEvent1Pop
 
 

MCAI_MT700211CA

MCAI_MT700211CA.ControlActEvent

Business name: Trigger Event

Identifies the action that resulted in this message being sent.

There may be constraints on the usage of the effectiveTime and reasonCode attributes in the definition of the interaction or the trigger events which are conveyed with this wrapper.

Key to understanding what action a message represents.

classCode : "CACT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: B:Event Identifier

A unique identifier for this particular event assigned by the system in which the event occurred.

These identifiers should be stored for use in 'retractions'. They should be stored in such a way that they are associated with the item that was modified by this event. For example, a system should be able to show the list of trigger event identifiers for the actions that have been recorded against a particular prescription.

Allows the event to be referenced (for retractions) and also indicates whether multiple interactions were caused by the same triggering event. The attribute is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
code : (HL7TriggerEventCode)

Business name: A:Event Type

Identifies the trigger event that occurred.

This is mandatory because it is essential to understanding the meaning of the event.

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: C:Event Effective Period

Indicates the time the change should begin (and occasionally when it should end). If not specified, assumption is that the event occurred at the same time the message was constructed.

Example use is to record a dispense pickup time on the Rx Pickup Notification interaction. This time may be in the past, but cannot be in the future.

The time a change becomes effective may differ from the time the event is recorded. (I.e. it may be in the future or the past). For changes such as 'suspend', an intended end date may also be indicated.

0-1Req
reasonCode : (ControlActReason)

Business name: E:Event Reason

Identifies why this specific query, modification request, or modification occurred.

The domain associated with this attribute will vary for each interaction and will be noted as part of the interaction description.

Allows identifying a reason for a specific action, such as 'reason for hold'. Also allows identifying reason for accessing information for a query.

0-1Req
subject : Subject21Mand
subjectOf : Subject0-50Req
MCAI_MT700211CA.Subject

Business name: d:caused

Identifies errors or warnings that were caused by the previous message or that are being managed as part of the current message.

Any trigger event can result in errors or may allow for errors to be overridden or managed.

typeCode : "SUBJ" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AP" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
detectedIssueEvent : DetectedIssueEvent1Pop
MCAI_MT700211CA.Subject2

Business name: f:refers to

Indicates the item(s) being acted upon by this trigger event.

If there are multiple subject items, the changes to all of them must be either accepted or rejected as a single action. I.e. One trigger event = 1 unit of work.

Provides information about the thing being created or modified.

typeCode : "SUBJ" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
act : 1Mand

MCCI_MT000100CA

MCCI_MT000100CA.Agent1
classCode : "AGNT" (RoleClass)1Mand
representedOrganization : Organization11Mand
MCCI_MT000100CA.Agent2
classCode : "AGNT" (RoleClass)1Mand
representedOrganization : Organization21Mand
MCCI_MT000100CA.Agent3
classCode : "AGNT" (RoleClass)1Mand
representedOrganization : Organization31Mand
MCCI_MT000100CA.AttentionLine

Business name: Routing Instruction Lines

Provides information on how the message should be routed within the receiving application.

Allows direction of messages within complex applications. This association is optional because not all applications will require this level of routing.

keyWordText :

Business name: A:Routing Type

A particular type of guidance for routing the message.

Allows categorization of routing types or support for multiple route pieces. Mandatory to understand the routing information.

1Mand
value :

Business name: B:Routing Name

Indicates the specific value used to route the item.

Allows internal routing within an application.

0-1Req
MCCI_MT000100CA.Device1
classCode : "DEV" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "INSTANCE" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
id : II

Business name: IA:Sending Application Identifier

The unique identifier of the application or system from where the message is being sent.

Because this is the key identifier of where the message is coming from, this attribute is mandatory.

1Mand
name :

Business name: IE:Sending Application Name

This is the name associated with the system or application sending the message.

Provides useful information when debugging.

0-1Req
desc :

Business name: II:Sending Application Configuration Information

Provides additional information about the configuration of the sending application. Useful when debugging.

Provides additional information that may assist in debugging interactions.

0-1Req
existenceTime : IVL.LOW<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: IH:Sending Application Version Date

Indicates the last time the sending application was modified or reconfigured.

Can help to isolate the source of a problem when debugging.

0-1Req
manufacturerModelName :

Business name: IG:Sending Software Version Number

Indicates the version number of the piece of software used to construct the message.

May be used to filter messages based on the compliance testing of the sending software.

0-1Req
softwareName :

Business name: IF:Sending Application Software Name

Indicates the name of the software used to construct the message.

May be used to filter messages based on sending application compliance testing.

0-1Req
asAgent : Agent10-1Opt
asLocatedEntity : LocatedEntity10-1Opt
MCCI_MT000100CA.Device2
classCode : "DEV" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "INSTANCE" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
id : II

Business name: JA:Receiver Application Identifier

The unique identifier of the application to which the message is being sent.

Used for routing and for verification that "yes, this message is intended for me." This is mandatory because it is the key identifier of the receiving application.

1Mand
asAgent : Agent20-1Opt
asLocatedEntity : LocatedEntity20-1Opt
MCCI_MT000100CA.Device3

Business name: Respond To System

The system to which responses are to be directed.

Provides support for directing responses to applications other than the original sender.

classCode : "DEV" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "INSTANCE" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
id : II

Business name: KA:Respond to Application Identifier

The unique identifier of the applications to which responses should be sent. Only populated when different from the sending application id.

Allows unique identification and routing to the application to be responded to. This attribute is mandatory be cause it is the principal identifier of the application to respond to.

1Mand
asAgent : Agent30-1Opt
asLocatedEntity : LocatedEntity30-1Opt
MCCI_MT000100CA.LocatedEntity1
classCode : "LOCE" (RoleClass)1Mand
location : Place11Mand
MCCI_MT000100CA.LocatedEntity2
classCode : "LOCE" (RoleClass)1Mand
location : Place21Mand
MCCI_MT000100CA.LocatedEntity3
classCode : "LOCE" (RoleClass)1Mand
location : Place31Mand
MCCI_MT000100CA.Message

Business name: HL7 Message

The root class of all messages.

Conveys information about the interaction and how it is to be processed

id : II

Business name: A:Message Identifier

A unique identifier for the message.

Allows detection of duplicate messages, and allows tying acknowledgments to the message they are acknowledging. The attribute is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
creationTime : TS.FULLDATETIME

Business name: G:Message Timestamp

Indicates the time this particular message instance was constructed.

Allows identification of how current the information in a message is. Also provides a baseline for identifying the time-zone of other times within the message. As a result, the attribute is mandatory.

1Mand
securityText :

Business name: H:Security Token

A locally-defined field used to maintain a session, identify a user, and/or perform some other function related to authenticating the message source.

Allows jurisdictions and applications to communicate authentication and session information. The attribute is optional because not all jurisdictions will require this capability.

0-1Opt
versionCode : (HL7StandardVersionCode)

Business name: C: HL7 Standard Version

Indicates the version of the messaging standard being referenced.

Needed to know how to validate message definition, CMET definition, vocabulary and other information and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
interactionId : II

Business name: B:Interaction Type

Indicates the interaction conveyed by this message.

Identifies what the receiving application should do, and how the message should be validated. The attribute is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
profileId : SET<II>

Business name: F:Conformance Profile Identifiers

Identifies the conformance profile(s) this message complies with.

Indicates any additional validation that may be appropriate. Also influences what extensions can be processed.

0-10Req
processingCode : (ProcessingID)

Business name: D:Processing Code

Indicates whether this message is intended to be processed as production, test or debug message.

Indicates how the message should be handled and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
processingModeCode : "T" (ProcessingMode)1Mand
acceptAckCode : (AcknowledgementCondition)

Business name: E:Desired Acknowledgment Type

Indicates how the message is expected to be acknowledged.

Provides support for immediate, deferred and polling mode and distinguishes which mode is desired. The attribute is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
receiver : Receiver1Mand
respondTo : RespondTo0-1Opt
sender : Sender1Mand
attentionLine : AttentionLine0-5Opt
controlActProcess : 1Mand
MCCI_MT000100CA.Organization1
classCode : "ORG" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "INSTANCE" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
id : II

Business name: IC:Sending Organization Identifier

Uniquely identifies the legal entity responsible for the content of the message.

May be used for routing/filtering purposes. Also allows tracking of the original responsible party for messages which may undergo multiple routing or translation steps. This attribute is optional because not all environments require communicating this information.

1Mand
MCCI_MT000100CA.Organization2
classCode : "ORG" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "INSTANCE" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
id : II

Business name: JC:Receiver Organization Identifier

The unique identifier of the organization with responsibility to act on the contents of this message.

Important when the eventual entity responsible for acting on an interaction may be reached through several routing steps. This attribute is optional because not all environments require communicating this information.

1Mand
MCCI_MT000100CA.Organization3
classCode : "ORG" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "INSTANCE" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
id : II

Business name: KC:Respond to Organization Id

The unique identifier of the application who is to be responsible for responses to this message.

Needed for circumstances where the 'respond to' organization is different than the sending organization. This attribute is optional because not all environments require communicating this information.

1Mand
MCCI_MT000100CA.Place1
classCode : "PLC" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "INSTANCE" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
id : II

Business name: ICA:Sending Facility Identifier

The unique identifier of the hospital, clinic or other facility which constructed the message.

May be used for routing, or for configuration control. This attribute is optional because not all environments require communicating this information.

1Mand
MCCI_MT000100CA.Place2
classCode : "PLC" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "INSTANCE" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
id : II

Business name: JD:Receiver Facility Identifier

Identifies the facility expected to receive the message.

May be used to assist in routing the message. This attribute is optional because not all environments require communicating this information.

1Pop
MCCI_MT000100CA.Place3
classCode : "PLC" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "INSTANCE" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
id : II

Business name: KD:Respond to Facility Id

Indicates the clinic or other facility to which responses to this interaction should be sent.

May affect the routing of a message. This attribute is optional because not all environments require communicating this information.

1Mand
MCCI_MT000100CA.Receiver
typeCode : "RCV" (CommunicationFunctionType)1Mand
telecom : TEL.URI

Business name: JB:Receiver Network Address

The address to which this message is being sent.

Indicates where the message should be sent. This is optional because not all environments require network addresses.

0-1Opt
device : Device21Mand
MCCI_MT000100CA.RespondTo

Business name: to be responded to by

Indicates the interaction that should receive the response to this interaction. Used when different from the sender of the original interaction.

In complex routing environments, the acknowledgements may need to be sent to a system other than the one which constructed the original message. This association is optional because not all environments will support responses to systems other than the original sender.

typeCode : "RSP" (CommunicationFunctionType)1Mand
telecom : TEL.URI

Business name: KB:Respond to Network Address

Indicates the address to send acknowledgments of this message to.

Needed when the address to respond to is different than that of the sender. This is optional because not all environments require network addresses.

0-1Opt
device : Device31Mand
MCCI_MT000100CA.Sender
typeCode : "SND" (CommunicationFunctionType)1Mand
telecom : TEL.URI

Business name: IB:Sending Network Address

The network address of the application which sent the message.

May be important for sender validation. Usually also the address to which responses are sent. This is optional because not all environments require network addresses.

0-1Opt
device : Device11Mand
 
 

MCCI_MT000200CA

MCCI_MT000200CA.Acknowledgement
typeCode : (AcknowledgementType)

Business name: GA:Acknowledgement Code

Indicates whether the previous interaction was successfully processed.

Key to understanding whether the interaction has been successful and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
messageWaitingNumber : INT.NONNEG

Business name: GC:Number of Waiting Messages

For applications which support polling, indicates the total number of messages waiting to be retrieved.

Indicates to a system how many polled messages are available without the need so send a separate query. The element is optional because not all systems will support polling.

0-1Opt
messageWaitingPriorityCode : (MessageWaitingPriority)

Business name: GD:Message Waiting Priority

Indicates the priority of the highest-priority message that is waiting on the poll queue for the system being responded to.

The priority of the waiting message may influence how quickly the polling system may choose to download queued messages. The element is optional because not all systems will support polling.

0-1Opt
targetMessage : TargetMessage1Mand
acknowledgementDetail : AcknowledgementDetail0-50Req
MCCI_MT000200CA.AcknowledgementDetail

Business name: Errors or Warnings

An error, warning or information message associated with the message being acknowledged.

Allows identification issues related to the parsing and low-level processing of the message.

typeCode : (AcknowledgementDetailType)

Business name: Message type

Distinguishes between errors, warnings and information messages.

Different types of messages have substantially different ramifications. As a result, the element is mandatory.

1Mand
code : (AcknowledgementDetailCode)

Business name: A:Response Code

Indicates the specific issue represented by this message.

By providing coded identification of issues and errors, allows applications to have logic that manages particular errors and warnings automatically. However in some circumstances, a code may not be available. Therefore the attribute is marked as 'populated'.

1Pop
text :

Business name: C:Message Description

The human-readable description of the error, warning or information message. May convey additional details not present in the 'code', but is not intended to be human-processable.

Allows supplementing the 'computer' information for human-readability.

0-1Req
location : SET<ST>

Business name: B:Referenced Message Locations

Indicates the location of the elements within the message instance that triggered this error, warning or information message.

I.e. only the default 'child' axis is permitted, occurrence numbers are always specified, and no other predicates are permitted.

Allows syntax and other messages to be linked to particular fields within the message.

0-5Req
MCCI_MT000200CA.Agent1
classCode : "AGNT" (RoleClass)1Mand
representedOrganization : Organization11Mand
MCCI_MT000200CA.Agent2
classCode : "AGNT" (RoleClass)1Mand
representedOrganization : Organization21Mand
MCCI_MT000200CA.Agent3
classCode : "AGNT" (RoleClass)1Mand
representedOrganization : Organization31Mand
MCCI_MT000200CA.AttentionLine

Business name: Routing Instruction Lines

Provides information on how the message should be routed within the receiving application.

Allows direction of messages within complex applications. This association is optional because not all applications will require this level of routing.

keyWordText :

Business name: A:Routing Type

A particular type of guidance for routing the message.

Allows categorization of routing types or support for multiple route pieces. Mandatory to understand the routing information.

1Mand
value :

Business name: B:Routing Name

Indicates the specific value used to route the item.

Allows internal routing within an application.

0-1Req
MCCI_MT000200CA.Device1
classCode : "DEV" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "INSTANCE" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
id : II

Business name: IA:Sending Application Identifier

The unique identifier of the application or system to whom the message is being routed.

Because this is the key identifier of where the message is intended to go, this attribute is mandatory.

1Mand
name :

Business name: IE:Sending Application Name

This is the name associated with the system or application sending the message.

Provides useful information when debugging.

0-1Req
desc :

Business name: II:Sending Application Configuration Information

Provides additional information about the configuration of the sending application. Useful when debugging.

Provides additional information that may assist in debugging interactions.

0-1Req
existenceTime : IVL.LOW<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: IH:Sending Application Version Date

Indicates the last time the sending application was modified or reconfigured.

Can help to isolate the source of a problem when debugging.

0-1Req
manufacturerModelName :

Business name: IG:Sending Software Version Number

Indicates the version number of the piece of software used to construct the message.

May be used to filter messages based on the compliance testing of the sending software.

0-1Req
softwareName :

Business name: IF:Sending Application Software Name

Indicates the name of the software used to construct the message.

May be used to filter messages based on sending application compliance testing.

0-1Req
asAgent : Agent10-1Opt
asLocatedEntity : LocatedEntity10-1Opt

MCCI_MT000200CA.TargetMessage
id : II

Business name: BA:Acknowledged Message Id

References the identifier of the message this current message is acknowledging.

Provides the necessary link to complete a conversation for systems using communication technologies which are not conversational. This attribute is therefore mandatory.

1Mand

Business name: B:Interaction Type

Indicates the interaction conveyed by this message.

Identifies what the receiving application should do, and how the message should be validated. The attribute is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
profileId : SET<II>

Business name: F:Conformance Profile Identifiers

Identifies the conformance profile(s) this message complies with.

Indicates any additional validation that may be appropriate. Also influences what extensions can be processed.

0-10Req
processingCode : (ProcessingID)

Business name: D:Processing Code

Indicates whether this message is intended to be processed as production, test or debug message.

Indicates how the message should be handled and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
processingModeCode : "T" (ProcessingMode)1Mand
acceptAckCode : (AcknowledgementCondition)

Business name: E:Desired Acknowledgment Type

Indicates how the message is expected to be acknowledged.

Provides support for immediate, deferred and polling mode and distinguishes which mode is desired. The attribute is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
receiver : Receiver1Mand
respondTo : RespondTo0-1Opt
sender : Sender1Mand
attentionLine : AttentionLine0-5Opt
acknowledgement : Acknowledgement1Mand
controlActProcess : 0-1Req
MCCI_MT000300CA.Organization1
classCode : "ORG" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "INSTANCE" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
id : II

Business name: IC:Sending Organization Identifier

Uniquely identifies the legal entity responsible for the content of the message.

May be used for routing/filtering purposes. Also allows tracking of the original responsible party for messages which may undergo multiple routing or translation steps. This attribute is optional because not all environments require communicating this information.

1Mand
MCCI_MT000300CA.Organization2
classCode : "ORG" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "INSTANCE" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
id : II

Business name: JC:Receiver Organization Identifier

The unique identifier of the organization with responsibility to act on the contents of this message.

Important when the eventual entity responsible for acting on an interaction may be reached through several routing steps. This attribute is optional because not all environments require communicating this information.

1Mand
MCCI_MT000300CA.Organization3
classCode : "ORG" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "INSTANCE" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
id : II

Business name: KC:Respond to Organization Id

The unique identifier of the application who is to be responsible for responses to this message.

Needed for circumstances where the 'respond to' organization is different than the sending organization. This attribute is optional because not all environments require communicating this information.

1Mand
MCCI_MT000300CA.Place1
classCode : "PLC" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "INSTANCE" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
id : II

Business name: ICA:Sending Facility Identifier

The unique identifier of the hospital, clinic or other facility which constructed the message.

May be used for routing, or for configuration control. This attribute is optional because not all environments require communicating this information.

1Mand
MCCI_MT000300CA.Place2
classCode : "PLC" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "INSTANCE" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
id : II

Business name: JD:Receiver Facility Identifier

Identifies the facility expected to receive the message.

May be used to assist in routing the message. This attribute is optional because not all environments require communicating this information.

1Mand
MCCI_MT000300CA.Place3
classCode : "PLC" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "INSTANCE" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
id : II

Business name: KD:Respond to Facility Id

Indicates the clinic or other facility to which responses to this interaction should be sent.

May affect the routing of a message. This attribute is optional because not all environments require communicating this information.

1Mand
MCCI_MT000300CA.Receiver
typeCode : "RCV" (CommunicationFunctionType)1Mand
telecom : TEL.URI

Business name: JB:Receiver Network Address

The address to which this message is being sent.

Indicates where the message should be sent. This is optional because not all environments require network addresses.

0-1Opt
device : Device21Mand
MCCI_MT000300CA.RespondTo

Business name: to be responded to by

Indicates the interaction that should receive the response to this interaction. Used when different from the sender of the original interaction.

In complex routing environments, the acknowledgements may need to be sent to a system other than the one which constructed the original message. This association is optional because not all environments will support responses to systems other than the original sender.

typeCode : "RSP" (CommunicationFunctionType)1Mand
telecom : TEL.URI

Business name: KB:Respond to Network Address

Indicates the address to send acknowledgments of this message to.

Needed when the address to respond to is different than that of the sender. This is optional because not all environments require network addresses.

0-1Opt
device : Device31Mand
MCCI_MT000300CA.Sender
typeCode : "SND" (CommunicationFunctionType)1Mand
telecom : TEL.URI

Business name: IB:Sending Network Address

The network address of the application which sent the message.

May be important for sender validation. Usually also the address to which responses are sent. This is optional because not all environments require network addresses.

0-1Opt
device : Device11Mand
MCCI_MT000300CA.TargetMessage
id : II

Business name: BA:Acknowledged Message Id

References the identifier of the message this current message is acknowledging.

Provides the necessary link to complete a conversation for systems using communication technologies which are not conversational. This attribute is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
 
 

MCCI_MT102001CA

MCCI_MT102001CA.Agent1
classCode : "AGNT" (RoleClass)1Mand
representedOrganization : Organization11Mand
MCCI_MT102001CA.Agent2
classCode : "AGNT" (RoleClass)1Mand
representedOrganization : Organization21Mand
MCCI_MT102001CA.Agent3
classCode : "AGNT" (RoleClass)1Mand
representedOrganization : Organization31Mand
MCCI_MT102001CA.AttentionLine

Business name: Routing Instruction Lines

Provides information on how the message should be routed within the receiving application.

Allows direction of messages within complex applications. This association is optional because not all applications will require this level of routing.

keyWordText :

Business name: A:Routing Type

A particular type of guidance for routing the message.

Allows categorization of routing types or support for multiple route pieces. Mandatory to understand the routing information.

1Mand
value :

Business name: B:Routing Name

Indicates the specific value used to route the item.

Allows internal routing within an application.

0-1Req
MCCI_MT102001CA.Device1
classCode : "DEV" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "INSTANCE" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
id : II

Business name: IA:Sending Application Identifier

The unique identifier of the application or system to whom the message is being routed.

Because this is the key identifier of where the message is intended to go, this attribute is mandatory.

1Mand
name :

Business name: IE:Sending Application Name

This is the name associated with the system or application sending the message.

Provides useful information when debugging.

0-1Req
desc :

Business name: II:Sending Application Configuration Information

Provides additional information about the configuration of the sending application. Useful when debugging.

Provides additional information that may assist in debugging interactions.

0-1Req
existenceTime : IVL.LOW<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: IH:Sending Application Version Date

Indicates the last time the sending application was modified or reconfigured.

Can help to isolate the source of a problem when debugging.

0-1Req
manufacturerModelName :

Business name: IG:Sending Software Version Number

Indicates the version number of the piece of software used to construct the message.

May be used to filter messages based on the compliance testing of the sending software.

0-1Req
softwareName :

Business name: IF:Sending Application Software Name

Indicates the name of the software used to construct the message.

May be used to filter messages based on sending application compliance testing.

0-1Req
asAgent : Agent10-1Opt
asLocatedEntity : LocatedEntity10-1Opt

id : II

Business name: JA:Receiver Application Identifier

The unique identifier of the application to which the message is being sent.

Used for routing and for verification that "yes, this message is intended for me." This is mandatory because it is the key identifier of the receiving application.

1Mand

asLocatedEntity : LocatedEntity20-1Opt

The unique identifier of the applications to which responses should be sent. Only populated when different from the sending application id.

Allows unique identification and routing to the application to be responded to. This attribute is mandatory be cause it is the principal identifier of the application to respond to.

MCCI_MT102001CA.Message

Business name: HL7 Message

The root class of all messages.

Conveys information about the interaction and how it is to be processed

id : II

Business name: A:Message Identifier

A unique identifier for the message.

Allows detection of duplicate messages, and allows tying acknowledgments to the message they are acknowledging. The attribute is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
creationTime : TS.FULLDATETIME

Business name: G:Message Timestamp

Indicates the time this particular message instance was constructed.

Allows identification of how current the information in a message is. Also provides a baseline for identifying the time-zone of other times within the message. As a result, the attribute is mandatory.

1Mand
securityText :

Business name: H:Security Token

A locally-defined field used to maintain a session, identify a user, and/or perform some other function related to authenticating the message source.

Allows jurisdictions and applications to communicate authentication and session information. The attribute is optional because not all jurisdictions will require this capability.

0-1Opt
versionCode : (HL7StandardVersionCode)

Business name: C: HL7 Standard Version

Indicates the version of the messaging standard being referenced.

Needed to know how to validate message definition, CMET definition, vocabulary and other information and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
interactionId : II

Business name: B:Interaction Type

Indicates the interaction conveyed by this message.

Identifies what the receiving application should do, and how the message should be validated. The attribute is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
profileId : SET<II>

Business name: F:Conformance Profile Identifiers

Identifies the conformance profile(s) this message complies with.

Indicates any additional validation that may be appropriate. Also influences what extensions can be processed.

0-10Req
processingCode : (ProcessingID)

Business name: D:Processing Code

Indicates whether this message is intended to be processed as production, test or debug message.

Indicates how the message should be handled and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
processingModeCode : "T" (ProcessingMode)1Mand
acceptAckCode : (AcknowledgementCondition)

Business name: E:Desired Acknowledgment Type

Indicates how the message is expected to be acknowledged.

Provides support for immediate, deferred and polling mode and distinguishes which mode is desired. The attribute is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
receiver : Receiver1Mand
respondTo : RespondTo0-1Opt
sender : Sender1Mand

POIZ_MT030050CA

POIZ_MT030050CA.AdverseReactionObservationEvent

Active Vaccine Event

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : "ADVERSE_REACTION" (ActCode)1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
POIZ_MT030050CA.CauseOf

Business name: Adverse Reaction Indicator

Indicates whether there was an adverse event associated with the immunization.

Tracking adverse events is an important part of reporting immunizations. The presence or absence of this class behaves as a 'mandatory' indicator where the presence indicates an adverse reaction and the absence indicates no known reaction.

typeCode : "CAUS" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
adverseReactionObservationEvent : AdverseReactionObservationEvent1Pop
POIZ_MT030050CA.Consumable2

Business name: *c:administered

Identifies the vaccine being recorded.

The vaccine is the key part of the administration record. However because SNOMED can pre-coordinate the vaccine into code, the association is only 'required'.

RXA-5 (Immunization Agent)

Association is mandatory when not using SNOMED

typeCode : "CSM" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
medication : Medication1Pop
POIZ_MT030050CA.Immunization

Business name: Immunization

Represents a single immunization occurrence for a particular patient

Allows capturing a patient's immunization profile

approachSite must be required if not using SNOMED

Route must be required if not using SNOMED

If immunization was not refused, then refusal reason must not be specified otherwise field should be treated as populated.

classCode : "SBADM" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : CD (ActCode)

Business name: Immunization Type

Indicates what type of administration is being performed.

Indicates that the type of administration is an administration, and for SNOMED, also indicates the specific type of administration. Thus the attribute is mandatory. The datatype is CD to allow for SNOMED post-coordination.

1Mand
negationInd :

Business name: Not Immunized?

An explicit indication that a person has not been immunized with the specified vaccine at the time indicated.

Tracking failures to be immunized is also important in immunization reporting. This flag must always be known and is always mandatory.

NotImmunizedFlag

CompletionStstus (true = Not administered)

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
effectiveTime : TS.FULLDATE

Business name: C:Immunization Date

The date vaccination(s) was administered to the patient.

Important information for establishing the validity of the immunization records, and therefore mandatory. Also used in the scheduling of subsequent immunizations.

DateOfVaccination

1Mand
confidentialityCode : (x_VeryBasicConfidentialityKind)

Business name: D:Immunization Masking Indicator

Denotes access restriction placed on the immunization record. Methods for accessing masked immunization records will be governed by each jurisdiction (e.g. court orders, shared secret/consent, etc.).

The default is 'NORMAL'.

Provides support for additional confidentiality constraint to reflect the wishes of the patient.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

0-1Opt
reasonCode : (ActNoImmunizationReason)

Business name: Immunization Refusal Reason

A coded value denoting a patient's reason for refusing to be immunized.

Typical reasons include: Parental decision, Religious exemption, Patient decision, etc

Useful information for planning future immunization encounters for the patient.

CompletionStatus (Refused)

0-1Req
routeCode : (RouteOfAdministration)

Business name: E:Route of Administration

This is the means by which the drug was administered to the patient.

Ensures consistency in description of routes.

Attribute is marked "optional" to allow for use of pre-coordinated SNOMED Codes.

RXR-1

0-1Opt
approachSiteCode : (HumanSubstanceAdministrationSite)

Business name: Administration Site

A coded value denoting the body area where the immunization was administered.

This is also referred to as the anatomical site of vaccination.

Some immunizations are intended to adjust from site to site. (E.g. if first injection is given in right deltoid, first booster should be given in left deltoid.)

Attribute is marked "optional" to allow for use of pre-coordinated SNOMED Codes.

RXR.2

0-1Opt
doseQuantity : PQ.DRUG

Business name: Quantity Administered

The amount of the vaccine administered to/by the patient.

Useful for evaluating reaction and for checking contraindication.

Attribute is populated to allow for situations where quantity may not be known and thus null flavor must be specified.

1Pop
subject : Subject101Mand
consumable : Consumable20-1Req
informant : Informant0-1Req
inFulfillmentOf : InFulfillmentOf30-1Req
subjectOf : Subject90-1Req
cause : CauseOf0-1Req
POIZ_MT030050CA.ImmunizationPlan

Business name: Immunization Course

Specifies whether there is more that 1 dose in the course of immunizations.

Allows the system to record a specific immunization event as one of several within a course of immunizations. Allows tracking whether immunization plans have been completed.

classCode : "SBADM" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "INT" (ActMood)1Mand
code : "IMMUNIZ" (ActCode)1Mand
statusCode : "active" (ActStatus)1Mand
fulfillment : InFulfillmentOf0-1Req
successor : Predecessor0-1Req
POIZ_MT030050CA.InFulfillmentOf

Business name: next dose planned for

Indicates the date on which subsequent immunization is expected to be administered.

Used as follow-up reminder for the patient.

typeCode : "FLFS" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
subsetCode : "NEXT" (ActRelationshipSubset)1Mand
nextPlannedImmunization : NextPlannedImmunization1Pop
POIZ_MT030050CA.InFulfillmentOf3

Business name: part of

Indicates the order of a specific immunization event with a planned/expected number of immunizations.

Allows tracking against a therapy plan.

typeCode : "FLFS" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
sequenceNumber : INT.POS

Business name: Vaccine Dose Number

Indicates whether this is the initial immunization (Dose Number = 1) or a specific booster (Dose Number = 2 means first booster, 3 means 2nd booster, etc.).

Used in compliance checking regarding completion of a planned immunization therapy.

RXA.2

1Pop
immunizationPlan : ImmunizationPlan1Pop
POIZ_MT030050CA.Informant

Business name: reported by

Indicates where the information that led to the recording of this information came from. E.g. Reported by patient, parent, health-care provider, etc.

The original source of the information can be important in evaluating its accuracy and importance.

typeCode : "INF" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
informantionSourceRole : InformantionSourceRole1Pop
POIZ_MT030050CA.InformantionSourceRole
classCode : (x_InformationSource)

Business name: Information Source

A coded value denoting a patient, patient's agent, or a provider as the source of the recorded immunization information.

Allows for the explicit identification of the source of the recorded information.

1Mand
POIZ_MT030050CA.NextImmunizationPlan

The NextImmunizationPlan is when you need your next "series" of immunizations, often referred to as booster shots.

classCode : "SBADM" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "INT" (ActMood)1Mand
code : "IMMUNIZ" (ActCode)1Mand
effectiveTime : TS.FULLDATE

Business name: Next Planned Series Repeat Date

Indicates the date on which the next series is scheduled to be administered.

Allows for the scheduling of a multi-dose immunization course.

1Mand
POIZ_MT030050CA.NextPlannedImmunization

The NextPlannedImmunization is the next scheduled dose within a set or "series" of immunizations.

classCode : "SBADM" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "INT" (ActMood)1Mand
code : "IMMUNIZ" (ActCode)1Mand
statusCode : "active" (ActStatus)1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL.LOW<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: Next Planned Dose Date

Indicates the date on which the next course of immunization is to be undertaken.

Necessary reminder to a patient and his/or provider for a follow-up therapy.

1Mand
POIZ_MT030050CA.Predecessor

typeCode : "SUCC" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand

POIZ_MT030060CA.Immunization

Business name: Immunizations

A record of a patient's immunizations.

Necessary component of a person's overall medication profile. Helps deal with outbreaks and also drug contraindication checking.

approachSite must be required if not using SNOMED

Route must be required if not using SNOMED

classCode : "SBADM" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: A:Immunization Record Id

This is an identifier assigned to a unique instance of an immunization record.

Allows for the unique referencing of a specific immunization record. Thus the mandatory requirement.

1Mand
code : CD (ActCode)

Business name: Immunization Type

Indicates what type of administration is being performed.

Indicates that the type of administration is an administration, and for SNOMED, also indicates the specific type of administration. Thus the attribute is mandatory. The datatype is CD to allow for SNOMED post-coordination.

1Mand
negationInd :

Business name: Not Immunized?

An explicit indication that a person has not been immunized with the specified vaccine at the time indicated.

Tracking failures to be immunized is also important in immunization reporting. The attribute is mandatory because it is not meaningful to record an immunization where it is unknown

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
effectiveTime : TS.FULLDATE

Business name: Immunization Date

The date vaccination(s) was administered to the patient.

Important information for establishing the validity of the immunization records, and therefore mandatory. Also used in the scheduling of subsequent immunizations.

1Mand
confidentialityCode : (x_VeryBasicConfidentialityKind)

Business name: Immunization masking Indicator

Denotes access restriction placed on the immunization record. Methods for accessing masked immunization records will be governed by each jurisdiction (e.g. court orders, shared secret/consent, etc.). The default is 'NORMAL'.

Provides support for additional confidentiality constraint to reflect the wishes of the patient.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

0-1Opt
reasonCode : (ActNoImmunizationReason)

Business name: Immunization Refusal Reason

A coded value denoting a patient's reason for refusing to be immunized. Typical reasons include: Parental decision, Religious exemption, Patient decision, etc.

Useful information for planning future immunization encounters for the patient.

0-1Req
routeCode : (RouteOfAdministration)

Business name: Route of Administration

This is the means by which the drug was administered to the patient.

Ensures consistency in description of routes.

Attribute is marked 'optional' to allow for use of pre-coordinated SNOMED Codes.

0-1Opt
approachSiteCode : (HumanSubstanceAdministrationSite)

Business name: Administration Site

A coded value denoting the body area where the immunization was administered. This is also referred to as the anatomical site of vaccination.

Some immunizations are intended to adjust from site to site. (E.g. if first injection is given in right deltoid, first booster should be given in left deltoid.)

Attribute is marked 'optional' to allow for use of pre-coordinated SNOMED Codes.

0-1Opt
doseQuantity : PQ.DRUG

Business name: Quantity Administered

The amount of the vaccine administered to/by the patient.

Useful for evaluating reaction and for checking contraindication.

Used in compliance checking regarding completion of a planned immunization therapy and is therefore marked as "populated".

POIZ_MT060140CA

POIZ_MT060140CA.ImmunizationPeriod
value : IVL<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: G:Immunization Period

Indicates that the returned records should be filtered to only include those immunizations that occurred within the indicated time-period. This will commonly be used to retrieve 'all immunizations since xxx'.

Allows the requester to specify the period of interest for the retrieval of immunization records.

Useful for constraining run-away queries.

1Mand
POIZ_MT060140CA.IncludeIssuesIndicator
value :

Business name: Include Issues Indicator

Indicates whether or not issues attached to the immunization record are to be returned along with the detailed information.

Allows for the flexibility of omitting/including issues in the retrieval of information for immunization data.

Because the attribute is boolean, it must explicitly indicate a 'TRUE' or 'FALSE', and thus it is mandatory.

1Mand
POIZ_MT060140CA.IncludeNotesIndicator
value :

Business name: Include Notes Indicator

Indicates whether or not notes attached to the immunization record are to be returned along with the detailed information.

Allows for the flexibility of omitting/including notes in the retrieval of information for immunization data. The value of this parameter must be known to return a response, so it is marked as mandatory.

1Mand
POIZ_MT060140CA.NextPlannedDosePeriod

Business name: Next Planned Dose Period

value : IVL<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: H:Next Planned Dose Period

Indicates that the returned records should be filtered to only include those immunization records for which the next planned dose date falls within the indicated time-period.

Allows the requester to specify the period of interest for the retrieval of immunization records.

Useful for constraining run-away queries.

1Mand
POIZ_MT060140CA.ParameterList

Business name: Generic Query Parameters

Defines the set of parameters that may be used to filter the query response.

Root class for query definition

immunizationPeriod : ImmunizationPeriod0-1Req
includeIssuesIndicator : IncludeIssuesIndicator1Mand
includeNotesIndicator : IncludeNotesIndicator1Mand
nextPlannedDosePeriod : NextPlannedDosePeriod0-1Req
patientBirthDate : PatientBirthDate1Mand
patientGender : PatientGender1Mand
patientID : PatientID1Mand
patientName : PatientName1Mand
renewalPeriod : RenewalPeriod0-1Req
vaccineCode : VaccineCode0-1Req
vaccineDoseNumber : VaccineDoseNumber0-1Req
POIZ_MT060140CA.PatientBirthDate
value : TS.DATE

Business name: D:Patient Birth Date

Indicates the date on whic the patient was born.

Use to confirm identity of the patient for the query and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
POIZ_MT060140CA.PatientGender
value : (AdministrativeGender)

Business name: C:Patient Gender

Indicates the gender (sex) of the patient.

Used to confirm the identity of the patient for the query and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
POIZ_MT060140CA.PatientID
value : II

Business name: B:Patient ID

Identifier of the patient who is the subject of the patient immunization query. Filter the result set to include only those records pertaining to the patient with this Id.

Allows filtering of result set by patient Id. This is a mandatory field because a patient must be specified for the query to be valid

1Mand
POIZ_MT060140CA.PatientName
value : PN.BASIC

Business name: C:Patient Name

The name of the patient who is the subject of the patient immunization query.

Filter the result set to include only those records pertaining to the patient with this name.

Allows filtering of result set by patient name. This is a mandatory field because a patient name must match the patient Id for the query to be valid.

1Mand
POIZ_MT060140CA.RenewalPeriod
value : IVL<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: I:Renewal Period

Indicates that the returned records should be filtered to only include those immunization records for which the renewal date falls within the indicated time-period.

Allows the requester to specify the period of interest for the retrieval of immunization records.

Useful for constraining run-away queries.

1Mand
POIZ_MT060140CA.VaccineCode
value : (VaccineEntityType)

Business name: E:Vaccine Code

A coded value indicating a specific vaccine to be used in searching for patient immunization record.

The result set will be filtered to only include immunization records involving the specific vaccine code

Allows for finer sub-set of immunization records to be retrieved based on the vaccine code used in the immunization.

1Mand
POIZ_MT060140CA.VaccineDoseNumber
value : INT.POS

Business name: F:Vaccine Dose Number

A number representing the vaccine booster order that must be used in searching for patient immunization record.

The result set will be filtered to only include immunization records pertaining to specific booster number.

Allows for finer sub-set of immunization records to be retrieved based on the sequence of the vaccine booster.

1Mand

POIZ_MT060150CA.CauseOf

Business name: Adverse Reaction Indicator

Indicates whether there was an adverse event associated with the immunization.

Tracking adverse events is an important part of reporting immunizations. The presence or absence of this class behaves as a 'mandatory' indicator where the presence indicates an adverse reaction and the absence indicates no known reaction.

typeCode : "CAUS" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
adverseReactionObservationEvent : AdverseReactionObservationEvent1Pop
POIZ_MT060150CA.Consumable2

Business name: *c:administered

Identifies the vaccine being recorded. .

The vaccine is the key part of the administration record. However because SNOMED can pre-coordinate the vaccine into code, the association is only 'required'.

Association is mandatory when not using SNOMED

typeCode : "CSM" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "OP" (ContextControl)1Mand
medication : Medication1Pop

classCode : "ALRT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
POIZ_MT060150CA.Immunization

Business name: Immunizations

A record of a patient's immunizations.

Necessary component of a person's overall medication profile. Helps deal with outbreaks and also drug contraindication checking.

approachSite must be required if not using SNOMED

Route must be requires if not using SNOMED

If immunization was not refused, then refusal reason must not be specified otherwise field should be treated as populated.

classCode : "SBADM" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: A:Immunization Record Id

This is an identifier assigned to a unique instance of an immunization record.

Allows for the unique referencing of a specific immunization record. Thus the mandatory requirement.

1Mand
code : CD (ActCode)

Business name: Immunization Type

Indicates what type of administration is being performed.

Indicates that the type of administration is an administration, and for SNOMED, also indicates the specific type of administration. Therefore, the attribute is mandatory. The attribute is CD to allow for SNOMED post-coordination

1Mand
negationInd :

Business name: Not Immunized?

An explicit indication that a person has not been immunized with the specified vaccine at the time indicated.

Tracking failures to be immunized is also important in immunization reporting. Marked as mandatory because it is not meaningful for this flag to be 'unknown'.

NotImmunized

CompletionStstus (true = Not administered)

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
effectiveTime : TS.FULLDATE

Business name: C:Immunization Date

The date vaccination(s) was administered to the patient.

Important information for establishing the validity of the immunization records, and therefore mandatory. Also used in the scheduling of subsequent immunizations.

ZDP.13.2.2

ZDP.13.3

ZDP.13.4

ZDP.13.5

1Mand
confidentialityCode : (x_VeryBasicConfidentialityKind)

Business name: D:Immunization Masking Indicator

Denotes access restriction place on the immunization record.

Provides support for additional confidentiality constraint to reflect the wishes of the patient.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

0-1Opt
reasonCode : (ActNoImmunizationReason)

Business name: Immunization Refusal Reason

A coded value denoting a patient's reason for refusing to be immunized.

Typical reasons include: Parental decision, Religious exemption, Patient decision, etc

Allows sorting and categorizing different kinds of refusal reasons. Ensures that reasons are gathered in a consistent analyzable manner.

CompletionStatus (Refused)

0-1Req
routeCode : (RouteOfAdministration)

Business name: E:Route of Administration

This is the means by which the drug was administered to the patient.

Ensures consistency in description of routes.

Attribute is marked 'optional' to allow for use of pre-coordinated SNOMED Codes.

Route of administration

0-1Opt
approachSiteCode : (HumanSubstanceAdministrationSite)

Business name: Administration Site

A coded value denoting the body area where the immunization was administered.

Some immunizations are intended to adjust from site to site. (E.g. if first injection is given in right deltoid, first booster should be given in left deltoid.)

Attribute is marked "optional" to allow for use of pre-coordinated SNOMED Codes.

RXR.2

0-1Opt
doseQuantity : PQ.DRUG

Business name: Quantity Administered

The amount of the vaccine administered to/by the patient.

Useful for evaluating reaction and for checking contraindication.

Attribute is populated to allow for situations where quantity may not be known and thus null flavor must be specified.

The characteristics of a manufactured product that visually distinguish it from other products.

A coded value denoting the type of physical characteristic being documented. Kinds of characteristics include: Color, Shape, Markings, Size.

Identifies what kind of characteristic is being identified. This is mandatory as providing the characteristic alone without specifying the type can result in ambiguity

value :

Business name: Characteristic

Information pertaining to a specific instance of drug characteristic (color, shape, markings etc)

Provides the 'value' part of the name-value pair describing the drug product appearance characteristic.

The attribute is marked as 'mandatory' as there must be a value for a mandatory code.

POME_MT010040CA.Document

Business name: Monographs

Information on the composition and use of a drug.

Guides providers for specifying optimum use of drugs by patients. May also guide patients in appropriately using their medication.

classCode : "DOC" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: Monograph Id

Unique identifier assigned to a monograph record.

Allows matching and replacing of locally-stored monographs.

This attribute is marked as 'mandatory', as it is always available.

Monograph.monographId

1Mand
code : (ActMedicationDocumentCode)

Business name: Monograph Type

Distinguishes between different kinds of documents and monographs. Kinds of monographs include: Clinical Monograph, Patient Education Monograph, etc.

Allows monograph types to be distinguished for display, printing, etc.

Code is mandatory because an application can't know what to do with a monograph without knowing its type.

Allows distinction between Drug Monograph and Patient Monograph.

ZPC1.2

ZPD2.2

1Mand
text : ED.DOCORREF

Business name: Monograph Content

Includes either the full-blown content of the monograph (as a PDF, HTML or HL7 CDA document), or provides a reference to where the monograph can be accessed on the network via HTTP or FTP

Allows delivery of the monograph information to the provider either embedded or by reference

DrugMonograph.DrugMomographLines

PatientMonograph.PatientMonographLines

ZPD3.1

0-1Req
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL<TS.DATE>

Business name: Monograph Effective/Expiry Date

The date on which the information in the monograph became effective, and/or the date on which the information in the monograph was superseded

Indicates currency of information or when monograph no longer applies. Different systems may update their monographs at different times, and it is important to know what version contains the most current information.

Monograph effective and/or expiry date should be available in most situations and is clinically relevant; thus attribute is marked as 'populated'.

Monograph.EffectiveDate

Monograph.EndDate

1Pop
languageCode : (HumanLanguage)

Business name: Written in

A coded value denoting the language in which the monograph is written.

Allows providers to request or display monographs in the language of their choice.

This attribute is marked as 'populated' because the language of the monograph must always be known/available or a null flavor must be specified.

1Pop
author : Author0-1Req
POME_MT010040CA.HalfLife

Business name: Drug Half-Life

Specification of the length of time a particular drug remains in the body (as active)

Impacts contraindication checking for drugs no longer being taken by patients.

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : "REP_HALF_LIFE" (ActCode)1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
value : PQ.TIME

Business name: Half-Life Period

Different drugs are absorbed and degraded by the body at different rates. The half-life indicates the length of time necessary for a human body to degrade the drug to half its original potency. The actual time-period will vary from person to person based on mass, renal function, liver function, route of administration and other factors

Depending on the half-life, a drug may remain present and active in a patient's system long after they cease taking it. Understanding this time period is essential to appropriate dosing, and also to identifying when to include medications in drug-drug interaction checking.

DrugProduct.HalfLifePeriod

1Mand
POME_MT010040CA.Ingredient

Business name: drug contains

Identification of which ingredients are contained (or are not contained) in a drug, along with their respective quantities.

Useful to providers in deciding appropriate use instruction (dosage specification) for patients. Also important in checking for potential adverse reactions to non-active ingredients. For compounds, allows contraindication checking against ingredients of custom compounds.

classCode : "INGR" (RoleClass)1Mand
negationInd :

Business name: Does Not Contain Indicator

An indication that a drug does not contain the specified ingredient (active or inactive).

Useful for filtering searches. Allows providers to search for drugs not containing a specific active ingredients or excipients. E.g. lactose-free, gluten-free, etc.

Because product descriptions (particularly herbals) occasionally use the phrase "may contain", this attribute allows null values.

0-1Req
quantity : PQ.DRUG

Business name: Ingredient Quantity

The quantity of the ingredient in a drug. This is represented/measured in various forms/units including: mg, mg/vol, %, etc.

Essential for evaluating appropriate dosage based on strength, as well as for creating custom compounds with proper composition.

CompoundIngredient.amount(numerator)

CompoundIngredient.proportionOfFinal(e.g. 10% = .1mg/1mg)

ZPC.4(quantity)

ZPC.5(unit)

ZPJ1.4(quantity)

ZPJ1.5(unit)

ZPJ1.6(e.g. 10% = .1mg/1mg)

ZCP.3

ZDU.4.3

ZDU.6.1.2

Compound.448-ED (quantity)

Compound.451-EG (unit)

0-1Req
ingredient : Substance1Mand
POME_MT010040CA.InitialDispense

Business name: Drug Validity Period

Defines upper limits for period in which a prescribed drug may be dispensed. Although an attempt will be made to obtain and define panCanadian validity periods for drug, it is possible that drug validity periods wii be jurisdiction-specific

Allows for business rules regarding dispenses against a prescription. Controlled and monitored drugs have shorter prescription lifespans that other drugs.

classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "DEF" (ActMood)1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL.WIDTH<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: First Fill Period

The period within which the prescribed drug has to be dispensed for the first time.

This is usually jurisdiction-specific, and for the most part, it is set at the drug class level.

For instance, the first fill period of validity for narcotic drugs is 3 days in most jurisdiction, where as it is between 18 and 24 months for other non-controlled drugs.

Certain prescribers have time limitations or certain drugs must be filled in a finite period of time.

DrugProduct:firstFillPeriod (first occurrence, if multiple)

1Mand
POME_MT010040CA.LivingSubjectKind
classCode : "LIV" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "KIND" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
administrativeGenderCode : (AdministrativeGender)

Business name: Patient Gender

Indicates the gender of patient to whom the dosage specification applies.

Some dosage specifications are gender-specific.

1Mand
POME_MT010040CA.ManufacturedProduct

Business name: manufactured by

Associates a drug product with the organization responsible for producing it.

May be important for tracing adverse events and for performing drug searches.

classCode : "MANU" (RoleClass)1Mand
manufacturer : Manufacturer1Mand
POME_MT010040CA.Manufacturer

Business name: Manufacturer

Identity of the organization that manufactured the drug product.

Useful in distinguishing and grouping drug products

classCode : "ORG" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "INSTANCE" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
id : II

Business name: Manufacturer Id

An identifier denoting a specific drug manufacturer.

Allows sending of identifiers in place of manufacturer name. May be used in drug search where specific manufacturer is a criterion.

0-1Req
name :

Business name: Manufacturer Name

The name of the drug manufacturer.

Used in reporting.

The attribute is marked as "mandatory" because there will always be a name for an organization.

DrugProduct.ManufacturerName

POME_MT010040CA.Medicine

Business name: Drug or Compound

A catalog of drugs (manufactured material) from which drugs may be selected for prescribing/dispensing. This includes: TC - Therapeutic Class; GD - Generic Drug; GF - Generic Formulation; MD - Manufactured Drug; and CMP - Compound

Provides a list of drugs available for prescribing/dispensing.

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

classCode : "MMAT" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "KIND" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
code : (ClinicalDrug)

Business name: Drug Code

An identifier for a type of drug. Depending on where the drug is being referenced, the drug may be identified at different levels of abstraction. E.g. Manufactured drug (including vaccines), generic formulation, generic, therapeutic class, etc.

Used to ensure clear communication by uniquely identifying a particular drug product when prescribing or dispensing. This attribute is mandatory because querying by drug code can only return drug codes.

1Mand
name : SET<TN>

Business name: Drug Names

The name assigned to a drug.

Names are used for human reference communication, to allow selection from dropdowns and for local searching. Up to two names are supported: a 'search name' which is fully formed with no abbreviations, and a 'display name' which may contain abbreviations to fit within a smaller area on the screen.

This attribute is marked as 'mandatory' as drugs at any level of the drug hierarchy is supposed to have a name.

DrugProduct.Name (Search)

POME_MT010040CA.MedicineClass

Business name: Drug Categories

A categorization system that shows where a drug fits into a hierarchy of drug classification. Examples include: therapeutic class, generic drug, generic formulation, and manufactured drug.

Allows filtering and drill-down of drug products, as well as decision making with respect to substitutability, etc.

Either a code or name must be specified.

classCode : "MMAT" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "KIND" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
code : (ClinicalDrug)

Business name: Drug Code

A code that uniquely identifiers a drug within a specific drug identification scheme.

Used to uniquely identify a particular drug product when prescribing/dispensing at a higher level of abstraction (e.g. generic drug, generic formulation).

This attribute is marked as "populated" as drug code should be available in most cases.

HICL

Therapeutic Class

Therapeutic Sub Classification

DrugProduct.activeIngredientId

DrugProduct.ActiveIngredientGroupNumber

DrugProduct.StandardProductId (Mnemonic)

DrugProduct.StandardIDType(Code System)

1Pop
name :

Business name: Drug Name

The name assigned to a drug within a specific drug identification scheme.

To display in dropdowns and for local searching.

This attribute is marked as "populated" as a drug name should be available in most cases.

Generic Name

1Pop
POME_MT010040CA.MonitoringProgram

Business name: Monitoring Programs

A system of additional business rules, documentation or reporting associated with a particular drug or group of drugs. These are typically instituted to detect potential abuse, or to monitor prescribing and/or dispensing patterns of a sensitive class of medications. Examples include triplicate programs, antibiotic monitoring programs, etc.

Allows association of additional business requirements with a particular drug

DrugProduct.triplicate

Prescription.triplicate

classCode : "MPROT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : (ActMonitoringProtocolCode)

Business name: Program Type

A coded value denoting a specific kind of monitoring program. For example, "Drugs of potential abuse", "Antibiotics", etc.

Used for classifying and sorting monitoring programs.

This is mandatory because, different program types have different business rules.

DispensedItem.triplicate

1Mand
title :

Business name: Program Name

A user-friendly label assigned to the monitoring program.

Provides a provider-recognizable label for the program.

0-1Req
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
custodian : Custodian0-1Req
POME_MT010040CA.ObservationEventCriterion

Business name: Patient Characteristics

Indicates a characteristic that should be possessed by the patient for the dose to be appropriate.

Allows filtering of dosages to be appropriate to the patient.

Value should be mandatory if not using SNOMED

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN.CRT" (ActMood)1Mand
code : (ObservationDosageDefinitionPreconditionType)

Business name: Patient Characteristic Type

Indicates the type of patient characteristic being expressed. E.g. Height, weight, age, lab values, etc. If negation indicator is true, then this indicates a characteristic the patient should *not* have.

Needed to identify what type of characteristic is being expressed, and therefore mandatory.

1Mand
negationInd :

Business name: Exclude characteristic?

If true, indicates that the characteristic is one which should *not* be held by the patient for the dosage to apply.

Many dosages are inappropriate for patients with certain characteristics (e.g. INR values, etc.)

Because it must be known whether the characteristic is included or excluded, this element is mandatory.

1Mand
value : IVL<PQ.BASIC>

Business name: Patient Characteristic Value

Indicates the specific value or range of values of the characteristic a patient should have for the dosage to be appropriate.

Allows comparison to actual patient characteristics to see if the dosage is applicable. In some circumstances, the specific range may not be known, thus the field is "populated"

Example: This dosage specification applies to people over 60 pounds".

1Pop

Business name: may be taken according to

Indicates the dosage specification(s) which are appropriate for the medication.

Helps providers determine appropriate dosing for the drug.

typeCode : "OPTN" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand

Indicates the name of the organization or agency that created the dosage recommendation
