PORX_MT020030CA

PORX_MT020030CA.ActRequest

Business name: Prescription

Information pertaining to a prescriber's authorization for a drug to be dispensed to a patient, as well as the instruction on when and how the drug is to be administered to the patient.

This is a 'core' class of the medication model and is important for understanding what drugs the patient is intended to be receiving. Also needed for e-prescribing.

classCode : "ACT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "RQO" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: A:Prescription Order Number

This is an identifier assigned to a specific medication order. The number remains constant across the lifetime of the order, regardless of the number of providers or pharmacies involved in fulfilling the order.

Allows prescriptions to be uniquely referenced. Multiple identifiers are allowed to support assigning of prescription ids by the prescriber, EHR, and potentially by pharmacies.

The ID is mandatory to allow every prescription record to be uniquely identified.

PORX_MT020060CA

PORX_MT020060CA.Author

Business name: bc:prescribed by

The person who prescribed the device.

Used to create an 'inferred' prescription if an electronic prescription does not already exist in the EHR.

typeCode : "AUT" (ParticipationType)1Mand
time : TS.FULLDATE

Business name: Prescription Order Date

The calendar date on which the device was prescribed. This may differ from the date on which the prescription becomes effective. E.g. A prescription created today may not be valid to be dispensed or used for two weeks.

Indicates when the action was performed, and may influence expiry dates for the order.

The attribute is populated because the creation date of the prescription shall always be known or absent for a reason.

1Pop
assignedPerson : AssignedPerson1Pop
PORX_MT020060CA.Component

Indicates the days supply and quantity of devices dispensed.

Dispense is not complete without specifying quantity dispensed, and thus this association is mandatory.

typeCode : "COMP" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
supplyEvent : SupplyEvent1Mand

PORX_MT020060CA.DeviceDispense

Business name: Prescription Dispense

This is the detailed information about a device dispense that has been performed on behalf a patient

Dispensing is an integral part of the overall prescription process.

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: A:Prescription Dispense Number

Identifier assigned by the dispensing facility.

Allows formal tracking of centrally recorded dispenses to local records for audit and related purposes.

0-1Req
confidentialityCode : (x_VeryBasicConfidentialityKind)

Business name: E:Prescription Masking Indicator

Communicates the intent that the dispense should be masked if it is created; If the dispense is masked, this makes the complete prescription and all dispenses masked.

If a dispense is masked, it implicitly masks the prescription being dispensed. (There's no point in masking a dispense if the prescription is unmasked.)

Can be used to set a mask for a new dispense, if present in a new dispense request.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

DispensedItem.masked

0-1Opt
subject : Subject81Mand
recordTarget : RecordTarget0-1Req
inFulfillmentOf : InFulfillmentOf11Mand
component1 : Component110-1Req
component2 : Component1Mand
subjectOf : Subject70-1Req
PORX_MT020060CA.DeviceRequest

Information pertaining to the prescription for which a dispense is being created

Dispenses for electronically created prescriptions must reference the prescription.

The Prescriber Name must be specified only when the Prescription ID is Null

classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "RQO" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: D:Prescription Order Number

The identifier of the prescription for which a dispense is beiing created.

Allows prescriptions to be uniquely referenced.

The ID is only 'populated' because in some cases the prescription will not yet exist electronically.

PORX_MT020060CA.SupplyEvent
classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : (ActPharmacySupplyType)

Business name: Dispense Type

Indicates the type of dispensing event that is performed. Examples include: Trial Fill, Completion of Trial, Partial Fill, Emergency Fill, Samples, etc.

Indicates reason for the size of dispense. Because it defines what type of dispense is occurring, the attribute is mandatory.

DispensedItem.activityType

D52

ZDP.2

Claim.403-D3

Claim.343-HD

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: Dispense Processing and Pickup Date

Represents the date the dispense product was prepared and when the product was picked up by or delivered to the patient. The dispense processing date and pickup date can be back dated to reflect when the actual processing and pickup occurred. The lower-bound of the period signifies the dispense-processing date whereas the upper-bound signifies the dispense-pickup date.

Must be able to post-date a dispense (enter retroactively) e.g. system failure.

Used by the system in calculating expected exhaustion time. Valuable in compliance checking. This attribute is mandatory because an existing dispense record must at least indicate the date it was processed.

ZPB3.9

ZDP.17 (high)

DRU.040-02 (low, qualifier=07, format=102)

DRU.040-02 (low, qualifier=36, format=102)

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

Dispense Date

Dispense Date

DispensedItem.dispenseDate

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

1Mand
quantity : INT.POS

Business name: Dispensed Quantity

The number of devices that have been dispensed.

Critical in understanding the patient's profile, both past and current, This is also mandatory to allow determination of the amount that remains to be dispensed against the prescription.

D58

ZPB3.4

ZDP.10.1

ZDP.10.2.1 (the fact that it is package is determined by a playing entity)

ZDP.9.1

ZDP.9.2.1 (the fact that it is package is determined by a playing entity)

DRU.020-01 (Unit, qualifier=38 0r 87)

DRU.020-02 (Quantity, qualifier=38 0r 87)

expectedUseTime : IVL.WIDTH<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: Dispensed Days Supply

The number of days that the dispensed quantity is expected to last.

Useful in monitoring patient compliance. May also be useful in determining and managing certain contraindications ('Fill-Too-Soon', 'Fill-Too-Late', and 'Duration of Therapy'). Because 'Days Supply' may be necessary to compute total dispensed quantity, it is made a 'populated' field.

PORX_MT020070CA.Author

Business name: bc:prescribed by

The person who prescribed the medication.

Used to create an 'inferred' prescription if an electronic prescription does not already exist in the EHR.

typeCode : "AUT" (ParticipationType)1Mand
time : TS.FULLDATE

Business name: Prescription Order Date

The date at which the drug was prescribed. This may differ from the date on which the prescription becomes effective. E.g. A prescription created today may not be valid to be dispensed or administered for two weeks.

Indicates when the action was performed, and may influence expiry dates for the order.

The attribute is populated because the creation date of the prescription shall always be known or absent for a reason.

1Pop
assignedPerson : AssignedPerson1Pop

Indicates the days supply and quantity of medication dispensed.

Dispense is not complete without specifying quantity dispensed, and thus this association is mandatory.

PORX_MT020070CA.MedicationDispense

Business name: Prescription Dispense

This is the detailed information about a medication dispense that has been performed on behalf a patient

Dispensing is an integral part of the overall medication process.

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: A:Local Dispense Id

Identifier assigned by the dispensing facility.

Allows formal tracking of centrally recorded dispenses to local records for audit and related purposes.

0-1Req
confidentialityCode : (x_VeryBasicConfidentialityKind)

Business name: E:Prescription Masking Indicator

Communicates the intent that the dispense should be masked if it is created; If the dispense is masked, this makes the complete prescription and all dispenses masked.

If a dispense is masked, it implicitly masks the prescription being dispensed. (There's no point in masking a dispense if the prescription is unmasked.)

Can be used to set a mask for a new dispense, if present in a new dispense request.

DispensedItem.masked

0-1Req
subject : Subject81Mand
recordTarget : RecordTarget0-1Req
inFulfillmentOf : InFulfillmentOf11Mand
component1 : Component130-1Req
component2 : Component111-10Mand
component3 : Component1Mand
subjectOf : Subject70-1Req

PORX_MT020070CA.Product2

Business name: *e:dispensed

Identifies the product being dispensed.

Also provides information on compound ingredients and instructions and packaging requirements

Identifies the drug as part of the patient's medication profile. The drug is one of the most important parts of the dispense record, and it is therefore mandatory.

Record target can only be present if subject is an animal (in which case it must be present)

PORX_MT020070CA.SupplyEvent
classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : (ActPharmacySupplyType)

Business name: Dispense Type

Indicates the type of dispensing event that is performed. Examples include: Trial Fill, Completion of Trial, Partial Fill, Emergency Fill, Samples, etc.

Indicates reason for the size of dispense. Because it defines what type of dispense is occurring, the attribute is mandatory.

DispensedItem.activityType

D52

ZDP.2

Claim.403-D3

Claim.343-HD

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: Dispense Processing and Pickup Date

Represents the date the dispense product was prepared and when the product was picked up by or delivered to the patient. The dispense processing date and pickup date can be back dated to reflect when the actual processing and pickup occurred. The lower-bound of the period signifies the dispense-processing date whereas the upper-bound signifies the dispense-pickup date.

Must be able to post-date a dispense (enter retroactively) e.g. system failure.

Used by the system in calculating expected exhaustion time. Valuable in compliance checking. This attribute is mandatory because an existing dispense record must at least indicate the date it was processed.

ZPB3.9

ZDP.17 (high)

DRU.040-02 (low, qualifier=07, format=102)

PORX_MT030040CA

PORX_MT030040CA.AdministrationInstructions

Business name: Prescribed Adminidtration Instruction

classCode : "SBADM" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "RQO" (ActMood)1Mand
code : "DRUG" (ActCode)1Mand
text :

Business name: Rendered Dosage Instruction

A free form textual specification generated from the input specifications as created by the provider.

This is made up of either an 'Ad-hoc dosage instruction' or 'Textual rendition of the structured dosage lines', plus route, dosage unit, and other pertinent administration information specified by the provider.

Allows the provider to verify the codified structured dosage information entered and ensure that the exploded instruction is consistent with the intended instructions.

Also useful in bringing back administration instructions on query responses. Because all prescriptions and dispenses have dosage, this attribute is mandatory.

1Mand
PORX_MT030040CA.AnnotationIndicator
classCode : "ACT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand

PORX_MT030040CA.Author2

Business name: *b:prescribed by

This is the provider who authorized the medication to be dispensed to the patient.

To be a legal order, the person responsible for its creation must be identified. Thus the association is mandatory.

Prescription.Prescriber

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

typeCode : "AUT" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AP" (ContextControl)1Mand
time : TS.FULLDATE

Business name: Prescribed Date

The date at which the drug was prescribed. This may differ from the date on which the prescription becomes effective. E.g. A prescription created today may not be valid to be dispensed or administered for two weeks.

Indicates when the action was performed, and may influence expiry dates for the order.

The attribute is populated because the creation datetime of the prescription will not always be known (as in the case of 'inferred prescription').

PORX_MT030040CA.CombinedMedicationRequest

Business name: Prescription

Where the prescription is for a combination of drugs (e.g. 10mg tablets + 40mg tablets) repeatNumber cannot be populated and quantity must be expressed in mg.

This is a 'core' class of the medication model and is important for understanding what drugs the patient is intended to be receiving.

classCode : "SBADM" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "RQO" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: A:Prescription Order Number

The Prescription Order Number is a globally unique number assigned to a prescription by the EHR/DIS irrespective of the source of the order

It is created by the EHR/DIS once the prescription has passed all edits and validation.

Allows prescriptions to be uniquely referenced.

The number is mandatory to allow every prescription record to be uniquely identified.

Prescription.prescriptionNumber

Prescription.prescriptionExternalKey

D53(ID for the prescription assigned by pharmacy)

D55(ID for the dispense event)

D99.01

X0101(id for prescription)

DRU.080-01(extension)

DRU.080-02(route)

Claim.455-EM (route)

Claim.402-D2 (extension)

Claim.456-EN

Claim.454-EK

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

1Mand
code : CD (ActCode)

Business name: Prescription Type

Indicates that this is a prescription for a drug as opposed to an immunization. For SNOMED, may also contain information regarding drug and route.

Needed to convey the meaning of this class and is therefore mandatory.

The element allows 'CD' to provide support for SNOMED.

1Mand
statusCode : (ActStatus)

Business name: C:Prescription Status

This denotes the state of the prescription in the lifecycle of the prescription. Valid statuses are: NEW, ACTIVE, SUSPENDED, ABORTED, COMPLETED, OBSOLETE and NULLIFIED.

Indicates what actions are allowed to be performed against a prescription.

This is a mandatory field because every prescription needs to be in some state.

Prescription.state (cannot distinguish between 'Filled' and 'Unfilled', must look at amounts dispensed to distniguish between those; and also cannot distinguish modified, need to look at event history).

Prescription Status

1Mand
confidentialityCode : (x_VeryBasicConfidentialityKind)

Business name: F:Prescription Masking Indicator

Communicates the intent of the patient to restrict access to their prescriptions.

Provides support for additional confidentiality constraint, giving patients a level of control over their information.

Valid values are: 'NORMAL' (denotes 'Not Masked'); and 'RESTRICTED' (denotes 'Masked').

The default is 'NORMAL' signifying 'Not Masked'.

Allows the patient to have discrete control over access to their medication data.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

Prescription.masked

PORX_MT030040CA.Component1

Business name: e:to be administered according to

The Prescriber's instruction(s) for the administration of the medication.

This information is needed for a prescription to be valid and is therefore mandatory. Multiple repetitions are supported for circumstances where a single therapy involves the administration of multiple drugs. E.g. Didrocal.

typeCode : "COMP" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
administrationInstructions : AdministrationInstructions1Mand
PORX_MT030040CA.Component4

Business name: classifies

Indicates the clinical use category in which the prescription has been put.

Allows prescriptions to be categorized in multiple ways.

typeCode : "COMP" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
workingListEvent : WorkingListEvent1Pop
PORX_MT030040CA.Component6

Business name: f:includes

Identifies the instructions for how the prescribed medication should be dispensed to the patient.

An essential part of most prescriptions is the authorization to dispense. Multiple repetitions are included to accommodate circumstances where multiple drug products may need to be dispensed to complete a therapy. E.g. 100 x 20mg tablets and 50 x 10mg tablets. The association is marked as Populated because the authorization to dispense is a critical portion of a prescription. However the association is allowed to be 'null' when the order is for a medication which requires no dispense authorization (e.g. over-the-counter medications), or when the patient already has sufficient supply of the medication on hand to complete the therapy.

typeCode : "COMP" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
supplyRequest : SupplyRequest1Pop
PORX_MT030040CA.DerivedFrom

Business name: Inferred Indicator

If true, indicates that the data associated with the prescription is uncertain because the existence of the prescription has been inferred from a secondary source (e.g. dispensing data).

Distinguishes electronic records which reflect exactly what was ordered from orders that merely mimic what was dispensed and therefore can't be used for information about ordering patterns. Because it must always be known how an order was captured, this attribute is mandatory.

typeCode : "DRIV" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
sourceDispense : SourceDispense1Pop
PORX_MT030040CA.DetectedIssueEvent

Business name: Issues

Describes an issue associated with a prescription that resulted in a dispenser refusing to fill it.

Allows a dispenser to assert an issue against a prescription to be displayed to subsequent dispensers as well as others reviewing the patient's medication profile.

classCode : "ALRT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : (ActDetectedIssueCode)

Business name: Issue Type

A coded value that is used to distinguish between different kinds of issues. Types of issue include: unrecognized identifiers, permission issues, drug-drug contraindications, drug-allergy alerts, duplicate therapies, suspect fraud etc.

.

Identifies what kind of issue was detected or is being managed.

This is mandatory so as to ensure that one issue type can be distinguished from another.

1Mand
text :

Business name: Issue Comment

A free form textual description regarding the issue of fraudulence. This may be specified in place of, or in addition to the coded issue.

Enables extra or more detailed description of the alert

0-1Req
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
PORX_MT030040CA.DetectedIssueIndicator

The presence of issues can be of clinical significance and may prompt a clinician to wish to drill down for further information.

classCode : "ALRT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
PORX_MT030040CA.DirectTarget

Indicates the medication that has been prescribed to the patient.

This is a key aspect of the prescription. It is only marked as 'required' because SNOMED may pre-coordinate the drug into code.

Association is mandatory when not using SNOMED

typeCode : "DIR" (ParticipationType)1Mand

PORX_MT030040CA.Location

Allows follow-up and traceability of the refusal and is therefore mandatory

PORX_MT030040CA.Location2

Business name: *c:targeted to pharmacy

Indicates the pharmacy to which the prescription has been directed or which has currently assumed responsibility for dispensing the prescription.

Allows prescriptions to be directed on the request of the patient or by legal requirement. Also allows indication of which pharmacy is the current 'custodian' of the prescription.

This should always be known or should have an explicit null flavor of 'NA' (non-assigned) or 'UNK' (paper prescription). Thus the association is 'populated'.

typeCode : "LOC" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "OP" (ContextControl)1Mand
substitutionConditionCode : (x_SubstitutionConditionNoneOrUnconditional)

Business name: Dispense Facility Not Assignable Indicator

Indicates a 'hard' or 'soft' assignment of dispensing priviledged to the targetted facility.

'Hard' assignment (mandated facility) indicates that the prescription can be dispensed only at that facility.

'Soft' assignment (usually as a patient directive) indicates that the prescription may be dispensed at facilities other than the targeted facility.

Influences whether the prescription may be transferred to a service delivery location other than the targeted dispenser.

0-1Req
serviceDeliveryLocation : ServiceDeliveryLocation1Pop
PORX_MT030040CA.Precondition

Business name: Non-authoritative Indicator

If true, indicates that the prescription is non-authoritative. I.e. A paper copy must be viewed before the prescription can be dispensed.

Allows distinguishing prescriptions where the paper copy is authoritative vs. the electronic copy being authoritative.

This attribute behaves as a 'mandatory' element where the presence of the association indicates that a paper prescription is needed and the absence of the association indicates that one is not.

typeCode : "PRCN" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
verificationEventCriterion : VerificationEventCriterion1Pop
PORX_MT030040CA.Reason

Business name: d:prescribed because of

Denotes the reason(s) for this specific prescription; it must not be interpreted as a permanent diagnosis.

Helps providers evaluate the appropriateness of the dosage instructions for the medication, and may influence education or literature provided to the patient on the use of the medication.

Provided at the discretion of the prescriber to enhance patient care. E.g., take 1 tab bid for migraine. Also needed for drug-disease interaction checking software to work properly.

This field is marked as populated because of its high clinical importance, however 'Nulls' are allowed because the individual recording the prescription (e.g. pharmacist) may not be aware of the indication or the prescriber may choose to withhold (mask) the information due to patient sensitivity.

typeCode : "RSON" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
priorityNumber : INT.POS

Business name: Indication Priority

Ordering of prescribing indications from primary indication (low number) to minor indication (higher number). Multiple indications are permitted to have the same priority if they're considered of equivalent importance.

Allows providers to indicate whether indication is the primary or secondary target of the therapy. E.g., Terazosin for Benign Prostatic Hypertrophy as primary and Hypertension as secondary or vice-versa.

0-1Req
Choice: indications : Indications1Pop
 »»  observationDiagnosis : ObservationDiagnosis0-1Opt
 »»  observationSymptom : ObservationSymptom0-1Opt
 »»  otherIndication : OtherIndication0-1Opt
PORX_MT030040CA.Reason2

Business name: because of

Identifies an issue as the reason for recording a refusal to fill against a prescription.

Allows a dispenser to point to an issue of 'suspect fraud' as the reason for recording a 'refusal to fill' against a prescription.

typeCode : "RSON" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
detectedIssueEvent : DetectedIssueEvent1Pop
PORX_MT030040CA.RefusalToFill

Business name: Refusal to Fills

Indicates that the identified issue resulted in a dispenser refusing to fill the subject prescription.

Exposes in the model that this issue is associated with a refusal to dispense.

An indication of 'refusal to fill' must be indicated, thus attribute is mandatory.

One of 'Refusal To Fill Reason' or 'Issue' must be specified, but not both.

classCode : "CACT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : "PORX_TE010210UV" (ActCode)1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
effectiveTime : TS.FULLDATE

Business name: Refusal To Fill Date

1Pop
reasonCode : (ActSupplyFulfillmentRefusalReason)

Business name: Refusal to Fill Reason

Indicates a non-clinical-issue based reason for refusing to fill.

Indicates a non-clinical-issue based reason for refusing to fill. Allows CWE for non-coded reasons.

location : Location1Mand
reason : Reason20-50Req

This association is mandatory as it indicates one of presence or absence notes.

PORX_MT030040CA.Subject2

Indicates that there are issues associated with this prescription.

The presence of issues can be of clinical significance and may prompt a clinician to wish to drill down for further information.

This association is mandatory as it indicates one of presence or absence issues.

PORX_MT030040CA.Subject5

Identity of the person for whom the prescription was created.

A legal requirement, and also allows the content to be linked to the person's EHR. As a result, this association is mandatory.

DispensedItem.person

Future use request(true when participation is not present)

PORX_MT030040CA.SupplyEventFirstSummary

Business name: First Dispense Information

Provides summary information about the first dispense event on the prescription

Useful in understanding the status of a prescription and in planning for renewals.

classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL.HIGH<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: First Dispense Pickup Date

Indicates when the first dispense against the prescription was picked up.

Useful in establishing start of therapy.

Important information for compliance.

0-1Req
quantity : PQ.DRUG

Business name: First Quantity Dispense

Indicates the amount of medication first dispensed on the prescription.

Usually establishes trial quantities for a prescription.

If the first dispense information is known, the quantity must be known and therefore is mandatory

1Mand
PORX_MT030040CA.SupplyEventFutureSummary

Business name: Remaining Dispense Information

Provides summary information about what dispenses remain to be performed against the prescription

Useful in understanding the status of a prescription and in planning for renewals.

At least one of quantity and repeatNumber must be specified.

classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
repeatNumber : INT.NONNEG

Business name: A:Fills Remaining

Indicates the number of remaining dispenses estimated, assuming that each fill is equal to the quantity prescribed for a single fill, rounding up.

Indicates the number of dispenses that may still occur.

0-1Req
quantity : PQ.DRUG

Business name: B:Remaining Total Quantity

Indicates the total remaining undispensed quantity authorized against the prescription.

Indicates how much can still be dispensed.

0-1Req
PORX_MT030040CA.SupplyEventLastSummary

Business name: Last Dispense Information

Provides summary information about the most recent dispense event performed against the prescription

Useful in understanding the status of a prescription and in planning for renewals.

classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL.HIGH<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: Last Dispense Pickup Date

Indicates the most recent date on which a dispense on the prescription was picked up.

Useful in determining when a prescription will next need to be dispensed. Also provides an indication of compliance.

0-1Req
quantity : PQ.DRUG

Business name: Last Quantity Dispensed.

Indicates the most recent quantity of the drug that was picked up for the prescription.

Useful in determining amount of medication that a patient should have on-hand. Also provides an indication of compliance.

If the most recent dispense information is known, the quantity must be known and therefore is mandatory

1Mand
PORX_MT030040CA.SupplyEventPastSummary

Business name: Previous Dispense Information

Summarizes the dispenses that have happened against the prescription to date.

Helps in understanding the status of the prescription and evaluating compliance.

At least one of quantity and repeatNumber must be specified.

classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
repeatNumber : INT.NONNEG

Business name: A:Number of Fill Made Against Rx

Indicates the number of dispense events performed against the prescription to date, including trial, partial and complete fills.

Useful in tracking the progress of a prescription in prescription.

0-1Req
quantity : PQ.DRUG

Business name: B:Total Supplied Amount

Indicates the amount of the prescribed medication that has been dispensed to-date.

Useful for tracking the progress of a prescription

0-1Req
PORX_MT030040CA.SupplyRequest

Business name: Dispense Instructions

Specification of how the prescribed medication is to be dispensed to the patient. Dispensed instruction information includes the quantity to be dispensed, how often the quantity is to be dispensed, etc.

Sets the parameters within which the dispenser must operate in dispensing the medication to the patient.

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "RQO" (ActMood)1Mand
statusCode : (ActStatus)

Business name: A:Prescription Dispense Indicator

This generally mirrors the status for the prescription, but in some circumstances may be changed to 'aborted' while the prescription is still active. When this occurs, it means the prescription may no longer be dispensed, though it may still be administered.

Allows a prescriber to say "Finish what you have on hand, but don't get any more."

Because the status should always be known, this element is mandatory.

1Mand
quantity : PQ.DRUG

Business name: B:Total Prescribed Quantity

The overall amount of amount medication to be dispensed under this prescription. Includes any first fills (trials, aligning quantities), the initial standard fill plus all refills.

Sets upper limit for medication to be dispensed. Can be used to verify the intention of the prescriber with respect to the overall medication. Used for comparison when determining whether additional quantity may be dispensed in the context of a part-fill prescription.

Narcotics must always be specified as a total quantity.

0-1Req
location : Location21Pop
PORX_MT030040CA.VerificationEventCriterion
classCode : "VERIF" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN.CRT" (ActMood)1Mand
code : "VFPAPER" (ActCode)1Mand
PORX_MT030040CA.WorkingListEvent

Business name: Drug Use

Categorization of prescriptions based on the intended duration of the prescribed therapy.

Useful in establishing compliance for drug renewals and refills.

classCode : "LIST" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : (ActTherapyDurationWorkingListCode)

Business name: D:Prescription Treatment Type

Describes the categorization of the therapy envisioned by this prescription (e.g. Continuous/Chronic, Short-Term/Acute and "As-Needed).

Allows categorizing prescription for presentation. May influence detection of duplicate therapy. May also be used to affect how DUR processing is completed. The field is marked as "populated" because the intended duration of the therapy should generally be known at prescribe time. However in some circumstances, it may not be known whether a therapy will be short-term or long-term.

Prescription type

Prescription.drugUseIndicator

1Mand
 
 

PORX_MT040010CA

PORX_MT040010CA.Component

Business name: administered according to

Indicates how the drug is to be consumed by the patient.

When available, it is important to understand the specific instructions that were provided to the patient.

typeCode : "COMP" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
dosageInstruction : DosageInstruction1Pop
PORX_MT040010CA.Consumable2

Business name: c:*administered

Identifies the other active medication being recorded into the system as being taken by the patient.

The drug is the key part of this recording activity, and is therefore mandatory.

typeCode : "CSM" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "OP" (ContextControl)1Mand
medication : Medication1Mand
PORX_MT040010CA.OtherMedication

Business name: Other Medication

A record of a medication the patient is believed to be taking, but for which an electronic order does not exist. 'Other medications' include any drug product deemed relevant to the patient's drug profile, but which was not specifically ordered by a prescriber in a DIS-enabled jurisdiction. Examples include over-the counter medications that were not specifically ordered, herbal remedies, and recreational drugs. Prescription drugs that the patient may be taking but were not prescribed on the EHR (e.g. institutionally administered or out-of-jurisdiction prescriptions) will also be recorded here.

Necessary component of a person's overall medication profile. Allows DUR checking against a more complete drug profile.

Status can only be 'ACTIVE' or 'COMPLETED'

routeCode must not be used when code is SNOMED and is mandatory otherwise

classCode : "SBADM" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : CD (ActCode)

Business name: Other Medication Type

Indicates that the record is a drug administration rather than an immunization or other type of administration. For SNOMED, may also include route, drug and other information.

Needed to convey the meaning of this class and is therefore mandatory.

The element allows 'CD' to provide support for SNOMED.

Must be 'DRUG' unless using SNOMED

1Mand
statusCode : (ActStatus)

Business name: C:Other Medication Status

This denotes a state in the lifecycle of the other medication. Valid statuses are: 'ACTIVE' and 'COMPLETED' only.

Indicates what actions are allowed to be performed against an other medication record. This is a mandatory field because every recorded 'other medication' needs to be in some state.

Note ------ The provider might know that the patient is not taking the medication but not necessarily when the patient stopped it. Thus the status of the medication could be set to 'COMPLETED' by the provider without necessarily setting an End Date on the medication record.

1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL<TS.DATE>

Business name: d:Drug Active Period

Indicates the time-period in which the patient has been taking or is expected to be taking the medication.

Either the start or end or both can be null if they are not known.

Used to help determine whether the medication is currently active. Because this information won't always be available, the attribute is marked as 'populated'.

ZDP.13.2.2

ZDP.13.3

ZDP.13.4

ZDP.13.5

1Pop
confidentialityCode : (x_VeryBasicConfidentialityKind)

Business name: E:Other Medication Masking Indicator

Denotes access restriction place on the other medication record. Methods for accessing masked other medications will be governed by each jurisdiction (e.g. court orders, shared secret/consent, etc.).

Provides support for additional confidentiality constraint to reflect the wishes of the patient.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

0-1Opt
routeCode : (RouteOfAdministration)

Business name: F:Route of Administration

This is the means by which the patient is taking the other medication.

Ensures consistency in description of routes. Provides potential for cross-checking dosage form and route. Because this information is pre-coordinated into 'code' for SNOMED, it is marked as optional.

Route of administration

0-1Opt
subject : Subject101Mand
consumable : Consumable21Mand
component : Component0-10Req
subjectOf : Subject90-1Req

Essential for linking the other active medication to the patient's record, and is therefore mandatory.

PORX_MT040020CA

PORX_MT040020CA.OtherMedication

Business name: Other Medication

While SNOMED codes may pre-coordinate the drug code, the drug must not be modified. However route information for a drug may be updated.

The medication record being updated.

routeCode must not be used when code is SNOMED and is mandatory otherwise

classCode : "SBADM" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: A:Other Medication Id

Identifier of the Other Medication record that needs to be updated.

Uniquely identifies the record to be updated and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
code : CD (ActCode)

Business name: Other Medication Type

Indicates that the record is a drug administration rather than an immunization or other type of administration. For SNOMED, may also include route, drug and other information.

Needed to convey the meaning of this class and is therefore mandatory.

The element allows 'CD' to provide support for SNOMED.

Must be 'DRUG' unless using SNOMED

1Mand
statusCode : (ActStatus)

Business name: B:Medication Status

Indicates whether the medication is still considered active.

Valid status can only be 'ACTIVE' or 'COMPLETED'.

Indicates the new state of the medication and is therefore mandatory.

Note ------ The provider might know that the patient is not taking the medication but not necessarily when the patient stopped it. Thus the status of the medication could be set to 'COMPLETED' by the provider without necessarily setting an End Date on the medication record.

1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL<TS.DATE>

Business name: C:Drug Active Period

The new period in which the active medication is deemed to be active.

Allows the drug active period information to be changed.

1Pop
confidentialityCode : (x_VeryBasicConfidentialityKind)

Business name: D:Other Medication Masking Indicator

0-1Opt
routeCode : (RouteOfAdministration)

Business name: E:Route

This is the means by which the patient is taking the other medication.

Ensures consistency in description of routes. Provides potential for cross-checking dosage form and route. Because this information is pre-coordinated into 'code' for SNOMED, it is marked as optional.

0-1Opt
subject : Subject101Mand
PORX_MT040020CA.Subject10

Business name: *pertains to

Identity of the Patient whose Other Medication record is to be updated.

Ensures that the Other Medication recorded to be updated belongs to the right Patient and is therefore mandatory.

typeCode : "SBJ" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "OP" (ContextControl)1Mand
patient : Patient1Mand
 
 

PORX_MT050010CA

PORX_MT050010CA.DrugCode
value : (ClinicalDrug)

Business name: Drug Codes

Indicates that the result set is to be filtered to include only those contraindications involving the specified drugs.

The codes may refer to administerable medications, orderable medications or higher level drug classifications.

The set of contraindication records retrieved would include all potential DDI between and amongst the drugs.

Allows for the retrieval of all potential contraindications that would result from drug profile scenarios.

This will most commonly be used by providers to test the viability of prescribing/dispensing medications into profile scenarios.

1Mand
PORX_MT050010CA.ParameterList

Business name: Generic Query Parameters

Defines the set of parameters that may be used to filter the query response.

Root class for query definition

drugCode : DrugCode2-20Mand
 
 

PORX_MT050020CA

PORX_MT050020CA.DrugCode
value : (ClinicalDrug)

Business name: E:Drug Code

Indicates that the result set is to be filtered to include only those contraindications pertaining to the specified drug.

The code may refer to an administerable medication, an orderable medication or a higher level drug classification.

The contraindication records retrieve would comprise the drug-drug interactions between this specified and each of the drugs on the patient's profile, as well as drug-disease and drug-allergy contraindications that might result (based on the information on the patient's profile).

Allows for the retrieval of all potential contraindications based on a specific medication being introduced onto the patient's medication profile. Contraindications can't be found without specifying the medication, therefore this attribute is mandatory.

This will most commonly be used by providers to test the viability of prescribing/dispensing a medication to a patient (in view of the patient's existing medication profile).

1Mand
PORX_MT050020CA.ParameterList

Business name: Generic Query Parameters

Defines the set of parameters that may be used to filter the query response.

Root class for query definition

drugCode : DrugCode1Mand
patientBirthDate : PatientBirthDate1Mand
patientGender : PatientGender1Mand
patientID : PatientID1Mand
patientName : PatientName1Mand
PORX_MT050020CA.PatientBirthDate
value : TS.DATE

Business name: D:Patient Birth Date

Indicates the date on which the patient was born.

Used to confirm the identity of the patient for the query and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
PORX_MT050020CA.PatientGender
value : (AdministrativeGender)

Business name: C:Patient Gender

Indicates the gender (sex) of the patient.

Used to confirm the identity of the patient for the query and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
PORX_MT050020CA.PatientID
value : II

Business name: B:Patient ID

Identifier of the patient who is the subject of the patient drug contraindication query. Filter the result set to include only those records pertaining to the patient with this Id.

Allows filtering of result set by patient Id. This is a mandatory field because a patient must be specified for the query to be valid

1Mand
PORX_MT050020CA.PatientName
value : PN.BASIC

Business name: C:Patient Name

The name of the patient who is the subject of the drug contraindication query.

Filter the result set to include only those records pertaining to the patient with this name.

Allows filtering of result set by patient name. This is a mandatory field because a patient name must match the patient Id for the query to be valid.

1Mand
 
 

PORX_MT060010CA

classCode : "ACT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
PORX_MT060010CA.Author5

Business name: *prescribed by

Indicates the prescriber of the prescription.

The prescriber is a key piece of legal information which must be conveyed and is therefore mandatory.

typeCode : "AUT" (ParticipationType)1Mand
time : TS.FULLDATE

Business name: Prescription Order Date

The date at which the device was prescribed. This may differ from the date on which the prescription becomes effective. E.g. A prescription created today may not be valid to be dispensed or used for two weeks.

Indicates when the action was performed, and may influence expiry dates for the order.

The attribute is populated because the creation date of the prescription shall always be known or absent for a reason.

1Pop
assignedPerson : AssignedPerson1Mand
PORX_MT060010CA.Author6

Business name: *changed by

Identity of the health service provider or the application responsible for the change in the prescription dispense status.

In an EHR integrated health services environment, it is important that other providers are able to query who is responsible for status changes. Also used by applications for auditing and sorting. The attribute is populated because provider or application maintaining the prescription dispense must be known else an appropriate 'null' flavor must be specified.

typeCode : "AUT" (ParticipationType)1Mand
time : TS.FULLDATETIME

Business name: Change Timestamp

The date and time at which the change was made.

Gives other providers the frame of reference in evaluating any post-change issues with the prescription dispense. Also used for sorting and audit purposes.

1Mand
Choice: changedBy : ChangedBy1Mand
 »»  assignedPerson : AssignedPerson0-1Opt
 »»  assignedDevice : AssignedDevice0-1Opt

 »»  AssignedDevice
PORX_MT060010CA.Component

Business name: l:includes

Indicates the days supply and quantity of devices dispensed.

Dispense is not complete without specifying quantity dispensed, and thus this association is mandatory.

typeCode : "COMP" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand

Indicates the way and manner in which the device is to be used by the patient.

PORX_MT060010CA.ControlActEvent

Business name: Dispense Status Changes

This records the history of changes that have been made to the prescription dispense, including why the changes were made, who made them and when.

Provides an audit trail of a patient's therapy adjustments. Status changes may affect evaluations of compliance.

classCode : "CACT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : (HL7TriggerEventCode)

Business name: Dispense Status Change Type

Identifies what kind of change occurred. Examples include Suspended, Aborted, etc.

This attribute is mandatory to ensure that change types are distinguishable.

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: Dispense Status Change Effective Date

The date on which the various status changes of a prescription dispense become valid and applicable. In the case of a suspend, may also indicate the scheduled time at which the status change will end.

Allows applications to sort and filter by time.

The effective date can be defaulted to change date, and thus is mandatory.

1Mand
reasonCode : (ControlActReason)

Business name: Dispense Status Change Reason

Denotes the reason the status of the prescription dispense was changed.

Ensures consistent terminology in capturing and interpreting reasons for change. Allows CWE because not all reasons will correspond to a pre-defined code.

0-1Req
responsibleParty : ResponsibleParty20-1Req
author : Author61Mand
PORX_MT060010CA.Destination2

Business name: shipped-to Address

Indicates where the dispensed product was sent.

Important as part of a claim for justifying shipping charges.

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

typeCode : "DST" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
serviceDeliveryLocation : ServiceDeliveryLocation1Pop
PORX_MT060010CA.DetectedIssueIndicator
classCode : "ALRT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
PORX_MT060010CA.DeviceDispense

Business name: Dispense

Describes the issuing of a drug in response to an authorizing prescription.

This is a 'core' class of the medication model and is important for understanding what drugs the patient is actually receiving.

Annotation is only permitted if Annotation Indicator is not present

Reported Issue is only permitted if Issue Indicator is not present

One of DetectedIssueIndicator or Reported Issues detailed info must be returned, but not both

One of AnnotationIndicator or Annotation detail info must be returned, but not both.

classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: A:Prescription Dispense Number

The Prescription Dispense Number is a globally unique number assigned to a prescription dispense by the EHR/DIS irrespective of the source of the supply event

It is created by the EHR/DIS once the dispense has passed all edits and validation.

Allows dispense events to be uniquely referenced and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
statusCode : (ActStatus)

Business name: B:Dispense Status

Indicates whether the dispense has been picked up ('complete') or has just been processed ('active').

Indicates how far along the process the dispense event is. It should always be known and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
confidentialityCode : (x_VeryBasicConfidentialityKind)

Business name: E:Prescription Masking Indicator

Indicates whether the dispense (and associated prescription) is masked.

Allows a patient to control access to 'sensitive' prescriptions. The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

0-1Opt
responsibleParty : ResponsibleParty0-1Req
performer : Performer31Mand
location : Location1Mand
component1 : Component110-1Req
component2 : Component1Mand
fulfillment : InFulfillmentOf0-1Req

Indicates the prescription that was dispensed.

Important for performing follow-up and therefore mandatory.

PORX_MT060010CA.Performer3

Business name: *c:dispensed by

Identification of the provider who dispensed the device.

Important for tracking responsibility and for following up. This is an essential part of the record, and therefore is mandatory.

typeCode : "PRF" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "OP" (ContextControl)1Mand

moodCode : "RQO" (ActMood)1Mand
text :

Business name: Usage Instructions

Indicates how the device is intended to be used.

Shows other providers the usage instructions provided to the patient.

1Mand
PORX_MT060010CA.Product2

Business name: *e:dispensed

Identifies the product that was dispensed.

Identifies the device as part of the patient's profile. The device is one of the most important parts of the dispense record, and it is therefore mandatory.

typeCode : "PRD" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
manufacturedProduct : ManufacturedProduct1Mand
PORX_MT060010CA.Receiver2

Business name: i:picked up by

Identifies the person who picked up the dispensed product for the patient.

Should only be recorded if there is a specific need to track the person (other than the patient) who picked up the dispense (e.g. for narcotics). If recorded and if a list of potential receivers have been identified by the Rx Order, then this person should be one of those listed.

Used when patient is not in a position to pick up their device.

typeCode : "RCV" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
responsibleParty : ResponsibleParty1Pop
PORX_MT060010CA.ResponsibleParty

Business name: *e:supervised by

Identification of the provider who was supervising the actions of the author.

Allows for the trail of responsibility for the action.

typeCode : "RESP" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "OP" (ContextControl)1Mand
assignedPerson : AssignedPerson1Pop

Allows for the trail of responsibility for the action.

typeCode : "RESP" (ParticipationType)1Mand
assignedPerson : AssignedPerson1Pop

assignedPerson : AssignedPerson1Pop
PORX_MT060010CA.ServiceDeliveryLocation

Business name: Dispense Ship-To Location

The location where the dispensed product is expected to be delivered.

Important as part of a claim for justifying shipping charges.

classCode : "SDLOC" (RoleClass)1Mand
addr : AD.BASIC

Business name: Ship To Address

Indicates where the dispensed product was sent.

Important as part of a claim for justifying shipping charges.

1Mand
PORX_MT060010CA.Subject

Business name: has history

Shows how the status of the dispense has changed over time.

Dispense records can change status from 'active' to 'completed' or even 'aborted'. This allows providers to understand exactly when those changes took place.

typeCode : "SUBJ" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
controlActEvent : ControlActEvent1Pop
PORX_MT060010CA.Subject12

Business name: Notes Indicator

If true, indicates that there are notes associated with the device record.

Indicates whether there is information available on further drill-down.

This element behaves as a 'mandatory' element that is true if the association is present and false otherwise.

typeCode : "SUBJ" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
subsetCode : "SUM" (ActRelationshipSubset)1Mand
annotationIndicator : AnnotationIndicator1Pop
PORX_MT060010CA.Subject13

Business name: Issue Indicator

Indicates that there are issues associated with this record.

The presence of issues can be of clinical significance and may prompt a clinician to wish to drill down for further information.

This element behaves as a 'mandatory' element that is true if the association is present and false otherwise.

typeCode : "SUBJ" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
subsetCode : "SUM" (ActRelationshipSubset)1Mand
detectedIssueIndicator : DetectedIssueIndicator1Pop
PORX_MT060010CA.Subject6

Business name: k:managed

Detailed information indicating identified issues (permission problems, usage issues, duplicate therapy, age appropriateness, etc.) with the proposed prescription dispense, along with how the issues have been managed by the dispenser.

Allows a dispenser to override alerts and business rules, as well as providing a permanent record of management steps.

typeCode : "SUBJ" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
detectedIssueEvent : DetectedIssueEvent1Pop
PORX_MT060010CA.Subject7

Business name: k:includes

Indicates the various comments that providers have recorded about this dispense record.

Improves communication between providers by allowing a mechanism to exchange un-coded free-form information.

typeCode : "SUBJ" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
annotation : Annotation1Pop
PORX_MT060010CA.SupplyEvent
classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : (ActPharmacySupplyType)

Business name: Dispense Type

Indicates the type of dispensing event that is performed. Examples include: Trial Fill, Completion of Trial, Partial Fill, Emergency Fill, Samples, etc.

Indicates reason for the size of dispense. Because it defines what type of dispense is occurring, the attribute is mandatory.

DispensedItem.activityType

D52

ZDP.2

Claim.403-D3

Claim.343-HD

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: Dispense Processing and Pickup Date

Represents the date the dispense product was prepared and when the product was picked up by or delivered to the patient. The dispense processing date and pickup date can be back dated to reflect when the actual processing and pickup occurred. The lower-bound of the period signifies the dispense-processing date whereas the upper-bound signifies the dispense-pickup date.

Used by the system in calculating expected exhaustion time. Valuable in compliance checking. This attribute is mandatory because an existing dispense record must at least indicate the date it was processed.

ZPB3.9

ZDP.17 (high)

DRU.040-02 (low, qualifier=07, format=102)

DRU.040-02 (low, qualifier=36, format=102)

Dispense Date

DispensedItem.dispenseDate

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

1Mand
quantity : INT.POS

Business name: Dispensed Quantity

The number of devices that have been dispensed.

Critical in understanding the patient's profile, both past and current, This is also mandatory to allow determination of the amount that remains to be dispensed against the prescription.

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

DispensedItem.dispensedAmount

1Mand
expectedUseTime : IVL.WIDTH<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: Dispensed Days Supply

The number of days that the dispensed quantity is expected to last. Cannot be mandatory as there are some situations where 'as needed' cannot be used to determine days supply.

Useful in monitoring patient compliance. May also be useful in determining and managing certain contraindications ('Fill-Too-Soon', 'Fill-Too-Late', and 'Duration of Therapy'). Because 'Days Supply' may be necessary to compute total dispensed quantity, it is made a 'populated' field.

D59(width)

ZDP.11

DRU.040-02 (low, qualifier=ZDS, format=804)

PORX_MT060010CA.SupplyRequest

Business name: Prescription Reference

A reference to the prescription order being dispensed

Links a dispense with its parent prescription.

classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "RQO" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: Prescription Order Number

This is an identifier assigned to a specific device order. The number remains constant across the lifetime of the order, regardless of the number of providers or pharmacies involved in fulfilling the order.

Allows prescriptions to be uniquely referenced and associated with the dispense.

The ID is mandatory because the DIS will always assign a Prescription Order Number.

1Mand
responsibleParty : ResponsibleParty30-1Req
author : Author51Mand

statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
PORX_MT060020CA.Author2

Business name: *b:prescribed by

This is the provider who authorized the device to be dispensed to the patient.

To be a legal order, the person responsible for its creation must be identified. Thus the association is mandatory.

Prescription.Prescriber

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

typeCode : "AUT" (ParticipationType)1Mand
time : TS.FULLDATE

Business name: Prescription Order Date

The date at which the device was prescribed. This may differ from the date on which the prescription becomes effective. E.g. A prescription created today may not be valid to be dispensed or used for two weeks.

Indicates when the action was performed, and may influence expiry dates for the order.

The attribute is populated as it will not be there for inferred prescriptions.

PORX_MT060020CA.Component2

Business name: includes

Indicates the days supply and quantity of devices dispensed.

Dispense is not complete without specifying quantity dispensed, and thus this association is mandatory.

typeCode : "COMP" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
supplyEvent : SupplyEvent1Mand
PORX_MT060020CA.DetectedIssueIndicator

Business name: Issue Indicator

Indicates that there are issues associated with this prescription.

The presence of issues can be of clinical significance and may prompt a clinician to wish to drill down for further information.

This element behaves as a mandatory attribute which is true when the association is present and false when it is absent.

classCode : "ALRT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
PORX_MT060020CA.DeviceDispense

Business name: Dispense

Represents the dispensing of a device to a patient.

Communicates an overview of a patient's dispenses.

classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: A:Prescription Dispense Number

The Prescription Dispense Number is a globally unique number assigned to a dispense (single fill) by the EHR/DIS irrespective of the source of the dispense.

It is created by the EHR/DIS once the dispense has passed all edits and validation.

Allows for the referencing of a specific dispense record.

Identifier for a dispensed record is needed so that dispenses may be uniquely referenced. Thus the mandatory requirement.

1Mand
statusCode : (ActStatus)

Business name: C:Dispense Status

Indicates the status of the dispense record created on the EHR/DIS. If 'Active' it means that the dispense has been processed but not yet given to the patient. If 'Complete', it indicates that the medication has been delivered to the patient.

Important in understanding what medication the patient actually has on hand, thus the attribute is mandatory. May also influence the ability of a different pharmacy to dispense the medication.

1Mand
confidentialityCode : (x_VeryBasicConfidentialityKind)

Business name: E:Prescription Masking Indicator

Communicates the intent of the patient to restrict access to their prescriptions.

Provides support for additional confidentiality constraint, giving patients a level of control over their information.

Valid values are: 'NORMAL' (denotes 'Not Masked'); and 'RESTRICTED' (denotes 'Masked').

The default is 'NORMAL' signifying 'Not Masked'.

Allows the patient to have discrete control over access to their medication data.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

0-1Opt
responsibleParty : ResponsibleParty0-1Req
performer : Performer1Mand
location : Location1Mand
component : Component21Mand
fulfillment : InFulfillmentOf0-1Req
subjectOf1 : Subject40-1Req
subjectOf2 : Subject30-1Req

PORX_MT060030CA

PORX_MT060030CA.IssueFilterCode
value : (IssueFilterCode)

Business name: Issue Filter Code

Indicates whether records to be returned (e.g. prescription order, prescription dispense and/or other medication) should be filtered to those with at least one persistent un-managed issue (against the record), with at least one persistent issues or should return all records, independent of the presence of persistent issues.

By filtering returned records to include only those which have unmanaged issues or any issues at all, allows a provider to focus on those aspects of care where extra attention is needed. Because the attribute must be known, it is mandatory.

1Mand
PORX_MT060030CA.MostRecentByDeviceIndicator
value :

Business name: Most Recent By Device Indicator

Indicates whether or not the records are to be retrieved based on the most recent by Device Code. If true, only the most recent prescription or dispense or for the specified device type will be returned. The default is 'FALSE' indicating that retrieval of prescription and dispense records should not be limited to one per device type.

Helps decrease the volume of records returned, while still maintaining information on all devices that the patient is using.

The element is mandatory because the query recipient must know whether the value is true or false.

1Mand
PORX_MT060030CA.MostRecentDispenseForEachRxIndicator
value :

Business name: Most Recent Dispense for each Rx Indicator

Indicates whether or not prescription dispenses returned on a query should be limited to only the most recent dispense for a prescription order.

Allows for the returning of at most one prescription dispense record per a prescription.

The default is 'TRUE' indicating that retrieval should be for only the most recent dispense for a prescription is to be included in a query result.

Helps to trim down volume of query response by eliminating multiple prescription dispenses for the same prescription order.

The element is mandatory because the query recipient must know whether the value is true or false.

1Mand
PORX_MT060030CA.ParameterList

Business name: Generic Query Parameters

Defines the set of parameters that may be used to filter the query response.

Root class for query definition

issueFilterCode : IssueFilterCode1Mand
mostRecentByDeviceIndicator : MostRecentByDeviceIndicator1Mand
mostRecentDispenseForEachRxIndicator : MostRecentDispenseForEachRxIndicator1Mand
patientBirthDate : PatientBirthDate1Mand
patientGender : PatientGender1Mand
patientID : PatientID1Mand
patientName : PatientName1Mand
usageEffectivePeriod : UsageEffectivePeriod0-1Req
PORX_MT060030CA.PatientBirthDate
value : TS.DATE

Business name: Patient Birth Date

Indicates the date on which the patient was born.

Used to confirm the identity of the patient for the query and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
PORX_MT060030CA.PatientGender
value : (AdministrativeGender)

Business name: Patient Gender

Indicates the gender (sex) of the patient.

Used to confirm the identity of the patient for the query and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
PORX_MT060030CA.PatientID
value : II

Business name: B:Patient ID

Identifier of the patient who is the subject of the query. Filter the result set to include only those records pertaining to the patient with this Id.

Allows filtering of result set by patient Id. This is a mandatory field because a patient must be specified for the query to be valid

1Mand
PORX_MT060030CA.PatientName
value : PN.BASIC

Business name: C:Patient Name

The name of the patient who is the subject of the query.

Filter the result set to include only those records pertaining to the patient with this name.

Allows filtering of result set by patient name. This is a mandatory field because a patient name must match the patient Id for the query to be valid.

1Mand
PORX_MT060030CA.UsageEffectivePeriod
value : IVL<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: D:Usage Effective Period

Indicates the usage period for which the request/query applies.

Filter the result set to include only those records (prescription order and prescription dispense) for which the patient was deemed to be using the device within the specified period.

Allows the requester to specify the usage period of interest for the retrieval. Useful to avoid run-away queries.

1Mand
 
 

PORX_MT060040CA

PORX_MT060040CA.AnnotationIndicator
classCode : "ACT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
PORX_MT060040CA.Author

Business name: *refused by

Indicates who refused to fulfill the prescription

Allows follow-up and traceability of the refusal.

Association is mandatory as the provider refusing the fill must be known.

typeCode : "AUT" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "OP" (ContextControl)1Mand
assignedPerson : AssignedPerson1Mand
PORX_MT060040CA.Author1

Business name: *changed by

Identity of the health service provider or application responsible for the change in the prescription status.

In an EHR integrated health services environment, it is important that other providers are able to query who (or what application) is responsible for status changes. Also used by applications for auditing and sorting.

The attribute is mandatory because provider or application maintaining the prescription must be known.

PrescriptionStatus.provider

typeCode : "AUT" (ParticipationType)1Mand
time : TS.FULLDATETIME

Business name: Change Timestamp

The date on which the change was made.

Gives other providers the frame of reference in evaluating any post-change issues with the prescription. Also used for sorting and audit purposes.

This attribute is marked as "mandatory" as the time the comment was posted will always be known.

PrescriptionStatus.effectiveDate

1Mand

PORX_MT060040CA.Author4

Business name: *b:prescribed by

This is the provider who authorized the device to be dispensed to the patient.

To be a legal order, the person responsible for its creation must be identified. Thus the association is mandatory.

Prescription.Prescriber

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

typeCode : "AUT" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AP" (ContextControl)1Mand
time : TS.FULLDATE

Business name: Prescribed Date

The date at which the device was prescribed. This may differ from the date on which the prescription becomes effective. E.g. A prescription created today may not be valid to be dispensed or used for two weeks.

Indicates when the action was performed, and may influence expiry dates for the order.

The attribute is populated because the creation date of the prescription will always be known, except for inferred prescriptions.

Prescription.prescribedDate

Date prescription written

ZDP.8

DRU.040-02 (low, qualifier=85, format=102)

DRU.040-02 (low, qualifier=LO, format=102, where filter type = most recent)

Claim:414-DE

1Pop
modeCode : (ParticipationMode)

Business name: Prescription Transmission Method

Indicates the medium in which a prescription was transmitted to or received by the person who entered it into the electronic record.

Some jurisdictions have a requirement to track how an order was received. May also be important when orders are entered into a central repository from the pharmacy.

ZDP.4

Claim.419-DJ

0-1Req
signatureText : ED.SIGNATURE

Business name: Signature

An electronic signature of the prescription by the prescriber.

Allows for pure electronic prescriptions without a trusted intermediary. The attribute is optional because all jurisdictions may not support digital signatures.

Signature

PORX_MT060040CA.Component2

contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand

PORX_MT060040CA.Component6

Business name: f:includes

Identifies the instructions for how the prescribed device should be dispensed to the patient.

An essential part of most prescriptions is the authorization to dispense.

typeCode : "COMP" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
supplyRequest : SupplyRequest1Pop
PORX_MT060040CA.ControlActEvent

Business name: Status Changes

This records the history of changes that have been made to the prescription, including why the changes were made, who made them and when.

Provides an audit trail of a patient's therapy adjustments. Status changes may affect evaluations of compliance.

classCode : "CACT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : (HL7TriggerEventCode)

Business name: Change Type

Identifies what kind of change occurred. Examples include Suspended, Superseded, Released, Aborted (stopped), etc.

This attribute is mandatory to ensure that change types are distinguishable.

Distinguishes discontinueStatus, holdStatus, reactivateStatus and releaseStatus

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: Change Effective Period

The date on which the various status changes of a prescription become valid and applicable. In the case of a suspend, may also indicate the scheduled time at which the status change will end.

Allows applications to sort and filter by time.

The effective date can be defaulted to change date, and thus is mandatory.

PrescriptionStatus.initialEndDate

PrescriptionStatus.actualEndDate

Prescription.cancelTime

Prescription.holdReleaseDate

Prescription.holdStartDate

Prescription.modificationTime

Prescription.stopDate

Prescription.reactivateDate

ZPB3.14(when code is discontinued)

1Mand
reasonCode : (ControlActReason)

Business name: Change Reason

Denotes the reason the status of the prescription was changed.

Ensures consistent terminology in capturing and interpreting reasons for change. Allows CWE because not all reasons will correspond to a pre-defined code.

PrescriptionStatus.reason(mnemonic)

PrescriptionStatus.adhocReason(originalText)

0-1Req
responsibleParty : ResponsibleParty40-1Req
author : Author11Mand
PORX_MT060040CA.Coverage

Business name: Coverage Extensions

An authorization issued by a payor to cover a device not previously covered by a patient's drug plan.

Allows conveying special coverage information between providers.

classCode : "COV" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : (x_ActMoodOrderEvent)

Business name: Extension Granted Indicator

If set to 'EVN', then coverage has been granted. Otherwise it has merely been requested.

Indicates to the pharmacy whether they need to check the status of coverage prior to dispensing. Mandatory due to HL7 rules.

1Mand
id : II

Business name: A:Coverage Extension Id

Unique identification for a specific coverage extension.

Allows for referencing of a specific coverage extension.

This identifier may be needed on claims against the coverage.

At times when the ID will not be available (such as when the request has just been submitted), the attribute is 'populated'.

D64

Claim.462-EV

ZDP.23.3

Authorization identifier

1Pop
author : Author21Mand
PORX_MT060040CA.Coverage2

Business name: h:includes

Indicates any extensions to the patient's insurance coverage that have been solicited by the prescriber, including indications of whether the requested extension was granted.

An authorization issued by a payor to cover a device not previously covered by a patient's drug plan.

Helps streamline communication from prescriber to pharmacy by informing the pharmacy of whether an extension has already been requested, and if so, what the status is.

typeCode : "COVBY" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
coverage : Coverage1Pop
PORX_MT060040CA.DerivedFrom

Business name: Inferred Indicator

If true, indicates that the data associated with the prescription is uncertain because the existence of the prescription has been inferred from a secondary source (e.g. dispensing data).

Distinguishes electronic records which reflect exactly what was ordered from orders that merely mimic what was dispensed and therefore can't be used for information about ordering patterns. Because it must always be known how an order was captured, this attribute is mandatory.

typeCode : "DRIV" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
sourceDispense : SourceDispense1Pop
PORX_MT060040CA.Destination1

Identifies the location where the dispensed product is to be shipped, at the request of the patient or provider.

Used when the device cannot/will not be picked up from the dispenser in person.

typeCode : "DST" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "OP" (ContextControl)1Mand

PORX_MT060040CA.DetectedIssueEvent

Business name: Issues

Describes an issue associated with a prescription that resulted in a dispenser refusing to fill it.

Allows a dispenser to assert an issue against a prescription to be displayed to subsequent dispensers as well as others reviewing the patient's medication profile.

classCode : "ALRT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : (ActDetectedIssueCode)

Business name: A:Issue Type

A coded value that is used to distinguish between different kinds of issues. Types of issue include: unrecognized identifiers, permission issues, drug-drug contraindications, drug-allergy alerts, duplicate therapies, suspect fraud etc.

Identifies what kind of issue was detected or is being managed.

This is mandatory so as to ensure that one issue type can be distinguished from another.

1Mand
text :

Business name: B:Issue Comment

A free form textual description regarding the issue of fraudulence. This may be specified in place of, or in addition to the coded issue.

Enables extra or more detailed description of the alert

0-1Req
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
PORX_MT060040CA.DetectedIssueIndicator
classCode : "ALRT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
PORX_MT060040CA.DeviceDispense

Business name: Prescription Dispenses

This is the detailed information about a device dispense that has been performed on behalf of a patient.

Dispensing is an integral part of the overall prescription process.

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

Reported Issue is only permitted if Issue Indicator is not present

Annotation is only permitted if Annotation Indicator is not present

classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: A:Prescription Dispense Number

The Prescription Dispense Number is a globally unique number assigned to a dispense (single fill) by the EHR/DIS irrespective of the source of the dispense.

It is created by the EHR/DIS once the dispense has passed all edits and validation.

Allows for the referencing of a specific dispense record.

Identifier for a dispensed record is needed so that dispenses may be uniquely referenced. Thus the mandatory requirement.

DispensedItem.dispensedItemKey

DispensedItem.externalKey

D53(ID for the prescription assigned by pharmacy)

D55(ID for the dispense event)

D99.01

ZDP.5

ZDP.6

ZDP.22

ZRV.5

DRU.080-01(extension)

DRU.080-02(route)

Claim.455-EM (route)

Claim.402-D2 (extension)

Claim.456-EN

Claim.454-EK

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

1Mand
statusCode : (ActStatus)

Business name: Dispense Status

Indicates the status of the dispense record created on the EHR/DIS. If 'Active' it means that the dispense has been processed but not yet given to the patient. If 'Complete', it indicates that the device has been delivered to the patient.

Important in understanding what devices the patient actually has on hand, thus the attribute is mandatory. May also influence the ability of a different pharmacy to dispense the device.

1Mand
responsibleParty : ResponsibleParty30-1Req
performer : Performer31Mand

subjectOf5 : Subject70-99Req
PORX_MT060040CA.DeviceRequest

Business name: Prescription

Information pertaining to a Prescriber's authorization for a device to be dispensed to a patient, as well as the instruction on when and how the device is to be used by the patient.

This is a 'core' class of the medication model and is important for understanding what devices the patient is intended to be receiving.

Reported Issue is only permitted if Issue Indicator is not present and vice versa.

Annotation is only permitted if Annotation Indicator is not present and vice versa

classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "RQO" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: A:Prescription Order Number

The Prescription Order Number is a globally unique number assigned to a prescription by the EHR/DIS irrespective of the source of the order

It is created by the EHR/DIS once the prescription has passed all edits and validation.

Allows prescriptions to be uniquely referenced.

The number is mandatory to allow every prescription record to be uniquely identified.

Prescription.prescriptionNumber

Prescription.prescriptionExternalKey

D53(ID for the prescription assigned by pharmacy)

D55(ID for the dispense event)

D99.01

X0101(id for prescription)

ZDP.22

DRU.080-01(extension)

Claim.455-EM (route)

Claim.402-D2 (extension)

Claim.456-EN

Claim.454-EK

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

1Mand
statusCode : (ActStatus)

Business name: C:Prescription Status

This denotes the state of the prescription in the lifecycle of the prescription. Valid statuses are: NEW, ACTIVE, SUSPENDED, ABORTED, COMPLETED, OBSOLETE and NULLIFIED.

Indicates what actions are allowed to be performed against a prescription.

This is a mandatory field because every prescription needs to be in some state.

Prescription.state (cannot distinguish between 'Filled' and 'Unfilled', must look at amounts dispensed to distniguish between those; and also cannot distinguish modified, need to look at event history).

Prescription Status

1Mand
confidentialityCode : (x_VeryBasicConfidentialityKind)

Business name: F:Prescription Masking Indicator

Communicates the intent of the patient to restrict access to their prescriptions.

Provides support for additional confidentiality constraint, giving patients a level of control over their information.

Valid values are: 'NORMAL' (denotes 'Not Masked'); and 'RESTRICTED' (denotes 'Masked').

The default is 'NORMAL' signifying 'Not Masked'.

Allows the patient to have discrete control over access to their prescription data.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

Prescription.masked

0-1Opt

subject : Subject51Mand

PORX_MT060040CA.Precondition

Business name: Non-authoritative Indicator

If true, indicates that the prescription is non-authoritative. I.e. A paper copy must be viewed before the prescription can be dispensed.

Allows distinguishing prescriptions where the paper copy is authoritative vs. the electronic copy being authoritative.

This attribute behaves as a 'mandatory' element where the presence of the association indicates that a paper prescription is needed and the absence of the association indicates that one is not.

typeCode : "PRCN" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand

PORX_MT060040CA.PriorSupplyRequest

This is the original prescription that is being renewed. The current prescription uses the original prescription as the basis for its information.

Helps link prescriptions together, and subsequently indications for prescribing.
