PORX_MT060160CA.Component

Business name: includes

Indicates the days supply and quantity of medication dispensed.

Dispense is not complete without specifying quantity dispensed, and thus this association is mandatory.

typeCode : "COMP" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
supplyEvent : SupplyEvent1Mand
PORX_MT060160CA.Component1

Business name: e:to be administered according to

The Prescriber's instruction(s) for the administration of the medication.

This information is needed for a prescription to be valid and is therefore mandatory. Multiple repetitions are supported for circumstances where a single therapy involves the administration of multiple drugs. E.g. Canesten 3 DouPak.

typeCode : "COMP" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
dosageInstruction : DosageInstruction1Mand
PORX_MT060160CA.Component11

Business name: f:administered according to

Indicates how the drug is to be consumed by the patient.

It is important to understand the specific instructions that were provided to the patient. Therefore, the association is mandatory.

typeCode : "COMP" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
dosageInstruction : DosageInstruction1Mand
PORX_MT060160CA.Component13

Business name: g:performs

Indicates whether or not substitution was made as part of the prescription dispense.

Must be consistent with substitution directive from the prescription.

typeCode : "COMP" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "OP" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
substitutionMade : SubstitutionMade1Pop
PORX_MT060160CA.Component2

Business name: G:Not eligible for Trial?

Indicates that a prescription is part of a Trial Program.

Serves as reminder for dispenser to consider option of part-filling. In some jurisdictions, the prescription must be so designated by the prescriber for the dispenser to do trial dispensing.

The element is mandatory because eligibility must be either true or false.

typeCode : "COMP" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
negationInd :

Business name: Not Eligible for Trial?

An indication that a prescription is or is not eligible for trial dispensing from a clinical (not financial) perspective. False = Eligible, True = Not Eligible.

May affect dispensers' discretion to dispense anything other than prescribed fill quantity.

Expressed as 'Non-Eligibility' rather than 'Eligibility' due to restrictions in HL7 modeling.

The attribute is mandatory as it must be known whether it is true or false.

1Mand
trialSupplyPermission : TrialSupplyPermission1Mand
PORX_MT060160CA.Component3

Business name: g:includes

Identifies the instructions for how the prescribed medication should be dispensed to the patient.

An essential part of most prescriptions is the authorization to dispense. Multiple repetitions are included to accommodate circumstances where multiple drug products may need to be dispensed to complete a therapy. E.g. 100 x 20mg tablets and 50 x 10mg tablets. The association is marked as Populated because the authorization to dispense is a critical portion of a prescription. However the association is allowed to be 'null' when the order is for a medication which requires no dispense authorization (e.g. over-the-counter medications), or when the patient already has sufficient supply of the medication on hand to complete the therapy.

typeCode : "COMP" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
supplyRequestItem : SupplyRequestItem1Pop
PORX_MT060160CA.Component4

Business name: classifies

Indicates the clinical use category in which the prescription has been put.

Allows prescriptions to be categorized in multiple ways.

Attribute is marked "populated' to ensure that an item on the medication profile is categorized or 'null' value specified.

typeCode : "COMP" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
workingListEvent : WorkingListEvent1Pop
PORX_MT060160CA.Component5

Business name: i:administered according to

Indicates how the drug is to be consumed by the patient.

When available, it is important to understand the specific instructions that were provided to the patient.

typeCode : "COMP" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
dosageInstruction : DosageInstruction1Pop
PORX_MT060160CA.Component6

Business name: f:includes

Identifies the instructions for how the prescribed medication should be dispensed to the patient.

An essential part of most prescriptions is the authorization to dispense. Multiple repetitions are included to accommodate circumstances where multiple drug products may need to be dispensed to complete a therapy. E.g. 100 x 20mg tablets and 50 x 10mg tablets. The association is marked as Populated because the authorization to dispense is a critical portion of a prescription. However the association is allowed to be 'null' when the order is for a medication which requires no dispense authorization (e.g. over-the-counter medications), or when the patient already has sufficient supply of the medication on hand to complete the therapy.

typeCode : "COMP" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
supplyRequest : SupplyRequest1Pop
PORX_MT060160CA.Component7

Business name: a:includes

Indicates the date and quantity for the first dispense on the prescription, as well as count-down of refills dispensed.

Used in case of trial prescription or in situations where the first fill may be different from subsequent fills for administrative or non-clinical reasons (e.g. to align the refill dates of a series of prescriptions).

typeCode : "COMP" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
sequenceNumber : "1" INT.POS1Mand
initialSupplyRequest : InitialSupplyRequest1Pop
PORX_MT060160CA.Component8

Business name: has

Indicates the number of refills permitted on the prescription.

Used for compliance checking

typeCode : "COMP" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
sequenceNumber : "2" INT.POS1Mand
subsequentSupplyRequest : SubsequentSupplyRequest1Mand
PORX_MT060160CA.Consumable2

Business name: *c:administered

Identifies the other active medication being recorded into the system as being taken by the patient.

The drug is the key part of the administration record, and is therefore mandatory.

typeCode : "CSM" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "OP" (ContextControl)1Mand
medication : Medication1Mand
PORX_MT060160CA.ControlActEvent

Business name: Status Changes

This records the history of changes that have been made to the prescription, including why the changes were made, who made them and when.

Provides an audit trail of a patient's therapy adjustments. Status changes may affect evaluations of compliance.

classCode : "CACT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : (HL7TriggerEventCode)

Business name: Change Type

Identifies what kind of change occurred. Examples include Suspended, Superseded, Released, Aborted (stopped), etc.

This attribute is mandatory to ensure that change types are distinguishable.

Distinguishes discontinueStatus, holdStatus, reactivateStatus and releaseStatus

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: Change Effective Period

The date on which the various status changes of a prescription become valid and applicable. In the case of a suspend, may also indicate the scheduled time at which the status change will end.

Allows applications to sort and filter by time.

The effective date can be defaulted to change date, and thus is mandatory.

PrescriptionStatus.initialEndDate

PrescriptionStatus.actualEndDate

Prescription.cancelTime

Prescription.holdReleaseDate

Prescription.holdStartDate

Prescription.modificationTime

Prescription.stopDate

Prescription.reactivateDate

ZPB3.14(when code is discontinued)

1Mand
reasonCode : (ControlActReason)

Business name: Change Reason

Denotes the reason the status of the prescription was changed.

Ensures consistent terminology in capturing and interpreting reasons for change. Allows CWE because not all reasons will correspond to a pre-defined code.

PrescriptionStatus.reason(mnemonic)

PrescriptionStatus.adhocReason(originalText)

0-1Req
responsibleParty : ResponsibleParty60-1Req
author : Author11Mand
PORX_MT060160CA.Coverage

Business name: Coverage Extensions

An authorization issued by a payor to cover a drug not previously covered by a patient's drug plan.

Allows conveying special coverage information between providers.

classCode : "COV" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : (x_ActMoodOrderEvent)

Business name: Extension Granted Indicator

If set to 'EVN', then coverage has been requested. Otherwise it has merely been requested.

Indicates to the pharmacy whether they need to check the status of coverage prior to dispensing. Mandatory due to HL7 rules.

1Mand
id : II

Business name: A:Coverage Extension Id

Unique identification for a specific coverage extension.

Allows for referencing of a specific coverage extension.

This identifier may be needed on claims against the coverage.

At times when the ID will not be available (such as when the request has just been submitted), the attribute is 'populated'.

1Pop
author : Author21Mand
PORX_MT060160CA.Coverage2

Business name: h:includes

Indicates any extensions to the patient's insurance coverage that have been solicited by the prescriber, including indications of whether the requested extension was granted.

Helps streamline communication from prescriber to pharmacy by informing the pharmacy of whether an extension has already been requested, and if so, what the status is.

typeCode : "COVBY" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
coverage : Coverage1Pop
PORX_MT060160CA.Definition

Business name: references

Enables the communication of a reference to a protocol, study or guideline id, specific to the jurisdiction

Provides support for non-traditional therapies. Needed when seeking to prescribe “Special Access” medications. E.g. Ontario Limited Use program.

Supporting references

typeCode : "INST" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
substanceAdministrationDefinition : SubstanceAdministrationDefinition1Pop
PORX_MT060160CA.DerivedFrom

Business name: Inferred Indicator

If true, indicates that the data associated with the prescription is uncertain because the existence of the prescription has been inferred from a secondary source (e.g. dispensing data).

Distinguishes electronic records which reflect exactly what was ordered from orders that merely mimic what was dispensed and therefore can't be used for information about ordering patterns. Because it must always be known how an order was captured, this attribute is mandatory.

typeCode : "DRIV" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
sourceDispense : SourceDispense1Pop
PORX_MT060160CA.Destination1

Business name: to be shipped to

Identifies the location where the dispensed product is to be shipped, at the request of the patient or provider.

Used when the medication cannot/will not be picked up from the dispenser in person.

typeCode : "DST" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "OP" (ContextControl)1Mand
serviceDeliveryLocation : ServiceDeliveryLocation21Pop
PORX_MT060160CA.Destination2

Business name: shipped-to Address

Indicates where the dispensed product was sent.

Important as part of a claim for justifying shipping charges.

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

typeCode : "DST" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
serviceDeliveryLocation : ServiceDeliveryLocation1Pop
PORX_MT060160CA.DetectedIssueEvent

Business name: Issues

Describes an issue associated with a prescription that resulted in a dispenser refusing to fill it.

Allows a dispenser to assert an issue against a prescription to be displayed to subsequent dispensers as well as others reviewing the patient's medication profile.

classCode : "ALRT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : (ActDetectedIssueCode)

Business name: Issue Type

A coded value that is used to distinguish between different kinds of issues. Types of issue include: unrecognized identifiers, permission issues, drug-drug contraindications, drug-allergy alerts, duplicate therapies, suspect fraud etc.

Identifies what kind of issue was detected or is being managed.

This is mandatory so as to ensure that one issue type can be distinguished from another.

1Mand
text :

Business name: Issue Comment

A free form textual description regarding the issue of fraudulence. This may be specified in place of, or in addition to the coded issue.

Enables extra or more detailed description of the alert

0-1Req
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
PORX_MT060160CA.DetectedIssueIndicator
classCode : "ALRT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
PORX_MT060160CA.DirectTarget

Indicates the medication that has been prescribed (or inferred from a dispense) to the patient.

This is a key aspect of the prescription.

Because drug is sometimes pre-coordinated into code by SNOMED, this associaiton is only 'required'.

Association is mandatory when not using SNOMED

typeCode : "DIR" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "OP" (ContextControl)1Mand
medication : Medication1Pop

typeCode : "FLFS" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand

PORX_MT060160CA.InitialSupplyRequest

Business name: First Fill

Special instructions regarding the very first supply of medication to a patient.

Allows a different amount to be dispensed on an initial fill, either as a trial or to synchronize refill dates across multiple patient prescriptions

classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "RQO" (ActMood)1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL.HIGH<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: First Fill Expiry Date

The date before which an initial dispense can be made against the prescription. If an initial fill has not been made against the prescription in this time-period, it may not be dispensed.

Some jurisdictions have distinct stale-date periods for the initial fill of a prescription from the overall dispensing of the prescription. E.g. "The first fill must be made within 1 year, all fills must be complete within 1.5 years". (This attribute would be used for the "1 year".)

0-1Req
quantity : PQ.DRUG

Business name: First Fill Quantity

The quantity of medication to be dispensed the first time the prescription is dispensed against.

Allows a limited quantity to be dispensed for a trial or for a synchronizing dose.

Prescription.coordinatingAmount

0-1Req
expectedUseTime : IVL.WIDTH<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: First Fill Days Supply

The number of days that the first fill is expected to last, if the patient is compliant with the dispensing of the first fill and with administration of the prescription.

Used when the prescriber cannot or does not wish to calculate the quantity necessary to last for the trial or synchronization time.

0-1Req
PORX_MT060160CA.Location

Business name: *d:dispensed from

Indicates the facility/location where the dispensing was performed.

Important for performing follow-up and therefore mandatory.

typeCode : "LOC" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "OP" (ContextControl)1Mand
serviceDeliveryLocation : ServiceDeliveryLocation1Mand
PORX_MT060160CA.Location2

Business name: *recorded at

Indicates the facility/location where the other active medication was recorded.

Important for performing follow-up and is therefore mandatory.

typeCode : "LOC" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "OP" (ContextControl)1Mand
serviceDeliveryLocation : ServiceDeliveryLocation1Mand
PORX_MT060160CA.Location3

Business name: *prescribed at

Indicates the clinic or facility which originally issued the prescription.

Identifies where paper records are likely located for follow-up. This is marked as 'populated' because it won't always be known for 'inferred prescriptions.

typeCode : "LOC" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "OP" (ContextControl)1Mand
serviceDeliveryLocation : ServiceDeliveryLocation1Pop
PORX_MT060160CA.Location4

Business name: *refused at

Identifies the location where the refusal occurred

Allows follow-up and traceability of the refusal.

Association is mandatory as the dispensing facility refusing the fill must be known.

typeCode : "LOC" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "OP" (ContextControl)1Mand
serviceDeliveryLocation : ServiceDeliveryLocation1Mand
PORX_MT060160CA.Location5

Business name: *c:targeted to pharmacy

Indicates the pharmacy to which the prescription has been directed or which has currently assumed responsibility for dispensing the prescription.

Allows prescriptions to be directed on the request of the patient or by legal requirement. Also allows indication of which pharmacy is the current 'custodian' of the prescription.

This should always be known or should have an explicit null flavor of 'NA' (non-assigned) or 'UNK' (paper prescription). Thus the association is 'populated'.

Prescription.facility

typeCode : "LOC" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "OP" (ContextControl)1Mand
time : IVL.LOW<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: To be picked up when

The date and time on which the dispense is expected to be picked up.

Allows a prescriber to indicate to the targeted pharmacy, when patient will be expecting to pick up the dispensed medication.

0-1Req
substitutionConditionCode : (x_SubstitutionConditionNoneOrUnconditional)

Business name: Assigned Facility Not Reassignable Indicator

Indicates whether a dispenser to whom the prescription is targeted is a mandated or patient-preferred pharmacy.

Influences whether the prescription may be transferred to a service delivery location other than the targeted dispenser.

0-1Req
serviceDeliveryLocation : ServiceDeliveryLocation1Pop
PORX_MT060160CA.MedicationDispense

Business name: Prescription Dispenses

This is the detailed information about a medication dispense that has been performed on behalf of a patient.

Dispensing is an integral part of the overall medication process.

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

Reported Issue is only permitted if Issue Indicator is not present and vice versa

Annotation is only permitted if Annotation Indicator is not present and vice versa

classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: A:Prescription Dispense Number

The Prescription Dispense Number is a globally unique number assigned to a dispense (single fill) by the EHR/DIS irrespective of the source of the dispense.

It is created by the EHR/DIS once the dispense has passed all edits and validation.

Allows for the referencing of a specific dispense record.

Identifier for a dispensed record is needed so that dispenses may be uniquely referenced. Thus the mandatory requirement.

DispensedItem.dispensedItemKey

DispensedItem.externalKey

D53(ID for the prescription assigned by pharmacy)

D55(ID for the dispense event)

D99.01

ZDP.5

ZDP.6

ZDP.22

ZRV.5

DRU.080-01(extension)

DRU.080-02(route)

Claim.455-EM (route)

Claim.402-D2 (extension)

Claim.456-EN

Claim.454-EK

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

1Mand
statusCode : (ActStatus)

Business name: C:Dispense Status

Indicates the status of the dispense record created on the EHR/DIS. If “Active” it means that the dispense has been processed but not yet given to the patient. If “Complete”, it indicates that the medication has been delivered to the patient.

Important in understanding what medication the patient actually has on hand, thus the attribute is mandatory. May also influence the ability of a different pharmacy to dispense the medication.

1Mand
responsibleParty : ResponsibleParty30-1Req
performer : Performer31Mand
location : Location1Mand
component1 : Component1Mand
component2 : Component111-10Mand
component3 : Component130-1Req
subjectOf1 : Subject0-20Req
subjectOf2 : Subject120-1Req
subjectOf3 : Subject130-1Req

PORX_MT060160CA.MedicationRecord
Implementations of PORX_MT060160CA.MedicationRecord :
 »»  CombinedMedicationRequest
 »»  OtherMedication
PORX_MT060160CA.OtherMedication

Business name: Other Medications

A record of a medication the patient is believed to be taking, but for which an electronic order does not exist. 'Other medications' include any drug product deemed relevant to the patient's drug profile, but which was not specifically ordered by a prescriber in a DIS-enabled jurisdiction. Examples include over-the counter medications that were not specifically ordered, herbal remedies, and recreational drugs. Prescription drugs that the patient may be taking but was not prescribed on the EHR (e.g. institutionally administered or out-of-jurisdiction prescriptions) will also be recorded here.

Necessary component of a person's overall medication profile. Allows DUR checking against a more complete drug profile.

routeCode must not be used when code is SNOMED and is mandatory otherwise

Status can only be ‘ACTIVE’ or ‘COMPLETED’

Reported Issue is only permitted if Issue Indicator is not present and vice versa

Annotation is only permitted if Annotation Indicator is not present and vice versa

classCode : "SBADM" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: A:Administration Record Id

This is an identifier assigned to a unique instance of an other medication record.

Allows for the unique referencing of a specific active medication record. Thus the mandatory requirement. .

1Mand
code : CD (ActCode)

Business name: Other Medication Type

Indicates that the record is a drug administration rather than an immunization or other type of administration. For SNOMED, may also include route, drug and other information.

Needed to convey the meaning of this class and is therefore mandatory.

The element allows 'CD' to provide support for SNOMED.

Must be 'DRUG' unless using SNOMED

1Mand
statusCode : (ActStatus)

Business name: B:Other Medication Status

Indicates the status of the other medication record created on the EHR/DIS. Valid statuses for other medication records are: ACTIVE, COMPLETE.

Used to determine whether the medication should be considered in performing DUR checking.

Attribute is mandatory to ensure that a medication recorded in EHR/DIS is in some state.

Note ------ The provider might know that the patient is not taking the medication but not necessarily when the patient stopped it. Thus the status of the medication could be set to 'COMPLETED' by the provider without necessarily setting an End Date on the medication record.

1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL<TS.DATE>

Business name: C:Drug Active Period

Indicates the time-period in which the patient has been taking or is expected to be taking the other medication.

Used to indicate help determine whether the medication is currently active. Because this information won't always be available, the attribute is marked as 'populated'.

ZDP.13.2.2

ZDP.13.3

ZDP.13.4

ZDP.13.5

1Pop
confidentialityCode : (x_VeryBasicConfidentialityKind)

Business name: D:Other Medication Masking Indicator

Denotes access restriction place on the other active medication record. Methods for accessing masked active medications will be governed by each jurisdiction (e.g. court orders, shared secret/consent, etc.).

Provides support for additional confidentiality constraint to reflect the wishes of the patient.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

0-1Opt
routeCode : (RouteOfAdministration)

Business name: E:Route of Administration

This is the means by which the patient is taking the medication.

Ensures consistency in description of routes. Provides potential for cross-checking dosage form and route. Because this information is pre-coordinated into 'code' for SNOMED, it is marked as optional.

RXR.1

Route of administration

0-1Opt
subject : Subject101Mand
consumable : Consumable21Mand
responsibleParty : ResponsibleParty40-1Req
author : Author1Mand
location : Location21Mand
component : Component50-10Req
subjectOf1 : Subject110-20Req
subjectOf2 : Subject90-1Req
subjectOf3 : Subject140-99Req
subjectOf4 : Subject150-1Req
subjectOf5 : Subject170-25Req
PORX_MT060160CA.Performer3

Business name: *c:dispensed by

Identification of the provider who dispensed the medication.

Important for tracking responsibility and for following up. This is an essential part of the record, and therefore is mandatory.

typeCode : "PRF" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "OP" (ContextControl)1Mand
assignedPerson : AssignedPerson1Mand
PORX_MT060160CA.PertinentInformation

Business name: g:includes

Indicates other patient information that is an important consideration for the prescription. This information is limited to height and weight.

Allows patient height and weight to be conveyed to the pharmacy for dosage calculation or verification.

The additional repetitions are to allow for capturing of additional concepts beyond height and weight without impacting the message structure should future versions of the specification allow.

Medical History

typeCode : "PERT" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
quantityObservationEvent : QuantityObservationEvent1Pop
PORX_MT060160CA.Precondition

Business name: Non-authoritative Indicator

If true, indicates that the prescription is non-authoritative. I.e. A paper copy must be viewed before the prescription can be dispensed.

Allows distinguishing prescriptions where the paper copy is authoritative vs. the electronic copy being authoritative.

This attribute behaves as a 'mandatory' element where the presence of the association indicates that a paper prescription is needed and the absence of the association indicates that one is not.

typeCode : "PRCN" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
verificationEventCriterion : VerificationEventCriterion1Pop
PORX_MT060160CA.Predecessor
typeCode : "SUCC" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
priorCombinedMedicationRequest : PriorCombinedMedicationRequest1Pop
PORX_MT060160CA.PriorCombinedMedicationRequest

Business name: Parent Prescription

This is the original prescription that is being renewed. The current prescription uses the original prescription as the basis for its information.

Helps link prescriptions together, and subsequently indications for prescribing.

classCode : "SBADM" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "RQO" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: B:Previous Prescription Order Number

A reference to a previous prescription which the current prescription replaces.

Allows a prescription renewal (this prescription) to note the previous prescription id that was renewed;

Allows tracking a therapy across multiple renewal prescriptions.

New or Repeat (if present, then Repeat)

1Mand
code : "DRUG" (ActCode)1Mand
PORX_MT060160CA.Product1

Business name: b:orders dispense of

Identifies the drug to be supplied.

Allows for multiple drugs of the same generic with different strengths to be dispensed to form a single therapy. For example, “Dispense 100 x Drug A (5mg) and 200 x Drug B (10mg)”

typeCode : "PRD" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "OP" (ContextControl)1Mand
medication : Medication1Pop
PORX_MT060160CA.Product2

Business name: *e:dispensed

Identifies the product that was dispensed. Also provides information on compound ingredients and instructions and packaging requirements.

Identifies the drug as part of the patient's medication profile. The drug is one of the most important parts of the dispense record, and it is therefore mandatory.

typeCode : "PRD" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
medication : Medication1Mand
PORX_MT060160CA.QuantityObservationEvent

Business name: Prescription Patient Measurements

This comprises the height and/or weight of a patient as measured/observed/known by the prescriber at the time of prescribing.

Allows patient height and weight to be conveyed to the pharmacy for dosage calculation or verification

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : (x_ActObservationHeightOrWeight)

Business name: Prescription Patient Measurement Type

Identification of the type of observation that was made about the patient. The only two allowable types are height and weight.

Distinguishes height from weight.

Code is mandatory to ensure that measurements/observations are distinguishable.

OBS.010-01

Clinical.495-H2

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
effectiveTime : TS.FULLDATE

Business name: Prescription Patient Measurement Time

The date on which the measurement was made.

Allows provider to evaluate currency of the information.

The attribute is populated because the measurement time must be known or a null flavor must be specified.

OBS.010-04

Clinical.494-ZE

Clinical.495-H1

1Pop
value : PQ.HEIGHTWEIGHT

Business name: Prescription Patient Measured Value

The amount (quantity and unit) that has been recorded for the patient's height and/or weight. E.g. height in meters, weight in kilograms, etc.

Provides comparable representation of the measurement. May be used in calculations.

The attribute is mandatory because the measurement value must be known.

OBS.010-02 (quantity)

Clinical.595-H4 (value)

Clinical.495-H3 (unit)

1Mand
PORX_MT060160CA.Reason

Business name: because of

Identifies an issue as the reason for recording a refusal to fill against a prescription.

Allows a dispenser to point to an issue of 'drug-drug contraindication' for instance, as the reason for recording a 'refusal to fill' against a prescription.

typeCode : "RSON" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
detectedIssueEvent : DetectedIssueEvent1Pop
PORX_MT060160CA.Reason2

Business name: d:prescribed because of

Denotes the reason(s) for this specific prescription; it must not be interpreted as a permanent diagnosis.

Helps providers evaluate the appropriateness of the dosage instructions for the medication, and may influence education or literature provided to the patient on the use of the medication.

Provided at the discretion of the prescriber to enhance patient care. E.g., take 1 tab bid for migraine. Also needed for drug-disease interaction checking software to work properly.

This field is marked as populated because of its high clinical importance, however 'Nulls' are allowed because the individual recording the prescription (e.g. pharmacist) may not be aware of the indication or the prescriber may choose to withhold (mask) the information due to patient sensitivity.

typeCode : "RSON" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
priorityNumber : INT.POS

Business name: B:Indication Priority

Ordering of prescribing indications from primary indication (low number) to minor indication (higher number). Multiple indications are permitted to have the same priority if they're considered of equivalent importance.

Allows providers to indicate whether indication is the primary or secondary target of the therapy. E.g., Terazosin for Benign Prostatic Hypertrophy as primary and Hypertension as secondary or vice-versa.

0-1Req
Choice: indications : Indications1Pop
 »»  observationDiagnosis : ObservationDiagnosis0-1Opt
 »»  observationSymptom : ObservationSymptom0-1Opt
 »»  otherIndication : OtherIndication0-1Opt
PORX_MT060160CA.Receiver

Business name: *d:to be released to

Identifies the person(s) other than the patient, who are authorized to pick up the medication.

Used when patient is not in a position to pick up medication and when alternate receivers must be specifically authorized (e.g. for narcotics).

Repetitions are specified to allow for any one of multiple agents of the patient (e.g. Mother, Father, Cousin, Friend, etc) to be designated as allowed to pick up dispensed drugs.

typeCode : "RCV" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "OP" (ContextControl)1Mand
responsibleParty : ResponsibleParty1Pop
PORX_MT060160CA.Receiver2

Business name: i:picked up by

Identifies the person who picked up the dispensed product for the patient.

Used when patient is not in a position to pick up medication.

typeCode : "RCV" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
responsibleParty : ResponsibleParty1Pop
PORX_MT060160CA.RefusalToFill

Business name: Fill Refusals

Indicates that the identified issue resulted in a dispenser refusing to fill the subject prescription.

Exposes in the model that this issue is associated with a refusal to dispense.

An indication of 'refusal to fill' must be indicated, thus attribute is mandatory.

One of 'Refusal to Fill Reason' or an Issue must be specified but no both

classCode : "CACT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : "PORX_TE010210UV" (ActCode)1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
effectiveTime : TS.FULLDATE

Business name: Refusal To Fill Date

1Pop
reasonCode : (ActSupplyFulfillmentRefusalReason)

Business name: Refusal To Fill Reason

Indicates a non-clinical-issue based reason for refusing to fill.

Supports capture of reasons such as 'moral objection' which are not tied to specific issues. Set as CWE to allow for non-coded reasons.

annotation : Annotation1Pop
PORX_MT060160CA.Subject8

Business name: j:authorizes

Indicates whether the prescriber wishes to restrict the ability of the dispenser to make substitutions in selecting the specific drug to dispense. If not specified, substitutions are allowed, at the professional discretion of the dispenser or mandated through legislation.

Default position for this field is that a generic drug ('Generic') may be substituted for the trade preparation. The prescriber may specify that no substitution ('None') is allowed

May have financial implication for the patient. Many plans will not pay for name-brand medications unless the prescriber has indicated to the pharmacy that substitutions are not permitted.

typeCode : "SUBJ" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "OP" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
substitutionPermission : SubstitutionPermission1Pop
PORX_MT060160CA.Subject9

Indicates whether additional information is available for drill-down.

subsetCode : "SUM" (ActRelationshipSubset)1Mand

PORX_MT060160CA.SubsequentSupplyRequest

Dispensing instruction for all dispenses subsequent to the first fill.

classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "RQO" (ActMood)1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL.WIDTH<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: F:Dispense Interval

Indicates a minimum amount of time that must occur between dispenses.

Helps the prescriber ensure that the patient does not ever receive more than the appropriate amount of medication in a particular timeframe.

0-1Req
repeatNumber : INT.POS

Business name: G:Number of Fills

The number of times the prescribed quantity is to be dispensed, including the initial standard fill.

Used to calculate total prescribed quantity; and also used for compliance checking.

Expressed as Number of Fills rather than number of refills due to HL7 modeling constraints.

D54.03

DRU.060-02

Claim,415-DF

ZDP.15.1

Prescription.numberOfRefills

0-1Req
quantity : PQ.DRUG

Business name: D:Fill Quantity

The amount of medication to be dispensed to the patient for each normal fill (excluding trial or other special first fills).

Limits the quantity of medication in patient's possession at a time. Used in compliance checking

Prescription.fillAmount

Prescription.maximumDispensedAmount (when SupplyRequest.effectiveTime id populated with an interval)

Quantity

0-1Req
expectedUseTime : IVL.WIDTH<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: E:Days Supply

The number of days that each standard fill is expected to last. The dispenser must use the administration instructions together with the Days Supply to calculate the total quantity to dispense per fill. May be specified in addition to quantity to indicate the length of time a quantity of 'as needed' medication is expected to last.

Useful in determining and managing certain contraindications ('Fill-Too-Soon', 'Fill-Too-Late', and 'Duration of Therapy'). Also provides guidance to the pharmacy on how much to dispense. Also useful in research.

0-1Req
PORX_MT060160CA.SubstanceAdministrationDefinition

Business name: Protocols

Documentation of why a prescriber has chosen to prescribe the drug in the manner they have.

Allows linking to specific guidelines or protocols. Also used to provide additional detail needed when requesting a 'special access' drug from Health Canada.

classCode : "SBADM" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "DEF" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: Protocol Identifiers

A unique identifier for a specific protocol or guideline which the prescription has been written in accordance with.

Enables the communication of a reference to a protocol, study or guideline id, specific to the jurisdiction;

Allows providers to reference a protocol/guideline for prescribing to specific situations. This could also be used for justification for prescribing a medication from a particular formulary. E.g., 'Limited Use' medications in Ontario require physicians to use a code indicating that a patient is eligible for this particular medication.

1Mand
code : "DRUG" (ActCode)1Mand

An indication of what kind of substitution made, if any.

May explain why prescribed and dispensed medications differ.

A code signifying whether a different drug was dispensed from what was prescribed.

PORX_MT060160CA.SubstitutionPermission

Business name: Allowed Substitution

A prescriber's instruction that a specific prescribed product be dispensed as is, or not.

May have financial and therapeutic conformance ramifications for a patient.

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

classCode : "SUBST" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "PERM" (ActMood)1Mand
code : "G" (ActCode)1Mand
negationInd :

Business name: A:Substitution Not Allowed Indicator

If true, indicates that the drug must be dispensed exactly as prescribed

Many jurisdictions allow substitution by default and require prescribers to explicitly declare when they do not want substitution. The element is mandatory because it must be explicitly true or false.

1Mand
reasonCode : (SubstanceAdminSubstitutionNotAllowedReason)

Business name: Not Allowed Reason

The reason why the prescriber has indicated that substitution is not allowed by the dispensing pharmacy.

Some jurisdictions demand that a prescriber gives a reason for prohibiting substitution.

The field is marked as 'Populated' because the reason for substitution is important to understanding the decision. However when a prescription is being recorded in the pharmacy, the information may not be available.

1Pop
PORX_MT060160CA.SupplyEvent
classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : (ActPharmacySupplyType)

Business name: B:Dispense Type

Indicates the type of dispensing event that is performed. Examples include: Trial Fill, Completion of Trial, Partial Fill, Emergency Fill, Samples, etc.

Indicates reason for the size of dispense. Because it defines what type of dispense is occurring, the attribute is mandatory.

DispensedItem.activityType

D52

ZDP.2

Claim.403-D3

Claim.343-HD

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: D:Dispensed Processing and Pickup Date

Represents the date the dispense product was prepared and when the product was picked up by or delivered to the patient. The dispense processing date and pickup date can be back dated to reflect when the actual processing and pickup occurred. The lower-bound of the period signifies the dispense-processing date whereas the upper-bound signifies the dispense-pickup date.

Used by the system in calculating expected exhaustion time. Valuable in compliance checking.

This attribute is mandatory because an existing dispense record must at least indicate the date it was processed.

ZPB3.9

ZDP.17 (high)

DRU.040-02 (low, qualifier=07, format=102)

The amount of medication that has been dispensed. Includes unit of measure.

Critical in understanding the patient's medication profile, both past and current, This is also mandatory to allow determination of the amount that remains to be dispensed against the prescription.

PORX_MT060160CA.SupplyEventFirstSummary

Indicates when the first dispense against the prescription was picked up.

Useful in establishing start of therapy.

Important information for compliance

0-1Req
quantity : PQ.DRUG

Business name: First Quantity Dispensed

Indicates the amount of medication first dispensed on the prescription.

Usually establishes trial quantities for a prescription.

Because the quantity should always be known if the first dispense is known, this attribute is mandatory.

1Mand
PORX_MT060160CA.SupplyEventFutureSummary

Business name: Remaining Dispense Information

Provides summary information about what dispenses remain to be performed against the prescription

Useful in understanding the status of a prescription and in planning for renewals.

At least one of quantity and repeatNumber must be specified.

classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
repeatNumber : INT.NONNEG

Business name: A:Total Fills Remaining

Indicates the number of remaining dispenses estimated, assuming that each fill is equal to the quantity prescribed for a single fill, rounding up.

Indicates the number of dispenses that may still occur.

0-1Req
quantity : PQ.DRUG

Business name: B:Total Quantity Remaining

Indicates the total remaining undispensed quantity authorized against the prescription.

Indicates how much can still be dispensed.

0-1Req
PORX_MT060160CA.SupplyEventLastSummary

Business name: Last Dispense Information

Provides summary information about the most recent dispense event performed against the prescription

Useful in understanding the status of a prescription and in planning for renewals.

classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL.HIGH<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: Last Dispense Pickup Date

Indicates the most recent date on which a dispense on the prescription was picked up.

Useful in determining when a prescription will next need to be dispensed. Also provides an indication of compliance.

0-1Req
quantity : PQ.DRUG

Business name: Last Quantity Dispensed

Indicates the most recent quantity of the drug that was picked up for the prescription.

Useful in determining the amount of medication that a patient should have on-hand. Also provides an indication of compliance.

Because the quantity should always be known if the last dispense is known, this attribute is mandatory.

1Mand
PORX_MT060160CA.SupplyEventPastSummary

Business name: Previous Dispense Information

Summarizes the dispenses that have happened against the prescription to date.

Helps in understanding the status of the prescription and evaluating compliance.

At least one of quantity and repeatNumber must be specified.

classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
repeatNumber : INT.NONNEG

Business name: A:Dispensed Fills To-date

Indicates the number of dispense events performed against the prescription to date, including trial, partial and complete fills.

Useful in tracking the progress of a prescription in prescription.

0-1Req
quantity : PQ.DRUG

Business name: B:Dispensed Quantity To-date

Depending on the Dispense Aggregate Information Type, this field would contain one of Remaining Total Quantity, First Quantity Dispensed, Last Quantity Dispensed, or Total Supplied Amount.

Useful for tracking the progress of a prescription

0-1Req
PORX_MT060160CA.SupplyRequest

Business name: Dispense Instructions

Specification of how the prescribed medication is to be dispensed to the patient. Dispensed instruction information includes the quantity to be dispensed, how often the quantity is to be dispensed, etc.

Sets the parameters within which the dispenser must operate in dispensing the medication to the patient.

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "RQO" (ActMood)1Mand
statusCode : (ActStatus)

Business name: Prescription Dispensable Indicator

This generally mirrors the status for the prescription, but in some circumstances may be changed to 'aborted' while the prescription is still active. When this occurs, it means the prescription may no longer be dispensed, though it may still be administered.

Allows a prescriber to say "Finish what you have on hand, but don't get any more."

Because the status should always be known, this element is mandatory.

1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: A:Dispensing Allowed Period

This indicates the validity period of a prescription (stale dating the Prescription). It reflects the prescriber perspective for the validity of the prescription. Dispenses must not be made against the prescription outside of this period. The lower-bound of the Prescription Effective Period signifies the earliest date that the prescription can be filled for the first time. If an upper-bound is not specified then the Prescription is open-ended or will default to a stale-date based on regulations.

Indicates when the Order becomes valid, and when it ceases to be an actionable Order. Some jurisdictions place a 'stale date' on prescriptions that cause them to become invalid a certain amount of time after they are written. This time may vary by medication.

ZPB3.9

DRU.040-02 (low, qualifier=07, format=102)

DRU.040-02 (low, qualifier=36, format=102)

Number of days (width)

When will drug be administered?(low)

ZDP.17 (high)

Last date dispensed(when summary type is 'most recent')

Prescription.dispensingInterval(period)

Prescription.effectiveDate (low)

Prescription.expiryDate (high)

0-1Req
receiver : Receiver0-5Req
location : Location51Pop
destination : Destination10-1Req
component : Component31-5Pop
PORX_MT060160CA.SupplyRequestItem

Business name: Dispense Instruction Details

Specification of how the prescribed medication is to be dispensed to the patient. Dispensed instruction information includes the quantity to be dispensed, how often the quantity is to be dispensed, etc.

Sets the parameters within which the dispenser must operate in dispensing the medication to the patient.

Allows dispensing instructions to be given at specific dispensable drug level for an overall prescribed drug.

classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "RQO" (ActMood)1Mand
quantity : PQ.DRUG

Business name: B:Total Prescribed Quantity

The overall amount of amount medication to be dispensed under this prescription. Includes any first fills (trials, aligning quantities), the initial standard fill plus all refills.

Sets upper limit for medication to be dispensed. Can be used to verify the intention of the prescriber with respect to the overall medication. Used for comparison when determining whether additional quantity may be dispensed in the context of a part-fill prescription.

Narcotics must always be specified as a total quantity.

0-1Req
expectedUseTime : IVL.WIDTH<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: A:Total Days Supply

The number of days that the overall prescribed item is expected to last, if the patient is compliant with the dispensing and administration of the prescription.

Used to specify a total authorization as a duration rather than a quantity with refills. E.g. dispense 30 at a time, refill for 1 year. May also be sent as an estimate of the expected overall duration of the prescription based on the quantity prescribed. This attribute is mandatory because the prescriber (in discussion with the patient) has a better understanding of the days supply needed by the patient.

1Mand
product : Product10-1Req
component1 : Component70-1Req
component2 : Component81Mand
PORX_MT060160CA.TrialSupplyPermission

Business name: *Trial Prescription?

Identification of prescriptions for which dispensers are encouraged to dispense partial quantities on trial basis.

Trial fills are usually done with drugs that are either being tried on the patient for the first time or that the patient has indicated minor discomfort with their use. In order for the patient not to be saddled with costly and excessive medication on-hand, the tral process allows patients to test the tolerance and efficacy of drugs before completing fills.

Prescription.trialAuthorized('True' if this class is present)

classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "PERM" (ActMood)1Mand
code : "TF" (ActCode)1Mand
PORX_MT060160CA.VerificationEventCriterion
classCode : "VERIF" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN.CRT" (ActMood)1Mand
code : "VFPAPER" (ActCode)1Mand
PORX_MT060160CA.WorkingListEvent

Business name: Drug Use

Categorization of prescriptions based on the intended duration of the prescribed therapy.

Useful in establishing compliance for drug renewals and refills.

classCode : "LIST" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : (ActTherapyDurationWorkingListCode)

Business name: D:Treatment Type

Describes the categorization of the therapy envisioned by this prescription (e.g. Continuous/Chronic, Short-Term/Acute and "As-Needed).

Allows categorizing prescription for presentation. May influence detection of duplicate therapy. May also be used to affect how DUR processing is completed. The field is marked as "populated" because the intended duration of the therapy should generally be known at prescribe time. However in some circumstances, it may not be known whether a therapy will be short-term or long-term.

Prescription type

Prescription.drugUseIndicator

1Mand
 
 

PORX_MT060170CA

PORX_MT060170CA.AdministrationEffectivePeriod
value : IVL<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: Administration Effective Period

For a prescription indicates the period for which the patient was deemed to be taking the drug.

Filter the result set to include only those medication records (prescription order, prescription dispense and other medication) for which the patient was deemed to be taking the drug.

Allows the requester to specify the administration period of interest for the retrieval. Useful for constraining run-away queries.

1Mand
PORX_MT060170CA.AmendedInTimeRange
value : IVL<TS.FULLDATETIME>

Business name: Amended In Time Range

Indicates that the returned records should be filtered to only include those which have been amended in some way (had status changed, been annotated, prescription was dispensed, etc.) within the indicated time-period. This will commonly be used to 'retrieve everything that has been amended since xxx'.

Allows the requester to specify the event period of interest for the retrieval of medication records.

Useful for constraining run-away queries.

1Mand
PORX_MT060170CA.DiagnosisCode
value : (DiagnosisValue)

Business name: Diagnosis Code

Indicates that the result set is to be filtered to include only those records pertaining to the specified diagnosis indication code.

Allows for the retrieval of patient's prescriptions and/or dispenses based on prescribing indications.

1Mand
PORX_MT060170CA.DrugCode
value : (ClinicalDrug)

Business name: Drug Code

Indicates that the result set is to be filtered to include only those records pertaining to the specified drug. The code may refer to an orderable medication or a higher level drug classification.

Allows for the retrieval of patient prescriptions and/or dispenses based on a specific medication that was ordered and/or dispensed. This will most commonly be used to filter for therapeutic classifications such as "Anti-hypertensives".

1Mand
PORX_MT060170CA.IncludeEventHistoryIndicator
value :

Business name: Include Event History Indicator

Indicates whether or not history events associated with a prescription order, prescription dispense and/or active medications are to be returned along with the detailed information.

"Pending" changes will be returned regardless of the setting of this flag.

Allows for the flexibility of omitting/including history in the retrieval of the requested information.

Because the attribute is boolean, it must explicitly indicate a 'TRUE' or 'FALSE', and thus it is mandatory.

1Mand
PORX_MT060170CA.IncludeIssuesIndicator
value :

Business name: Include Issues Indicator

Indicates whether or not Issues (detected and/or managed) attached to the prescriptions, dispenses and other active medication records are to be returned along with the detailed information.

Allows for the flexibility of omitting/including issues in the retrieval of medication detail profile data.

Because the attribute is boolean, it must explicitly indicate a 'TRUE' or 'FALSE', and thus it is mandatory.

1Mand
PORX_MT060170CA.IncludeNotesIndicator
value :

Business name: Include Notes Indicator

Indicates whether or not notes attached to the prescription, dispenses and other active medication records are to be returned along with the detailed information.

Allows for the flexibility of omitting/including notes in the retrieval of information for medication profile detail data.

Because the attribute is boolean, it must explicitly indicate a 'TRUE' or 'FALSE', and thus it is mandatory.

1Mand
PORX_MT060170CA.IncludePendingChangesIndicator
value :

Business name: Include Pending Changes Indicator

Indicates whether to include future changes (e.g. status changes that aren't effective yet) associated with a prescription order, prescription dispense and/or active medications are to be returned along with the detailed information.

Allows for the flexibility of omitting/including future events in the retrieval of the requested information.

Because the attribute is boolean, it must explicitly indicate a 'TRUE' or 'FALSE', and thus it is mandatory.

1Mand
PORX_MT060170CA.MostRecentDispenseForEachRxIndicator
value :

Business name: Most Recent Dispense for each Rx Indicator

Indicates whether or not a prescription dispenses returned on a query should be limited to only the most recent dispense for a prescription.

Allows the returning of at most one prescription dispense record per a prescription.

The default is 'TRUE' indicating that retrieval should be for only the most recent dispense for a prescription is to be included in a query result.

Helps to trim down volume of query response by eliminating multiple dispenses for the same prescription.

Because this is a boolean attribute whose value must be known to evaluate the query, the attribute is mandatory.

1Mand
PORX_MT060170CA.OtherIndicationCode
value : (ActNonConditionIndicationCode)

Business name: Other Indication Code

Indicates that the result set is to be filtered to include only those records pertaining to the specified non-condition-related indication code.

Allows for the retrieval of patient's prescriptions and/or dispenses based on prescribing indications.

1Mand
PORX_MT060170CA.ParameterList

Business name: Generic Query Parameters

Defines the set of parameters that may be used to filter the query response.

Root class for query definition

amendedInTimeRange : AmendedInTimeRange0-1Req

Indicates the date on which the patient was born.

Used to confirm the identity of the patient for the query and is therefore mandatory.

value : (AdministrativeGender)

Business name: Patient Gender

Indicates the gender (sex) of the patient.

Used to confirm the identity of the patient for the query and is therefore mandatory.

value : II

Business name: B:Patient ID

Identifier of the patient who is the subject of the patient medication query. Filter the result set to include only those records pertaining to the patient with this Id.

Allows filtering of result set by patient Id. This is a mandatory field because a patient must be specified for the query to be valid

value : PN.BASIC

Business name: C:Patient Name

The name by which the patient is known.

Used to confirm the identity of the patient for the query and is therefore mandatory.

value : (SymptomValue)

Business name: Symptom Code

Indicates that the result set is to be filtered to include only those records pertaining to the specified symptom indication code.

Allows for the retrieval of patient's prescriptions and/or dispenses based on prescribing indications.

PORX_MT060180CA

PORX_MT060180CA.AdministrationEffectivePeriod
value : IVL<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: Administration Effective Period

Indicates the administration period for which the request/query applies.

Filter the result set to include only those medication records (prescription order, prescription dispense and other active medication) for which the patient was deemed to be taking the drug within the specified period.

Allows the requester to specify the administration period of interest for the retrieval. Useful for constraining run-away queries.

1Mand
PORX_MT060180CA.AmendedInTimeRange
value : IVL<TS.FULLDATETIME>

Business name: Amended in Time Range

Indicates that the returned records should be filtered to only include those which have been amended in some way (had status changed, been annotated, prescription was dispensed, etc.) within the indicated time-period. This will commonly be used to “retrieve everything that has been amended since xxx”.

Allows the requester to specify the event period of interest for the retrieval of medication records.

Useful for constraining run-away queries.

1Mand
PORX_MT060180CA.DiagnosisCode
value : (DiagnosisValue)

Business name: Diagnosis Code

Indicates that the result set is to be filtered to include only those records pertaining to the specified diagnosis indication code.

Allows for the retrieval of patient's prescriptions and/or dispenses based on prescribing indications.

1Mand

value : (ClinicalDrug)

Business name: Drug Code

Indicates that the result set is to be filtered to include only those records pertaining to the specified drug. The code may refer to an orderable medication or a higher level drug classification.

Allows for the retrieval of patient prescriptions and/or dispenses based on a specific medication that was ordered and/or dispensed. This will most commonly be used to filter for therapeutic classifications such as "Anti-hypertensives".

1Mand
PORX_MT060180CA.IncludeEventHistoryIndicator
value :

Business name: Include Event History Indicator

Indicates whether or not history events associated with a prescription order, prescription dispense and/or other active medications are to be returned along with the detailed information.

"Pending" changes will be returned regardless of the setting of this flag.

Allows for the flexibility of omitting/including history in the retrieval of the requested information.

Because the attribute is boolean, it must explicitly indicate a 'TRUE' or 'FALSE', and thus it is mandatory.

1Mand
PORX_MT060180CA.IncludeIssuesIndicator
value :

Business name: Include Issues Indicator

Indicates whether or not Issues (detected and/or managed) attached to the prescriptions, dispenses and other active medication records are to be returned along with the detailed information.

Allows for the flexibility of omitting/including issues in the retrieval of medication detail profile data.

Because the attribute is boolean, it must explicitly indicate a 'TRUE' or 'FALSE', and thus it is mandatory.

1Mand
PORX_MT060180CA.IncludeNotesIndicator
value :

Business name: Include Notes Indicator

Indicates whether or not notes attached to the prescription, dispenses and other active medication records are to be returned along with the detailed information.

Allows for the flexibility of omitting/including notes in the retrieval of information for medication profile detail data.

Because the attribute is boolean, it must explicitly indicate a 'TRUE' or 'FALSE', and thus it is mandatory.

1Mand
PORX_MT060180CA.IncludePendingChangesIndicator
value :

Business name: Include Pending Changes Indicator

Indicates whether to include future changes (e.g. status changes that aren't effective yet) associated with a prescription order, prescription dispense and/or active medications are to be returned along with the detailed information.

Allows for the flexibility of omitting/including future events in the retrieval of the requested information.

Because the attribute is boolean, it must explicitly indicate a 'TRUE' or 'FALSE', and thus it is mandatory.

1Mand
PORX_MT060180CA.IssueFilterCode
value : (IssueFilterCode)

Business name: Issue Filter Code

Indicates whether records to be returned (e.g. prescription order, prescription dispense and/or other medication) should be filtered to those with at least one persistent un-managed issue (against the record), with at least one persistent issues or should return all records, independent of the presence of persistent issues.

By filtering returned records to include only those which have unmanaged issues or any issues at all, allows a provider to focus on those aspects of care where extra attention is needed. Because the attribute must be known, it is mandatory.

1Mand
PORX_MT060180CA.MostRecentByDrugIndicator
value :

Business name: Most Recent By Drug Indicator

Indicates whether or not the medication records are to be retrieved based on the most recent by Drug Code. If true, only the most recent prescription, dispense or other active medication for a particular drug generic classification will be returned. The default is 'FALSE' indicating that retrieval of prescription, dispense and other active medication records should not be limited to one per drug.

Helps decrease the volume of records returned, while still maintaining information on all drugs that the patient is on.

Because this is a boolean attribute whose value must be known to evaluate the query, the attribute is mandatory.

1Mand
PORX_MT060180CA.MostRecentDispenseForEachRxIndicator
value :

Business name: Most Recent Dispense for each Rx Indicator

Indicates whether or not a prescription dispenses returned on a query should be limited to only the most recent dispense for a prescription.

Allows the returning of at most one prescription dispense record per a prescription.

The default is 'TRUE' indicating that retrieval should be for only the most recent dispense for a prescription is to be included in a query result.

Helps to trim down volume of query response by eliminating multiple dispenses for the same prescription.

Because this is a boolean attribute whose value must be known to evaluate the query, the attribute is mandatory.

1Mand
PORX_MT060180CA.OtherIndicationCode
value : (ActNonConditionIndicationCode)

Business name: Other Indication Code

Indicates that the result set is to be filtered to include only those records pertaining to the specified non-condition-related indication code.

Allows for the retrieval of patient's prescriptions and/or dispenses based on prescribing indications.

1Mand
PORX_MT060180CA.OtherMedicationRecordId
value : II

Business name: E:Other Medication Record Id

Identifier of the other active medication record for which detailed information is to be retrieved.

Allows for the retrieval of medication records based on a specific active medication record.

The name by which the patient is known.

1Mand
PORX_MT060180CA.PrescriberProviderID
value : II

Business name: Prescriber Provider ID

Identifier of the prescriber who created and/or supervised the prescriptions being retrieved.

The result set will be filtered to only include records which were either directly created by this provider, or were created 'under the supervision' of this provider.

Allows for the retrieval of prescriptions based on the specific prescribers.

1Mand
PORX_MT060180CA.PrescriptionDispenseNumber
value : II

Business name: E:Prescription Dispense Number

Identifies which prescription dispense record should be retrieved.

Allows for the retrieval of medication records relating to a specific dispense record.

1Mand
PORX_MT060180CA.PrescriptionOrderNumber
value : II

Business name: D:Prescription Order Number

Identifier of the prescription for which detailed information is required.

The result set will be filtered to only the specific prescription.

Identifies the prescription that is to be retrieved.

1Mand
PORX_MT060180CA.PrescriptionStatus
value : (ActStatus)

Business name: Prescription Statuses

Indicates that prescriptions of a specific statuses are to be included in the result set. Specific prescription statuses are: 'active', completed', 'aborted', 'suspended'.

Allows for the retrieval of patient prescriptions and dispenses based on the lifecycle state of the prescription.

1Mand
PORX_MT060180CA.RxDispenseIndicator
value : (PrescriptionDispenseFilterCode)

Business name: Rx Dispenser Indicators

A coded value indicating the dispensing (fill) status of the prescription to be included in the result set. Rx Dispense Indicators include: ND (Never Dispensed), DRR (Dispensed with Refills Remaining), etc.

The repetition of 3 allows for retrieval based on all three Rx Dispense Indicators.

Allows for finer sub-set of prescriptions to be retrieved based on the fill status of the prescription.

1Mand
PORX_MT060180CA.SymptomCode
value : (SymptomValue)

Business name: Symptom Code

Indicates that the result set is to be filtered to include only those records pertaining to the specified symptom indication code.

Allows for the retrieval of patient's prescriptions and/or dispenses based on prescribing indications.

1Mand
PORX_MT060180CA.TreatmentType
value : (ActTherapyDurationWorkingListCode)

Business name: Treatment Types

Indicates that the result set is to be filtered to only include those records pertaining to the specified treatment type (categories). The specific values are "Continuous/Chronic", "Short-Term/Acute" and "As-Needed/PRN".

Allows for the retrieval of prescriptions and dispensed based on the intended treatment type of the prescription. Repetition of 2 will allow for the result set to be filtered based on 1 or two treatment types.

1Mand
 
 

PORX_MT060190CA

PORX_MT060190CA.AdministrationInstructions
classCode : "SBADM" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "RQO" (ActMood)1Mand
code : "DRUG" (ActCode)1Mand
text :

Business name: Rendered Dosage Instruction

A textual rendition of structured (or non-structure) original dosage instruction specified by the prescriber.

Allows the prescriber to verify the structured dosage instruction.

Attribute is marked as "mandatory" as the rendition of the dosage instruction must always be made available to the prescriber.

1Mand

classCode : "ACT" (ActClass)1Mand

PORX_MT060190CA.Author

Business name: *recorded by

Indicates the provider who recorded the "other active medication".

Useful for follow-up and audit purposes, and therefore mandatory.

typeCode : "AUT" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AP" (ContextControl)1Mand
assignedPerson : AssignedPerson1Mand
PORX_MT060190CA.Author2

Business name: *c:prescribed by

This is the provider who authorized the medication to be dispensed to the patient.

To be a legal order, the person responsible for its creation must be identified. Thus the association is mandatory.

Prescription.Prescriber

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

typeCode : "AUT" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AP" (ContextControl)1Mand
time : TS.FULLDATE

Business name: Prescribed Date

The date that the prescription was written by the prescriber.

Essential information for a prescription to be legal.

This information may not always be known for an inferred prescription, and is therefore marked as "populated".

1Pop
assignedPerson : AssignedPerson1Mand
PORX_MT060190CA.Author3

Business name: *refused by

Indicates who refused to fulfill the prescription

Allows follow-up and traceability of the refusal and is therefore mandatory

typeCode : "AUT" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "OP" (ContextControl)1Mand
assignedPerson : AssignedPerson1Mand
PORX_MT060190CA.CombinedMedicationRequest

Business name: Prescription

Where the prescription is for a combination of drugs (e.g. 10mg tablets + 40mg tablets) repeatNumber cannot be populated and quantity must be expressed in mg.

This is a 'core' class of the medication model and is important for understanding what drugs the patient is intended to be receiving.

classCode : "SBADM" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "RQO" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: A:Prescription Order Number

The Prescription Order Number is a globally unique number assigned to a prescription by the EHR/DIS irrespective of the source of the order

It is created by the EHR/DIS once the prescription has passed all edits and validation.

Allows prescriptions to be uniquely referenced.

The number is mandatory to allow every prescription record to be uniquely identified.

Prescription.prescriptionNumber

Prescription.prescriptionExternalKey

D53(ID for the prescription assigned by pharmacy)

D55(ID for the dispense event)

D99.01

X0101(id for prescription)

ZDP.5

ZDP.6

ZDP.22

ZRV.5

DRU.080-01(extension)

DRU.080-02(route)

Claim.455-EM (route)

Claim.402-D2 (extension)

Claim.456-EN

Claim.454-EK

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

1Mand
code : CD (ActCode)

Business name: Prescription Type

Indicates that this is a prescription for a drug as opposed to an immunization. For SNOMED, may also contain information regarding drug and route.

Needed to convey the meaning of this class and is therefore mandatory.

The element allows 'CD' to provide support for SNOMED.

1Mand
statusCode : (ActStatus)

Business name: C:Prescription Status

This denotes the state of the prescription in the lifecycle of the prescription. Valid statuses are: NEW, ACTIVE, SUSPENDED, ABORTED, COMPLETED, OBSOLETE and NULLIFIED.

Indicates what actions are allowed to be performed against a prescription.

This is a mandatory field because every prescription needs to be in some state.

Prescription.state (cannot distinguish between 'Filled' and 'Unfilled', must look at amounts dispensed to distniguish between those; and also cannot distinguish modified, need to look at event history).

Prescription Status

1Mand
confidentialityCode : (x_VeryBasicConfidentialityKind)

Business name: F:Prescription Masking Indicator

Communicates the intent of the patient to restrict access to their prescriptions.

Provides support for additional confidentiality constraint, giving patients a level of control over their information.

Valid values are: 'NORMAL' (denotes 'Not Masked'); and 'RESTRICTED' (denotes 'Masked').

The default is 'NORMAL' signifying 'Not Masked'.

Allows the patient to have discrete control over access to their medication data.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

Prescription.masked

0-1Opt
directTarget : DirectTarget0-1Req
subject : Subject51Mand
responsibleParty : ResponsibleParty0-1Req
author : Author21Mand
location : Location41Pop
reason : Reason1-5Pop
precondition : Precondition0-1Req
derivedFrom : DerivedFrom0-1Req
component1 : Component11Mand
component2 : Component61Pop

fulfillment2 : InFulfillmentOf50-1Req

fulfillment4 : InFulfillmentOf20-1Req
subjectOf1 : Subject0-1Req
subjectOf2 : Subject20-1Req
subjectOf3 : Subject30-10Req
componentOf : Component41Pop
PORX_MT060190CA.Component1

Business name: e:to be administered according to

The Prescriber's instruction(s) for the administration of the medication.

This information is needed for a prescription to be valid and is therefore mandatory. Multiple repetitions are supported for circumstances where a single therapy involves the administration of multiple drugs. E.g. Didrocal.

typeCode : "COMP" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
administrationInstructions : AdministrationInstructions1Mand
PORX_MT060190CA.Component4

Business name: classifies

Indicates the clinical use category in which the prescription has been put.

Allows prescriptions to be categorized in multiple ways.

typeCode : "COMP" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
workingListEvent : WorkingListEvent1Pop
PORX_MT060190CA.Component6

Business name: f:includes

Identifies the instructions for how the prescribed medication should be dispensed to the patient.

An essential part of most prescriptions is the authorization to dispense. Multiple repetitions are included to accommodate circumstances where multiple drug products may need to be dispensed to complete a therapy. E.g. 100 x 20mg tablets and 50 x 10mg tablets. The association is marked as Populated because the authorization to dispense is a critical portion of a prescription. However the association is allowed to be 'null' when the order is for a medication which requires no dispense authorization (e.g. over-the-counter medications), or when the patient already has sufficient supply of the medication on hand to complete the therapy.

typeCode : "COMP" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
supplyRequest : SupplyRequest1Pop
PORX_MT060190CA.Consumable2

Business name: *c:administered

Identifies the other active medication being recorded into the system as being taken by the patient.

The drug is the key part of the administration record, and is therefore mandatory.

typeCode : "CSM" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "OP" (ContextControl)1Mand
medication : Medication1Mand
PORX_MT060190CA.DerivedFrom
typeCode : "DRIV" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "OP" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
sourceDispense : SourceDispense1Pop
PORX_MT060190CA.DetectedIssueEvent

Business name: Issues

Describes an issue associated with a prescription that resulted in a dispenser refusing to fill it.

Allows a dispenser to assert an issue against a prescription to be displayed to subsequent dispensers as well as others reviewing the patient's medication profile.

classCode : "ALRT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : (ActDetectedIssueCode)

Business name: Issue Type

A coded value that is used to distinguish between different kinds of issues. Types of issue include: unrecognized identifiers, permission issues, drug-drug contraindications, drug-allergy alerts, duplicate therapies, suspect fraud etc.

Identifies what kind of issue was detected or is being managed.

This is mandatory so as to ensure that one issue type can be distinguished from another.

1Mand
text :

Business name: Issue Comment

A free form textual description regarding the issue of fraudulence. This may be specified in place of, or in addition to the coded issue.

Enables extra or more detailed description of the alert

0-1Req
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
PORX_MT060190CA.DetectedIssueIndicator
classCode : "ALRT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
PORX_MT060190CA.DirectTarget

This is a key aspect of the prescription.

Association is mandatory if not using SNOMED

PORX_MT060190CA.Location2

Business name: *recorded at

Identification of the service delivery location where the other active medication was recorded

Used for follow-up communication on the dispensed product, and therefore mandatory.

typeCode : "LOC" (ParticipationType)1Mand
