PORX_MT060340CA.Subject6

Business name: k:managed

Detailed information indicating identified issues (permission problems, drug-drug interactions, dosage issues, duplicate therapy, drug-allergy, drug-lab, age appropriateness, etc.) with the proposed prescription dispense, along with how the issues have been managed by the dispenser.

Allows a dispenser to override alerts and business rules, as well as providing a permanent record of management steps.

typeCode : "SUBJ" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
detectedIssueEvent : DetectedIssueEvent1Pop
PORX_MT060340CA.Subject7

Business name: k:includes

Indicates the various comments that providers have recorded about this dispense record.

Improves communication between providers by allowing a mechanism to exchange un-coded free-form information.

typeCode : "SUBJ" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
annotation : Annotation1Pop
PORX_MT060340CA.Subject8

Business name: j:authorizes

Indicates whether the prescriber wishes to restrict the ability of the dispenser to make substitutions in selecting the specific drug to dispense. If not specified, substitutions are allowed, at the professional discretion of the dispenser or mandated through legislation.

Default position for this field is that a generic drug (“Generic”) may be substituted for the trade preparation. The prescriber may specify that no substitution (“None”) is allowed;

May have financial implication for the patient. Many plans will not pay for name-brand medications unless the prescriber has indicated to the pharmacy that substitutions are not permitted.

typeCode : "SUBJ" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "OP" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
substitutionPermission : SubstitutionPermission1Pop
PORX_MT060340CA.Subject9

Business name: includes

Indicates refusals that have been recorded against the prescription

Makes information about prior refusals to subsequent pharmacies, as well as to the prescriber

typeCode : "SUBJ" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
refusalToFill : RefusalToFill1Pop
PORX_MT060340CA.SubsequentSupplyRequest

Dispensing instruction for all dispenses subsequent to the first fill.

classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "RQO" (ActMood)1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL.WIDTH<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: F:Dispense Interval

Indicates a minimum amount of time that must occur between dispenses.

Helps the prescriber ensure that the patient does not ever receive more than the appropriate amount of medication in a particular timeframe.

0-1Req
repeatNumber : INT.POS

Business name: G:Number of Fills

The number of times the prescribed quantity is to be dispensed including the initial standard fill.

Used to calculate total prescribed quantity; and also used for compliance checking.

Expressed as Number of Fills rather than number of refills due to HL7 modeling constraints.

D54.03

DRU.060-02

Claim,415-DF

ZDP.15.1

Prescription.numberOfRefills

0-1Req
quantity : PQ.DRUG

Business name: D:Fill Quantity

The amount of medication to be dispensed to the patient for each normal fill (excluding trial or other special first fills).

Limits the quantity of medication in patient's possession at a time. Used in compliance checking

Prescription.fillAmount

Prescription.maximumDispensedAmount (when SupplyRequest.effectiveTime id populated with an interval)

Quantity

0-1Req
expectedUseTime : IVL.WIDTH<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: E:Days Supply

The number of days that each standard fill is expected to last. The dispenser must use the administration instructions together with the Days Supply to calculate the total quantity to dispense per fill. May be specified in addition to quantity to indicate the length of time a quantity of 'as needed' medication is expected to last.

Useful in determining and managing certain contraindications ('Fill-Too-Soon', 'Fill-Too-Late', and 'Duration of Therapy'). Also provides guidance to the pharmacy on how much to dispense. Also useful in research.

0-1Req
PORX_MT060340CA.SubstanceAdministrationDefinition

Business name: Protocols

Documentation of why a prescriber has chosen to prescribe the drug in the manner they have.

Allows linking to specific guidelines or protocols. Also used to provide additional detail needed when requesting a ‘special access’ drug from Health Canada.

classCode : "SBADM" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "DEF" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: Protocol Identifiers

A unique identifier for a specific protocol or guideline which the prescription has been written in accordance with.

Enables the communication of a reference to a protocol, study or guideline id, specific to the jurisdiction;

Allows providers to reference a protocol/guideline for prescribing to specific situations. This could also be used for justification for prescribing a medication from a particular formulary. E.g., 'Limited' Use’ medications in Ontario require physicians to use a code indicating that a patient is eligible for this particular medication.

1Mand
code : "DRUG" (ActCode)1Mand
PORX_MT060340CA.SubstitutionMade

Business name: Substitution

An indication of what kind of substitution made, if any.

May explain why prescribed and dispensed medications differ.

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : (ActSubstanceAdminSubstitutionCode)

Business name: Substitution Code

A code signifying whether a different drug was dispensed from what was prescribed.

Indicates that substitution was done (or not). This attribute is mandatory because it is essential to understanding the substitution.

PORX_MT060340CA.SubstitutionPermission

Business name: Allowed Substitution

A prescriber's instruction that a specific prescribed product be dispensed as is, or not.

May have financial and therapeutic conformance ramifications for a patient.

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

classCode : "SUBST" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "PERM" (ActMood)1Mand
code : "G" (ActCode)1Mand
negationInd :

Business name: A:Substitution Not Allowed Indicator

If true, indicates that the drug must be dispensed exactly as prescribed

Many jurisdictions allow substitution by default and require prescribers to explicitly declare when they do not want substitution.

The attribute is mandatory because it must be known whether the indicator is true or false.

1Mand
reasonCode : (SubstanceAdminSubstitutionNotAllowedReason)

Business name: Not Allowed Reason

The reason why the prescriber has indicated that substitution is not allowed by the dispensing pharmacy.

Some jurisdictions demand that a prescriber gives a reason for prohibiting substitution.

The field is marked as 'Populated' because the reason for substitution is important to understanding the decision. However when a prescription is being recorded in the pharmacy, the information may not be available.

1Pop
PORX_MT060340CA.SupplyEvent
classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : (ActPharmacySupplyType)

Business name: Dispense Type

Indicates the type of dispensing event that is performed. Examples include: Trial Fill, Completion of Trial, Partial Fill, Emergency Fill, Samples, etc.

Indicates reason for the size of dispense. Because it defines what type of dispense is occurring, the attribute is mandatory.

DispensedItem.activityType

D52

ZDP.2

Claim.403-D3

Claim.343-HD

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: Dispense Processing and Pickup Date

Represents the date the dispense product was prepared and when the product was picked up by or delivered to the patient. The dispense processing date and pickup date can be back dated to reflect when the actual processing and pickup occurred. The lower-bound of the period signifies the dispense-processing date whereas the upper-bound signifies the dispense-pickup date.

Used by the system in calculating expected exhaustion time. Valuable in compliance checking. This attribute is mandatory because an existing dispense record must at least indicate the date it was processed.

ZPB3.9

ZDP.17 (high)

DRU.040-02 (low, qualifier=07, format=102)

DRU.040-02 (low, qualifier=36, format=102)

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

Dispense Date

Dispense Date

DispensedItem.dispenseDate

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

1Mand
quantity : PQ.DRUG

Business name: Dispensed Quantity

The amount of medication that has been dispensed. Includes unit of measure.

Critical in understanding the patient's medication profile, both past and current, This is also mandatory to allow determination of the amount that remains to be dispensed against the prescription.

D58

ZPB3.4

ZDP.10.1

Claim.460-ET

Claim.600-28

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

Quantity

DispensedItem.dispensedAmount

1Mand
expectedUseTime : IVL.WIDTH<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: Dispense Days Supply

The number of days that the dispensed quantity is expected to last.

Cannot be mandatory as there are some situations where 'as needed' cannot be used to determine days supply.

Useful in monitoring patient compliance. May also be useful in determining and managing certain contraindications ('Fill-Too-Soon', 'Fill-Too-Late', and 'Duration of Therapy'). Because 'Days Supply' may be necessary to compute total dispensed quantity, it is made a 'populated' field.

D59(width)

PORX_MT060340CA.SupplyEventFirstSummary

Business name: First Dispense Information

Provides summary information about the first dispense event on the prescription

Useful in understanding the status of a prescription and in planning for renewals.

classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL.HIGH<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: A:First Dispense Pickup Date

Indicates when the first dispense against the prescription was picked up.

Useful in establishing start of therapy.

0-1Req
quantity : PQ.DRUG

Business name: B:First Quantity Dispensed

Indicates the amount of medication first dispensed on the prescription.

Usually establishes trial quantities for a prescription.

Because the quantity should always be known if the first dispense is known, this attribute is mandatory.

1Mand
PORX_MT060340CA.SupplyEventFutureSummary

Business name: Remaining Dispense Information

Provides summary information about what dispenses remain to be performed against the prescription

Useful in understanding the status of a prescription and in planning for renewals.

At least one of quantity and repeatNumber must be specified.

classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
repeatNumber : INT.NONNEG

Business name: A:Fills Remaining

Indicates the number of remaining dispenses estimated, assuming that each fill is equal to the quantity prescribed for a single fill, rounding up.

Indicates the number of dispenses that may still occur.

0-1Req
quantity : PQ.DRUG

Business name: B:Remaining Total Quantity

Indicates the total remaining undispensed quantity authorized against the prescription.

Indicates how much can still be dispensed.

0-1Req
PORX_MT060340CA.SupplyEventLastSummary

Business name: Last Dispense Information

Provides summary information about the most recent dispense event performed against the prescription

Useful in understanding the status of a prescription and in planning for renewals.

classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL.HIGH<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: Last Dispense Pickup Date

Indicates the most recent date on which a dispense on the prescription was picked up.

Useful in determining when a prescription will next need to be dispensed. Also provides an indication of compliance.

0-1Req
quantity : PQ.DRUG

Business name: Last Quantity Dispensed

Indicates the most recent quantity of the drug that was picked up for the prescription.

Useful in determining amount of medication that a patient should have on-hand. Also provides an indication of compliance.

Because the quantity should always be known if the last dispense is known, this attribute is mandatory.

1Mand
PORX_MT060340CA.SupplyEventPastSummary

Business name: Previous Dispense Information

Summarizes the dispenses that have happened against the prescription to date.

Helps in understanding the status of the prescription and evaluating compliance.

At least one of quantity and repeatNumber must be specified.

classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
repeatNumber : INT.NONNEG

Business name: A:Number of Fills Made Against Rx

Indicates the number of dispense events performed against the prescription to date, including trial, partial and complete fills.

Useful in tracking the progress of a prescription.

0-1Req
quantity : PQ.DRUG

Business name: B:Total Supplied Amount

Indicates the amount of the prescribed medication that has been dispensed to-date.

Useful for tracking the progress of a prescription

0-1Req
PORX_MT060340CA.SupplyRequest

Business name: Dispense Instructions

Specification of how the prescribed medication is to be dispensed to the patient. Dispensed instruction information includes the quantity to be dispensed, how often the quantity is to be dispensed, etc.

Sets the parameters within which the dispenser must operate in dispensing the medication to the patient.

A_BillablePharmacyDispense

classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "RQO" (ActMood)1Mand
statusCode : (ActStatus)

Business name: Prescription Dispensable Indicator

This generally mirrors the status for the prescription, but in some circumstances may be changed to 'aborted' while the prescription is still active. When this occurs, it means the prescription may no longer be dispensed, though it may still be administered.

Allows a prescriber to say "Finish what you have on hand, but don't get any more."

Because the status should always be known, this element is mandatory.

1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: A:Dispensing Allowed Period

This indicates the validity period of a prescription (stale dating the Prescription). It reflects the prescriber perspective for the validity of the prescription. Dispenses must not be made against the prescription outside of this period. The lower-bound of the Prescription Effective Period signifies the earliest date that the prescription can be filled for the first time. If an upper-bound is not specified then the Prescription is open-ended or will default to a stale-date based on regulations.

Indicates when the Order becomes valid, and when it ceases to be an actionable Order. Some jurisdictions place a 'stale date' on prescriptions that cause them to become invalid a certain amount of time after they are written. This time may vary by medication.

ZPB3.9

DRU.040-02 (low, qualifier=07, format=102)

DRU.040-02 (low, qualifier=36, format=102)

Number of days (width)

When will drug be administered?(low)

ZDP.17 (high)

Last date dispensed(when summary type is 'most recent')

Prescription.dispensingInterval(period)

Prescription.effectiveDate (low)

Prescription.expiryDate (high)

0-1Req
receiver : Receiver0-5Req
location : Location41Pop
destination : Destination10-1Req
component : Component31-5Pop
PORX_MT060340CA.SupplyRequestItem

Business name: Extended Dispense Instructions

Specification of the overall use duration of the prescrbed medication and/or overall quantity to be dispensed.

Sets the parameters within which the dispenser must operate in dispensing the medication to the patient.

classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "RQO" (ActMood)1Mand
quantity : PQ.DRUG

Business name: B:Total Prescribed Quantity

The overall amount of amount medication to be dispensed under this prescription. Includes any first fills (trials, aligning quantities), the initial standard fill plus all refills.

Sets upper limit for medication to be dispensed. Can be used to verify the intention of the prescriber with respect to the overall medication. Used for comparison when determining whether additional quantity may be dispensed in the context of a part-fill prescription.

Narcotics must always be specified as a total quantity.

0-1Req
expectedUseTime : IVL.WIDTH<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: A:Total Days Supply

The number of days that the overall prescribed item is expected to last, if the patient is compliant with the dispensing and administration of the prescription.

Used to specify a total authorization as a duration rather than a quantity with refills. E.g. dispense 30 at a time, refill for 1 year. May also be sent as an estimate of the expected overall duration of the prescription based on the quantity prescribed. This attribute is mandatory because the prescriber (in discussion with the patient) has a better understanding of the days supply needed by the patient.

1Mand
product : Product10-1Req
component1 : Component81Mand
component2 : Component70-1Req
PORX_MT060340CA.TrialSupplyPermission

Business name: *Trial Prescription?

Identification of prescriptions for which dispensers are encouraged to dispense partial quantities on trial basis.

Trial fills are usually done with drugs that are either being tried on the patient for the first time or that the patient has indicated minor discomfort with their use. In order for the patient not to be saddled with costly and excessive medication on-hand, the tral process allows patients to test the tolerance and efficacy of drugs before completing fills.

Prescription.trialAuthorized('True' if this class is present)

classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "PERM" (ActMood)1Mand
code : "TF" (ActCode)1Mand
PORX_MT060340CA.VerificationEventCriterion
classCode : "VERIF" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN.CRT" (ActMood)1Mand
code : "VFPAPER" (ActCode)1Mand
PORX_MT060340CA.WorkingListEvent

Business name: Drug Use

Categorization of prescriptions based on the intended duration of the prescribed therapy.

Useful in establishing compliance for drug renewals and refills.

classCode : "LIST" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : (ActTherapyDurationWorkingListCode)

Business name: D:Treatment Type

Describes the categorization of the therapy envisioned by this prescription (e.g Continuous/Chronic, Short-Term/Acute and "As-Needed).

Allows categorizing prescription for presentation. May influence detection of duplicate therapy. May also be used to affect how DUR processing is completed.

The field is marked as "populated" because the intended duration of the therapy should generally be known at prescribe time. However in some circumstances, it may not be known whether a therapy will be short-term or long-term.

Prescription type

Prescription.drugUseIndicator

1Mand

PORX_MT060360CA

PORX_MT060360CA.IncludeIssuesIndicator
value :

Business name: Include Issues Indicator

Indicates whether or not Issues (detected and/or managed) attached to the prescription dispense record to be returned along with the detailed information.

Allows for the flexibility of omitting/including issues in the retrieval of patient medication data.

Because the attribute is boolean, it must explicitly indicate a 'TRUE' or 'FALSE', and thus it is mandatory.

1Mand
PORX_MT060360CA.IncludeNotesIndicator
value :

Business name: Include Notes Indicator

Indicates whether or not notes attached to the prescription dispense record are to be returned along with the detailed information.

Allows for the flexibility of omitting/including notes in the retrieval of information for medication detail data.

Because the attribute is boolean, it must explicitly indicate a 'TRUE' or 'FALSE', and thus it is mandatory.

1Mand
PORX_MT060360CA.ParameterList

Business name: Generic Query Parameters

Defines the set of parameters that may be used to filter the query response.

Root class for query definition

includeIssuesIndicator : IncludeIssuesIndicator1Mand
includeNotesIndicator : IncludeNotesIndicator1Mand
patientBirthDate : PatientBirthDate1Mand
patientGender : PatientGender1Mand
patientID : PatientID1Mand
patientName : PatientName1Mand
prescriptionDispenseNumber : PrescriptionDispenseNumber1Mand
PORX_MT060360CA.PatientBirthDate
value : TS.DATE

Business name: Patient Birth Date

Indicates the date on which the patient was born.

Used to confirm the identity of the patient for the query and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
PORX_MT060360CA.PatientGender
value : (AdministrativeGender)

Business name: Patient Gender

Indicates the gender (sex) of the patient.

Used to confirm the identity of the patient for the query and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
PORX_MT060360CA.PatientID
value : II

Business name: B:Patient ID

Identifier of the patient who is the subject of the patient medication query. Filter the result set to include only those records pertaining to the patient with this Id.

Allows filtering of result set by patient Id. This is a mandatory field because a patient must be specified for the query to be valid

1Mand
PORX_MT060360CA.PatientName
value : PN.BASIC

Business name: C:Patient Name

The name of the patient who is the subject of the patient medication query.

Filter the result set to include only those records pertaining to the patient with this name.

Allows filtering of result set by patient name. This is a mandatory field because a patient name must match the patient Id for the query to be valid.

1Mand
PORX_MT060360CA.PrescriptionDispenseNumber
value : II

Business name: D:Prescription Dispense Number

Identifies which prescription dispense record should be retrieved.

Allows for the retrieval of medication records relating to a specific dispense record. A dispense cannot be retrieved without the identifier of the record, and the attribute is therefore mandatory.

1Mand

PORX_MT980010CA.DetectedIssueEvent

Business name: Issues

This is the list of clinical and business issues that have been detected and recorded involving the current action.

Provides a list of issues that have been detected and/or managed.

classCode : "ALRT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : (ActDetectedIssueCode)

Business name: A:Issue Type

A coded value that is used to distinguish between different kinds of issues. Types of issue include: unrecognized identifiers, permission issues, drug-drug contraindications, drug-allergy alerts, duplicate therapies, etc.

Identifies what kind of issue was detected or is being managed.

This is mandatory so as to ensure that one issue type can be distinguished from another.

Contraindication.crossSensitive (if code is related reaction dected issue then crossSensitive is 'True')

Distinguishes between DAI, DDI, DosageCheck, DPD, and Duplicate Therapy Contraindications

Business name: C:Issue Priority

A coded value denoting the importance of a detectable issue. Valid codes are: I - for Information, E - for Error, and W - for Warning.

Allows the provider to make informed decision on the importance and criticality of an issue. May also be used by the DIS to determine the order of returning issues. Attribute is mandatory because every issue needs to be prioritized.

PORX_MT980010CA.ObservationCodedEvent

Business name: Patient Coded Observations

This is the recorded observation (e.g. allergy, medical condition, lab result, pregnancy status, etc.) of the patient that contributed to the issue being raised.

Useful for determining appropriate management and for drilling down for more information.

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: A:Observation Identifier

Unique identifier for the record of the coded observation (e.g. allergy, medical condition, pregnancy status, etc.) that contributed to the issue.

Allows lookup of the specific coded observation (e.g. allergy, medical condition, pregnancy status, etc.) for additional details when evaluating appropriateness of issue management.

1Pop
code : CD (ObservationIssueTriggerCodedObservationType)

Business name: B:Observation Type

Distinguishes the kinds of coded observation that could be the trigger for clinical issue detection. Coded Observation types include: Allergy, Intolerance, Medical Condition, Indication, Pregnancy status, Lactation status and other observable information about a person that may be deemed as a possible trigger for clinical issue detection.

Indicates the type of recorded observation being referenced. The attribute is mandatory because it is essential to interpreting the rest of the information on the class.

Differentiates DAI from DPD Contraindications

DRU.100-04 (mnemonic)

DRU.100-05 (code system)

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
confidentialityCode : (x_VeryBasicConfidentialityKind)

Business name: D:Observation Masking Indicator

An indication of sensitivity surrounding the related condition, and thus defines the required sensitivity for the detected issue.

Conveys the patient's wishes relating to the sensitivity of the observation information.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

Contraindication.intractingSourceMasked (Normal=false; Restricted or Very Restricted = True); (Information is withheld because the prescription is masked will be given a NULL flavour of 'Masked')

PORX_MT980010CA.ObservationEventCriterion

Business name: Dosage Preconditions

A condition that must be true for the patient in order for the specified recommended dosage range to apply.

Allows recommended dosage instructions to be bound to a particular characteristic of the patient.

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN.CRT" (ActMood)1Mand
code : (ObservationDosageDefinitionPreconditionType)

Business name: A:Dosage Precondition Type

Indicates the type of characteristic against which the patient is evaluated. This includes age, weight, height, etc.

Allows the specification of multiple preconditions for a dosage specification, such as Age Range, Weight Range, etc. This is mandatory because the precondition range cannot be evaluated without knowing the precondition type.

1Mand
value : URG<PQ.BASIC>

Business name: B:Dosage Precondition Value

A specific value or range of values of the Dosage Precondition Type, for which the recommended dosage applies.

This includes min-max age range, min-max weights, etc.

This is a mandatory attribute as the values of the measurements must be known.

If not specified, it means that the range is based on a criteria (e.g. weight), but the specific range on which the criteria is based is not known.

Allows direct comparison of the patient's characteristics with the minimum and maximum values specified.

The element is mandatory because there's no point in identifying that the dosage range is based on criteria unless the specific criterion used is expressed.

Minimum Age

Maximum Age

1Mand
PORX_MT980010CA.ObservationMeasurableEvent

Business name: Patient Measurable Observations

This is the recorded observation (e.g. height, weight, lab result, etc.) of the patient that contributed to the issue being raised.

Useful for determining appropriate management and for drilling down for more information.

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand

The attribute is marked as populated because it may be masked.

Distinguishes between the kinds of measurable observation that could be the trigger for clinical issue detection. Measurable observation types include: Lab Result, Height, Weight, and other measurable information about a person that may be deemed as a possible trigger for clinical issue detection.

Indicates the type of observation record being referenced. The attribute is mandatory because it is essential to interpreting the rest of the information on the class.

statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

Indicates the event/process that caused the issue to occur.

The issue can be caused by information on the Patient’s profile, including Active Medication and/or Dispense, and/or Patient Coded Observations (pregnancy, geriatric, allergy/intolerance, etc), and/or Patient Measurable Observations (height, weight, etc)

Helps with management of the issue.

PORX_MT980010CA.SubstanceAdministration

Business name: Active Medication

Indicates an active medication (prescription or non-prescription medication) that is recorded in the patient’s record and which contributed to triggering the issue.

Allows providers to identify the offending drugs when determining their management approach.

classCode : "SBADM" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : (x_ActMoodOrderEvent)

Business name: Other Medication Indicator

If the attribute is 'RQO', represents a prescription or dispense record. Otherwise if 'EVN', it represents an 'Other Medication' record.

Knowing whether a drug is prescribed or not can influence actions taken to mitigate an issue. This attribute is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
id : II

Business name: A:Active Medication Record Number

Unique identifier of the prescription or other medication drug record that triggered the issue.

Allows provider to drill-down and retrieve additional information about the implicated drug therapy to either modify the therapy or to learn more information in determining their management approach for the issue.

The attribute is marked as populated because it may be masked.

DDI/DuplicateTherapy.InteractingPrescriptionNumber

InteractingPrescription.PrescriptionExternalKey

InteractingPrescription.PrescriptionNumber

DDI/Dosage/Duplicate Therapy.SourceNumber (All senders must uniquely identify prescriptions on request)

1Pop
code : CD (ActSubstanceAdministrationCode)

Business name: Administration Type

Identifies whether the interaction is with a drug or a vaccine. For SNOMED, may also indicate the specific drug or vaccine at issue.

Needed to determine what to do about the issue. Because the medication can be masked, this element is only marked as 'populated'.

The element allows a full 'CD' type to support SNOMED implementations.

1Pop
statusCode : (ActStatus)

Business name: B:Active Medication Status

Indicates the status of the medication record at the time of the issue.

Used to determine the relevance of the issue and the need to manage it. For example, if the medication is on hold, it may be less of an issue than if it is being actively taken.

ZPB3.8 (aborted = discontinued; nullified = reversed/system reversed; active=filled/not-filled)

0-1Req
effectiveTime : IVL<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: C:Active Medication Time-range

The date and time during which the patient is expected to be taking the drug which triggered the issue.

Allows the provider to evaluate ‘duplicate therapy’ and similar timing-based issues.

Requested Duration

0-1Req
confidentialityCode : (x_VeryBasicConfidentialityKind)

Business name: E:Active Medication Masking Indicator

An indication of sensitivity surrounding the related drug, and thus defines the required sensitivity for the detected issue.

Conveys the patient’s wishes relating to the sensitivity of the drug information.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

0-1Opt
doseQuantity : PQ.DRUG

Business name: D:Active Medication Dose Quantity

The amount of medication administered to the patient

Used in Low Dose/High Dose issues.

PORX_MT980010CA.SubstanceAdministrationEventCriterion

Business name: Recommended Dosage

Identifies the outer dosage boundaries that were exceeded and triggered the issue. Included in this information are the drug-specific recommended dosage ranges for various age groups and weight classes.

Provides a reference for calculating optimum dose of medication for patients.

classCode : "SBADM" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN.CRT" (ActMood)1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL.WIDTH<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: A:Dose Duration

Indicates the recommended duration for drug therapy that was exceeded or not met.

Allows calculation of amount under or over.

Recommended Duration (width)

0-1Req
doseQuantity : URG<PQ.DRUG>

Business name: B:Dosage Range

This is a specification of the range of quantity of medication (Min/Max figures) that is recommended for the drug to avoid triggering of dosage issues.

Allows calculation of amount over/under.

ContraIndication.recommendedRange

Maximum Dosage Level (high)

Minimum Dosage Level (low)

PORX_MT980010CA.SupplyEvent

Business name: Dispense

Indicates a particular dispense event that resulted in the issue.

Used when the issue pertains to the supply of the drug rather than the drug itself. E.g. Duplicate pharmacy, refill too soon, etc.

classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: A:Prescription Dispense Number

Unique identifier of the dispensed event that triggered the issue.

Allows provider to drill down and retrieve additional information about the dispense event for consideration in their issue management decision.

The attribute is marked as populated because it may be masked.

1Pop
statusCode : (ActStatus)

Business name: B:Dispense Status

Indicates the status of the dispense record created on the EHR/DIS. If 'Active' it means that the dispense has been processed but not yet given to the patient. If 'Complete', it indicates that the medication has been delivered to the patient.

Important in understanding what medication the patient actually has on hand, thus the attribute is mandatory. May also influence the ability of a different pharmacy to dispense the medication.

1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL.HIGH<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: B:Dispensed Date

The date and time on which the product was issued to the patient.

Applications should specify a null flavor of "Not Applicable" for dispenses that have not yet been picked up.

Allows evaluation of 'refill too soon' and similar issues.

Attribute is marked as 'populated' as a dispense record may not exist without processing date.

ZDU.4.5

1Pop
confidentialityCode : (x_VeryBasicConfidentialityKind)

Business name: C:Dispense Masking Indicator

An indication of sensitivity surrounding the related drug, and thus defines the required sensitivity for the detected issue.

Conveys the patient's wishes relating to the sensitivity of the drug information.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

0-1Opt
product : Product1Pop
location : Location1Pop

Identifies the provider who created the management of the issue.

Part of the audit record, but may not always be known for historical managements.

PORX_MT980020CA.Component

Business name: references

Provides information on the reference dosage instructions associated with the issue

Allows a provider to see what the boundaries are that caused the issue

typeCode : "COMP" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
substanceAdministrationEventCriterion : SubstanceAdministrationEventCriterion1Pop
PORX_MT980020CA.Component2

Business name: applies when

Indicates any pre-conditions that apply to the dosage instruction, such as age-range, height, weight, etc.

Allows different dosage ranges for different age groups, etc

typeCode : "COMP" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
observationEventCriterion : ObservationEventCriterion1Pop
PORX_MT980020CA.Consumable

Business name: related to

Identification of the drug that caused the issue.

Required for effective management of the issue.

The association is only marked as 'required' because SNOMED caon pre-coordinate some drug information into code.

A_DetectedMedicationIssue

This must be populated (with a drug or null flavor) if not using SNOMED

typeCode : "CSM" (ParticipationType)1Mand
medication : Medication1Pop
PORX_MT980020CA.Definition

Business name: is defined by

Relates an issue to an appropriate monograph.

This attribue is marked as "mandatory" because either the rule triggering the issue detection must be specified or a "null flavour" must be specfied.

Allows providers to quickly obtain information on a detected issue.

typeCode : "INST" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
detectedIssueDefinition : DetectedIssueDefinition1Pop
PORX_MT980020CA.DetectedIssueDefinition

Business name: Issue Description

This is the decision support rule that triggered the issue.

Provides detailed background for providers in evaluating the issue.

classCode : "ALRT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "DEF" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: A:Issue Monograph Id

Knowledgebase organization specific identifier for the issue definition.

Allows applications to match with local Knowledge-bases and avoid displaying duplicate issues to providers.

PORX_MT980020CA.DetectedIssueEvent

Business name: Issues

This is the list of clinical and business-rule issues that have been detected and recorded involving the current action.

Provides a list of issues that have been detected.

classCode : "ALRT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : (ActDetectedIssueCode)

Business name: A:Issue Type

A coded value that is used to distinguish between different kinds of issues. Types of issue include: unrecognized identifiers, permission issues, drug-drug contraindications, drug-allergy alerts, duplicate therapies, etc.

Identifies what kind of issue was detected.

This is mandatory so as to ensure that one issue type can be distinguished from another.

Contraindication.crossSensitive (if code is related reaction dected issue then crossSensitive is 'True')

Distinguishes between DAI, DDI, DosageCheck, DPD, and Duplicate Therapy Contraindications

Contraindication.DosageContraType

OverrideReason.reasonDomain

ZP3.3

E06(for contraindications errors are handled at transmission or controlAct wrapper level)

1Mand
text :

Business name: D:Issue Details

A free form textual description of a detected issue. This textual information is provided to either augment the coded information or in place of the coded information.

Lets providers see textual explanation of the issue.

E20(for contraindication errors are handled at transmission or controlact wrapper level)

0-1Req
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
priorityCode : (ActIssuePriority)

Business name: C:Issue Priority

A coded value denoting the importance of a detectable issue. Valid codes are: I - for Information, E - for Error, and W - for Warning.

Allows the provider to make informed decision on the importance and criticality of an issue. May also be used by the DIS to determine the order of returning issues. Attribute is mandatory because every issue needs to be prioritized.

PORX_MT980020CA.DetectedIssueManagement

Business name: Issue Managements

The processes and procedures employed by providers to resolve clinical conflicts between the action being performed and additional information already in the patient's record.

Presents alternatives for how the issue could be managed or has been managed in the past.

A_DetectedMedicationIssue

classCode : "ACT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "DEF" (ActMood)1Mand
code : (ActDetectedIssueManagementCode)

Business name: A:Management Type

Indicates the kinds of management actions that can be taken, based on the issue type.

Ensures consistency in description of management actions.

This is mandatory so as to ensure distinction between different kinds of management.

PORX_MT980020CA.ObservationCodedEvent

Business name: Patient Coded Observations

This is the recorded observation (e.g. allergy, medical condition, lab result, pregnancy status, etc.) of the patient that contributed to the issue being raised.

Useful for determining appropriate management and for drilling down for more information.

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: A:Observation Identifier

Unique identifier for the record of the coded observation (e.g. allergy, medical condition, pregnancy status, etc.) that contributed to the issue.

Allows lookup of the specific coded observation (e.g. allergy, medical condition, pregnancy status, etc) for additional details when evaluating appropriateness of issue management.

1Pop
code : CD (ObservationIssueTriggerCodedObservationType)

Business name: B:Observation Type

Distinguishes the kinds of coded observation that could be the trigger for clinical issue detection. Coded Observation types include: Allergy, Intolerance, Medical Condition, Indication, Pregnancy status, Lactation status and other observable information about a person that may be deemed as a possible trigger for clinical issue detection.

Indicates the type of recorded observation being referenced. The attribute is mandatory because it is essential to interpreting the rest of the information on the class.

Differentiates DAI from DPD Contraindications

DRU.100-04 (mnemonic)

DRU.100-05 (code system)

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
confidentialityCode : (x_VeryBasicConfidentialityKind)

Business name: D:Observation Masked Indicator

An indication of sensitivity surrounding the implicated condition, and thus defines the required sensitivity for the detected issue.

Conveys the patient's wishes relating to the sensitivity of the observation.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

Contraindication.intractingSourceMasked (Normal=false; Restricted or Very Restricted = True); (Information is withheld because the prescription is masked will be given a NULL flavour of 'Masked')

0-1Opt
value : (IssueTriggerObservationValue)

Business name: C:Observation Value

Denotes a specific coded observation made about a person that might have trigger the clinical issue detection.

Provides unambiguous reference to the implicated coded observation.

Containdication.allergenGroupName (PrintName) PIN:Contraindications.drugAllergy (Inferred from Code System - if it is a DIN it is probably a drug)

Contraindication.indicationDescription

Disease Code

0-1Req
PORX_MT980020CA.ObservationEventCriterion

Business name: Dosage Preconditions

A condition that must be true for the patient in order for the specified recommended dosage range to apply.

Allows recommended dosage instructions to be bound to a particular characteristic of the patient.

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN.CRT" (ActMood)1Mand
code : (ObservationDosageDefinitionPreconditionType)

Business name: A:Dosage Precondition Type

Indicates the type of characteristic against which the patient is evaluated. This includes age, weight, height, etc.

Allows the specification of multiple preconditions for a dosage specification, such as Age Range, Weight Range, etc. This is mandatory because the precondition range cannot be evaluated without knowing the precondition type.

1Mand
value : URG<PQ.BASIC>

Business name: B:Dosage Precondition Value

A specific value or range of values of the Dosage Precondition Type, for which the recommended dosage applies.

This includes min-max age range, min-max weights, etc.

This attribute is mandatory as the specific range of values must be known.

If not specified, it means that the range is based on a criteria (e.g. weight), but the specific range on which the criteria is based is not known.

Allows direct comparison of the patient's characteristics with the minimum and maximum values specified.

The element is mandatory because there's no point in identifying that the dosage range is based on criteria unless the specific criterion used is expressed.

Minimum Age

Maximum Age

1Mand
PORX_MT980020CA.ObservationMeasurableEvent

Business name: Patient Measurable Observations

This is the recorded observation (e.g. allergy, medical condition, lab result, weight, pregnancy status, etc.) of the patient that contributed to the issue being raised.

Useful for determining appropriate management and for drilling down for more information.

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: A:Observation Identifier

Unique identifier for the record of the observation (e.g. height, weight or lab test/result) that contributed to the issue.

Allows lookup of the specific observation (e.g. height, weight, or lab record) for additional details when evaluating appropriateness of issue management.

The attribute is only marked as 'populated' because it may be masked.

1Pop
code : (ObservationIssueTriggerMeasuredObservationType)

Business name: B:Observation Type

Distinguishes between the kinds of measurable observations that can trigger clinical issues. Measurable observation types include: Lab Result, Height, Weight, and other measurable information about a person that may be deemed as a possible trigger for clinical issue detection.

Indicates the type of observation record being referenced. The attribute is mandatory because it is essential to interpreting the rest of the information on the class.

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
confidentialityCode : (x_VeryBasicConfidentialityKind)

Business name: D:Observation Masked Indicator

An indication of sensitivity surrounding the offending measurable observation, and thus defines the required sensitivity for the detected issue.

Conveys the patient's wishes relating to the sensitivity of the observation.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

Contraindication.intractingSourceMasked (Normal=false; Restricted or Very Restricted = True); (Information is withheld because the prescription is masked will be given a NULL flavour of 'Masked')

0-1Opt
value : PQ.BASIC

Business name: C:Observation Value

Denotes a specific measurable observation made about a person that triggered the clinical issue detection.

Provides unambiguous reference to the implicated measurable observation.

0-1Req

A_DetectedMedicationIssue

PORX_MT980020CA.StorageIntent

Business name: Persistent Indicator

Indicates that this issue will be persisted as part of the patient's record.

Some issues are transitory and are only relevant while a request is being made. Others are relevant for clinical communication and need to be made available after the fact. When deciding whether and how to manage an issue, it is important to recognize which category it fits within.

This element behaves as a mandatory boolean where the presence of the association indicates true and the absence of the association indicates false.

classCode : "STORE" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "INT" (ActMood)1Mand
PORX_MT980020CA.Subject

Business name: has

Indicates the level og gravity of the detected issue.

Useful for determining contraindications to be manages.

typeCode : "SUBJ" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
severityObservation : SeverityObservation1Mand
PORX_MT980020CA.Subject2

Business name: caused by

Indicates the event/process that caused the issue to occur.

The issue can be caused by information on the Patient's profile, including Active Medication and/or Dispense, and/or Patient Coded Observations (pregnancy, geriatric, allergy/intolerance, etc), and/or Patient Measurable Observations (height, weight, etc)

Helps with management of the issue.

typeCode : "SUBJ" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand

PORX_MT980020CA.SubstanceAdministration

Business name: Active Medication

Indicates an active medication (prescription or non-prescription medication) that is recorded in the patient's record and which contributed to triggering the issue.

Allows providers to identify the implicated drugs when determining their management approach.

classCode : "SBADM" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : (x_ActMoodOrderEvent)

Business name: Other Medication Indicator

If the attribute is 'RQO', represents a prescription or dispense record. Otherwise if 'EVN', it represents an 'Other Medication' record.

Knowing whether a drug is prescribed or not can influence actions taken to mitigate an issue. The element is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
id : II

Business name: A:Active Medication Record Number

Unique identifier of the prescription or other medication drug record that triggered the issue.

Allows provider to drill-down and retrieve additional information about the implicated drug therapy to either modify the therapy or to learn more information in determining their management approach for the issue

The attribute is only marked as 'populated' because it may be masked.

DDI/DuplicateTherapy.InteractingPrescriptionNumber

InteractingPrescription.PrescriptionExternalKey

InteractingPrescription.PrescriptionNumber

DDI/Dosage/Duplicate Therapy.SourceNumber (All senders must uniquely identify prescriptions on request)

1Pop
code : CD (ActSubstanceAdministrationCode)

Business name: Administration Type

Identifies whether the interaction is with a drug or a vaccine. For SNOMED, may also indicate the specific drug or vaccine at issue.

Needed to determine what to do about the issue. Because the medication can be masked, this element is only marked as 'populated'.

The element allows a full 'CD' type to support SNOMED implementations.

1Pop
statusCode : (ActStatus)

Business name: B:Active Medication Status

Indicates the status of the medication record at the time of the issue.

Used to determine the relevance of the issue and the need to manage it. For example, if the medication is on hold, it may be less of an issue than if it is being actively taken.

ZPB3.8 (aborted = discontinued; nullified = reversed/system reversed; active=filled/not-filled)

0-1Req
effectiveTime : IVL<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: C:Active Medication Time-range

The date and time during which the patient is expected to be taking the drug which triggered the issue.

Allows the provider to evaluate 'duplicate therapy' and similar timing-based issues.

Requested Duration

0-1Req
confidentialityCode : (x_VeryBasicConfidentialityKind)

Business name: E:Active Medication Masking Indicator

An indication of sensitivity surrounding the implicated drug, and thus defines the required sensitivity for the detected issue.

Conveys the patient's wishes relating to the sensitivity of the drug.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

0-1Opt
doseQuantity : PQ.DRUG

Business name: D:Active Medication Dose Quantity

The amount of medication administered to the patient

Used in Low Dose/High Dose issues.

Requested Dosage Level

PORX_MT980020CA.SubstanceAdministrationEventCriterion

Business name: Recommended Dosage

Identifies the outer dosage boundaries that were exceeded and triggered the issue. Included in this information are the drug-specific recommended dosage ranges for various age groups, weight classes, etc.

Provides a reference for calculating optimum dose of medication for patients.

classCode : "SBADM" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN.CRT" (ActMood)1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL.WIDTH<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: A:Dose Duration

Indicates the recommended duration for drug therapy that was exceeded or not met.

Allows calculation of amount under or over.

Recommended Duration (width)

0-1Req
doseQuantity : URG<PQ.DRUG>

Business name: B:Dosage Range

This is a specification of the range of quantity of medication (Min/Max figures) that is recommended for the drug to avoid triggering of dosage issues.

Allows calculation of amount over/under.

ContraIndication.recommendedRange

Maximum Dosage Level (high)

Minimum Dosage Level (low)

PORX_MT980020CA.SupplyEvent

Business name: Dispense

Indicates a particular dispense event that resulted in the issue.

Used when the issue pertains to the supply of the drug rather than the drug itself. E.g. Duplicate pharmacy, refill too soon, etc.

classCode : "SPLY" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: A:Prescription Dispense Number

Unique identifier of the dispense event that triggered the issue.

Allows provider to drill down and retrieve additional information about the dispense event for consideration in their issue management decision.

The attribute is only marked as 'populated' because it may be masked.

1Pop
statusCode : (ActStatus)

Business name: B:Dispense Status

Indicates the status of the dispense record created on the EHR/DIS. If 'Active' it means that the dispense has been processed but not yet given to the patient. If 'Complete', it indicates that the medication has been delivered to the patient.

Important in understanding what medication the patient actually has on hand, thus the attribute is mandatory. May also influence the ability of a different pharmacy to dispense the medication.

1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL.HIGH<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: B:Dispensed Date

The date and time on which the product was dispensed to the patient.

Applications should specify a null flavor of "Not Applicable" for dispenses that have not yet been picked up.

Allows evaluation of 'refill too soon' and similar issues.

Attribute is marked as "populated" as a dispense record may not exist without processing date.

ZDU.4.5

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

product : Product1Pop
location : Location1Pop
PORX_MT980020CA.Trigger2

Business name: C:Management Required?

Information that indicates whether or not a detected issue needs to be managed.

Lets applications distinguish between minor issues that require no management versus those that need management to successfully process the request.

The association behaves as a mandatory attribute where the presence of the association indicates 'true', while the absence of indicates 'false'.

Contraindication.ManagementRequired (True, if this association is present)

typeCode : "TRIG" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
actRequest : ActRequest1Pop

typeCode : "COMP" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
substanceAdministrationEventCriterion : SubstanceAdministrationEventCriterion1Pop

PORX_MT980030CA.DetectedIssueEvent

Business name: Issues

This is the list of clinical and business issues that have been detected and recorded involving the current action.

Provides a list of issues that have been detected and/or managed.

classCode : "ALRT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : (ActDetectedIssueCode)

Business name: A:Issue Type

A coded value that is used to distinguish between different kinds of issues. Types of issue include: unrecognized identifiers, permission issues, drug-drug contraindications, drug-allergy alerts, duplicate therapies, suspect fraud etc.

Identifies what kind of issue was detected or is being managed.

This is mandatory so as to ensure that one issue type can be distinguished from another.

Contraindication.crossSensitive (if code is related reaction dected issue then crossSensitive is 'True')

Distinguishes between DAI, DDI, DosageCheck, DPD, and Duplicate Therapy Contraindications

priorityCode : (ActIssuePriority)

Business name: C:Issue Priority

A coded value denoting the importance of a detectable issue. Valid codes are: I - for Information, E - for Error, and W - for Warning.

Allows the provider to make informed decision on the importance and criticality of an issue. May also be used by the DIS to determine the order of returning issues. Attribute is mandatory because every issue needs to be prioritized.

PORX_MT980030CA.ObservationCodedEvent

Business name: Patient Coded Observations

This is the recorded observation (e.g. allergy, medical condition, lab result, pregnancy status, etc.) of the patient that contributed to the issue being raised.

Useful for determining appropriate management and for drilling down for more information.

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: A:Observation Identifier

Unique identifier for the record of the coded observation (e.g. allergy, medical condition, pregnancy status, etc.) that contributed to the issue.

Allows lookup of the specific coded observation (e.g. allergy, medical condition, pregnancy status, etc.) for additional details when evaluating appropriateness of issue management.

1Pop
code : CD (ObservationIssueTriggerCodedObservationType)

Business name: B:Observation Type

Distinguishes the kinds of coded observation that could be the trigger for clinical issue detection. Coded Observation types include: Allergy, Intolerance, Medical Condition, Indication, Pregnancy status, Lactation status and other observable information about a person that may be deemed as a possible trigger for clinical issue detection.

Indicates the type of recorded observation being referenced. The attribute is mandatory because it is essential to interpreting the rest of the information on the class.

Differentiates DAI from DPD Contraindications

DRU.100-04 (mnemonic)

DRU.100-05 (code system)

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
confidentialityCode : (x_VeryBasicConfidentialityKind)

Business name: D:Observation Masking Indicator

An indication of sensitivity surrounding the related condition, and thus defines the required sensitivity for the detected issue.

Conveys the patient's wishes relating to the sensitivity of the observation information.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

Contraindication.intractingSourceMasked (Normal=false; Restricted or Very Restricted = True); (Information is withheld because the prescription is masked will be given a NULL flavour of 'Masked')

0-1Opt
value : (IssueTriggerObservationValue)

Business name: C:Observation Value

Denotes a specific coded observation made about a person that might have trigger the clinical issue detection.

Provides unambiguous reference to the related coded observation.

0-1Req
PORX_MT980030CA.ObservationEventCriterion

Business name: Dosage Preconditions

A condition that must be true for the patient in order for the specified recommended dosage range to apply.

Allows recommended dosage instructions to be bound to a particular characteristic of the patient.

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN.CRT" (ActMood)1Mand
code : (ObservationDosageDefinitionPreconditionType)

Business name: A:Dosage Precondition Type

Indicates the type of characteristic against which the patient is evaluated. This includes age, weight, height, etc.

Allows the specification of multiple preconditions for a dosage specification, such as Age Range, Weight Range, etc. This is mandatory because the precondition range cannot be evaluated without knowing the precondition type.

1Mand
value : URG<PQ.BASIC>

Business name: B:Dosage Precondition Value

A specific value or range of values of the Dosage Precondition Type, for which the recommended dosage applies.

This includes min-max age range, min-max weights, etc.

This is a mandatory attribute as the specific range of values must be known.

If not specified, it means that the range is based on a criteria (e.g. weight), but the specific range on which the criteria is based is not known.

Allows direct comparison of the patient's characteristics with the minimum and maximum values specified.

The element is mandatory because there's no point in identifying that the dosage range is based on criteria unless the specific criterion used is expressed.

Minimum Age

Maximum Age

1Mand
PORX_MT980030CA.ObservationMeasurableEvent

Business name: Patient Measurable Observations

This is the recorded observation (e.g. height, weight, lab result, etc.) of the patient that contributed to the issue being raised.

Useful for determining appropriate management and for drilling down for more information.

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: A:Observation Identifier

Unique identifier for the record of the observation (e.g. height, weight or lab test/result) that contributed to the issue.

Allows lookup of the specific observation (e.g. height, weight, or lab record) for additional details when evaluating appropriateness of issue management.

The attribute is marked as populated because it may be masked.

1Pop
code : (ObservationIssueTriggerMeasuredObservationType)

Business name: B:Observation Type

Distinguishes between the kinds of measurable observation that could be the trigger for clinical issue detection. Measurable observation types include: Lab Result, Height, Weight, and other measurable information about a person that may be deemed as a possible trigger for clinical issue detection.

Indicates the type of observation record being referenced. The attribute is mandatory because it is essential to interpreting the rest of the information on the class.

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand

Conveys the patient’s wishes relating to the sensitivity of the observation information.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

PORX_MT980030CA.Subject2

Business name: caused by

Indicates the event/process that caused the issue to occur.

The issue can be caused by information on the Patient's profile, including Active Medication and/or Dispense, and/or Patient Coded Observations (pregnancy, geriatric, allergy/intolerance, etc), and/or Patient Measurable Observations (height, weight, etc)

Helps with management of the issue.

PORX_MT980030CA.SubstanceAdministration

Business name: Active Medication

Indicates an active medication (prescription or non-prescription medication) that is recorded in the patient's record and which contributed to triggering the issue.

Allows providers to identify the offending drugs when determining their management approach.

classCode : "SBADM" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : (x_ActMoodOrderEvent)

Business name: Other Medication Indicator

If the attribute is 'RQO', represents a prescription or dispense record. Otherwise if 'EVN', it represents an 'Other Medication' record.

Knowing whether a drug is prescribed or not can influence actions taken to mitigate an issue. The element is therefore mandatory

1Mand
id : II

Business name: A:Active Medication Record Number

Unique identifier of the prescription or other medication drug record that triggered the issue.

Allows provider to drill-down and retrieve additional information about the implicated drug therapy to either modify the therapy or to learn more information in determining their management approach for the issue.

The attribute is marked as populated because it may be masked.

DDI/DuplicateTherapy.InteractingPrescriptionNumber

InteractingPrescription.PrescriptionExternalKey

InteractingPrescription.PrescriptionNumber

DDI/Dosage/Duplicate Therapy.SourceNumber (All senders must uniquely identify prescriptions on request)

1Pop
code : CD (ActSubstanceAdministrationCode)

Business name: Administration Type

Identifies whether the interaction is with a drug or a vaccine. For SNOMED, may also indicate the specific drug or vaccine at issue.

Needed to determine what to do about the issue. Because the medication can be masked, this element is only marked as 'populated'.

The element allows a full 'CD' type to support SNOMED implementations.

1Pop
statusCode : (ActStatus)

Business name: B:Active Medication Status

Indicates the status of the medication record at the time of the issue.

Used to determine the relevance of the issue and the need to manage it. For example, if the medication is on hold, it may be less of an issue than if it is being actively taken.

ZPB3.8 (aborted = discontinued; nullified = reversed/system reversed; active=filled/not-filled)

0-1Req
effectiveTime : IVL<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: C:Active Medication Time-range

The date and time during which the patient is expected to be taking the drug which triggered the issue.

Allows the provider to evaluate 'duplicate therapy' and similar timing-based issues.

Requested Duration

0-1Req
confidentialityCode : (x_VeryBasicConfidentialityKind)

Business name: E:Active Medication Masking Indicator

An indication of sensitivity surrounding the related drug, and thus defines the required sensitivity for the detected issue.

Conveys the patient's wishes relating to the sensitivity of the drug information.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

0-1Opt
doseQuantity : PQ.DRUG

Business name: D:Active Medication Dose Quantity

The amount of medication administered to the patient
