REPC_MT000004CA

REPC_MT000004CA.AllergyIntoleranceStatus
value : (ActStatus)

Business name: G:Allergy/Intolerance Status

Indicates that the result set should be filtered to include only those allergy/intolerance records for the specified status. Valid statuses include: ACTIVE or COMPLETE.

Allows for the selective retrieval of allergy/intolerance records based on the status of the record.

1Mand
REPC_MT000004CA.AllergyIntoleranceType
value : CD (ObservationIntoleranceType)

Business name: H:Allergy/Intolerance Type

A coded value indicating whether to return an allergy record or an intolerance record. The result set will be filtered to include only allergy records or intolerance records accordingly.

Allows allergy/intolerance records to be selectively searched and retrieved.

1Mand
REPC_MT000004CA.AlllergyIntoleranceChangePeriod
value : IVL<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: F:Allergy/Intolerance Change Period

Filters the query response to only include allergy/intolerance records which have been created or modified within the date-range specified.

Useful in retrieving incremental changes to the patient's record.

1Mand
REPC_MT000004CA.IncludeNotesIndicator
value :

Business name: Include Notes Indicator

Indicates whether or not notes attached to the allergy/intolerance records are to be returned along with the detailed information.

Allows for the flexibility of omitting/including notes in the retrieval of information for allergy/intolerance data.

Because the attribute is boolean, it must explicitly indicate a 'TRUE' or 'FALSE', and thus it is mandatory.

1Mand
REPC_MT000004CA.ParameterList

Business name: Allergy/Intolerance Query Parameters

Defines the set of parameters that may be used to filter the query response

Root class for query definition

allergyIntoleranceStatus : AllergyIntoleranceStatus0-1Req
allergyIntoleranceType : AllergyIntoleranceType0-1Req
alllergyIntoleranceChangePeriod : AlllergyIntoleranceChangePeriod0-1Req
includeNotesIndicator : IncludeNotesIndicator1Mand
patientBirthDate : PatientBirthDate1Mand
patientGender : PatientGender1Mand
patientID : PatientID1Mand
patientName : PatientName1Mand
reactionType : ReactionType0-1Req
REPC_MT000004CA.PatientBirthDate
value : TS.DATE

Business name: E:Patient Birth Date

Indicates the date on which the patient was born.

Used to confirm the identity of the patient for the query and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
REPC_MT000004CA.PatientGender
value : (AdministrativeGender)

Business name: D:Patient Gender

Indicates the gender (sex) of the patient.

Used to confirm the identity of the patient for the query and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
REPC_MT000004CA.PatientID
value : II

Business name: B:Patient ID

Identifier of the patient who is the subject of the allergy/intolerance query. Filter the result set to include only those records pertaining to the patient with this Id.

Allows filtering of result set by patient Id. This is a mandatory field because a patient must be specified for the query to be valid.

1Mand
REPC_MT000004CA.PatientName
value : PN.BASIC

Business name: C:Patient Name

The name of the patient who is the subject of the allergy/intolerance query. Filter the result set to include only those records pertaining to the patient with this name.

Allows filtering of result set by patient name. This is a mandatory field because a patient name must match the patient Id for the query to be valid.

1Mand
REPC_MT000004CA.ReactionType
value : (SubjectReaction)

Business name: I:Reaction

A coded value denoting a specific reaction. E.g. Code for 'rash'. The result set will be filtered to include only those allergy records or intolerance records pertaining to the specified reaction.

Allows allergy/intolerance records to be selectively searched and retrieved.

1Mand
 
 

REPC_MT000005CA

REPC_MT000005CA.AdministrableMaterial

Business name: Exposed Material

A specific material or agent that to which the patient was exposed. Examples are: Codein (Drug), Peanut (Food), etc.

Allows the provider to zero in on specific culprits for the adverse reaction.

classCode : "ADMM" (RoleClass)1Mand
administerableMaterialKind : MaterialKind1Mand
REPC_MT000005CA.AllergyTestEvent

Business name: Allergy Tests

Indicates the specific allergy test that supports the recording of the allergy/intolerance.

Provides evidence for recording the allergy/intolerance.

Value is mandatory if not using SNOMED

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: B:Allergy Test Record Id

An identifier for a specific instance of an allergy/intolerance test.

Allows an allergy/intolerance test record to be directly referenced.

0-1Req
code : CD (ObservationAllergyTestType)

Business name: A:Allergy Test Type

A coded value denoting the type of allergy test conducted.

Allows different kinds of allergy/intolerance tests to be distinguishable and is therefore mandatory. It uses the CD type to support SNOMED post-coordination.

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
effectiveTime : TS.DATE

Business name: D:Allergy Test Date

The date on which the allergy test was performed.

Allows providers to evaluate the currency of the test.

0-1Req
value : (AllergyTestValue)

Business name: C:Allergy Test Result

A code indicating result of the allergy test.

Allows other providers to evaluate the test. There is no point in associating an allergy test with unknown results with an allergy or intolerance however the element is optional because this information may be post-coordinated in the 'code' attribute using SNOMED.

0-1Opt
REPC_MT000005CA.AnnotationIndicator

Business name: Note Indicator

If present, indicates that there are notes associated with the allergy or intolerance.

Shows whether additional information is available on further drill-down

classCode : "ACT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
REPC_MT000005CA.Author

Business name: *f:authored by

Identifies the provider who reported the allergy or intolerance.

Identifies responsibility for accuracy and relevance of the information. This association reflects primary responsibility, and is therefore mandatory.

AllergyIntolerance.authorizingProvider

ZPB1.3

AllergyIntolerance.authorizingPhysician

typeCode : "AUT" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AP" (ContextControl)1Mand
time : TS.FULLDATETIME

Business name: Create Timestamp

The date and time on which the allergy/intolerance record was created.

Identifies timing of allergy/intolerance for sorting and for audit purposes. Attribute is populated because the source of the data may not be through the 'record allergy/intolerance' interaction.

1Pop
assignedPerson : AssignedPerson1Mand
REPC_MT000005CA.CausalityAssessment

Business name: Reported Reactions

This is a recording of a patient reaction that is believed to be associated with the allergy/intolerance.

Helps providers to distinguish between proper allergies and intolerances. Allows the provider recording the allergy to assign appropriate severity to the allergy. May give insight on how to mitigate an intolerance that is likely to be triggered by administering a substance. (E.g. If a given drug typically causes nausea in the patient, an additional medication may be co-prescribed to manage the nausea.)

Value is mandatory if not using SNOMED

Code must be fixed to RXNASSESS if not using SNOMED

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : CD (ActCode)

Business name: Assessment Type

Indicates the type of assessment being made

For SNOMED this will include the actual assessment. For non-SNOMED, this should be fixed to RXNASSESS.

Communicates the relatedness assessment of the exposure to the reaction and is therefore mandatory. For SNOMED this will communicate the full assessment. It is expressed as a CD to allow for SNOMED post-coordination.

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
value : (ObservationValue)

Business name: Relatedness Assessment

Indicates whether the reaction is deemed to be related to the exposure.

This attribute will not be populated if using SNOMED. Otherwise it should have a fixed value of "RELATED".

Creates the link between the exposure and the reaction. Because the details of the assessment will be communicated in the 'code' attribute for SNOMED, this element is optional.

0-1Opt
subject : Subject61Mand
startsAfterStartOf : StartsAfterStartOf0-1Req
REPC_MT000005CA.Consumable

Business name: involved

Indicates the specific substance involved in the incidence that caused the reaction.

Identification of offending substance is needed for management of the reaction.

typeCode : "CSM" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
administrableMaterial : AdministrableMaterial1Mand
REPC_MT000005CA.ExposureEvent

Business name: Exposures

Incidence of the patient's exposure to (or contact with) with some material that might have caused the adverse reaction.

Examples of exposures include: Administering a substance (drug, food, etc) to the patient, Patient coming into contact with an environmental material, etc.

Communicates the cause of the adverse reaction.

classCode : "SBADM" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: B:Incidence Identifier

Identifier of the exposure event that caused the adverse reaction. This could be an identifier for a prescription, immunization, or other active medication record.

Allows for drilling down to retrieve further information about the exposure

0-1Req
routeCode : (RouteOfAdministration)

Business name: C:Exposure Method

The method by which the patient was exposed to the substance.

Helps evaluate the cause of the reaction.

0-1Req
consumable : Consumable1Mand

Indicates where the information that led to the recording of this information came from. The possible 3 sources of the information are: the patient, the patient's representative or a health-care provider.

The original source of the information can be important in evaluating its accuracy and importance.

typeCode : "INF" (ParticipationType)1Mand

REPC_MT000005CA.IntoleranceCondition

Business name: Allergy/Intolerance

A record of a patient's allergy or intolerance.

Necessary component of a person's overall medication and clinical profile. Helps with drug contraindication checking.

Value is mandatory if not using SNOMED

classCode : "COND" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: D:Allergy/Intolerance Record Id

Unique identifier for an allergy/intolerance record.

Allows for direct referencing of an allergy/intolerance record when querying or performing updates and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
code : CD (ObservationIntoleranceType)

Business name: A:Allergy/Intolerance Type

A coded value denoting whether the record pertains to an intolerance or a true allergy. (Allergies result from immunologic reactions. Intolerances do not.)

Allows for the separation of allergy and intolerance records. The type of condition is critical to understanding the record and is therefore mandatory. It is expressed as a CD to allow for SNOMED post-coordination.

1Mand
negationInd :

Business name: G:Allergy/Intolerance Refuted

An indication that the allergy/intolerance has been refuted. I.e. A clinician has positively determined that the patient does not suffer from a particular allergy or intolerance.

Allows providers to refute a previously confirmed or suspected allergy. The attribute is mandatory because it is critical to know whether the record represents the refutation or affirmation of an allergy or intolerance.

1Mand
statusCode : (ActStatus)

Business name: E:Allergy/Intolerance Status

A coded value that indicates whether an allergy/intolerance is 'ACTIVE' or 'COMPLETE' (indicating no longer active).

System must default the status to 'ACTIVE'.

Allows providers to evaluate the relevance of a recorded allergy/intolerance. The status has a default value of 'ACTIVE' and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
effectiveTime : TS.DATE

Business name: I:Allergy/Intolerance Date

The date on which the recorded allergy is considered active.

Allows providers to evaluate the period of relevance for the allergy/intolerance record.

0-1Req
confidentialityCode : (x_VeryBasicConfidentialityKind)

Business name: H:Allergy/Intolerance Masking Indicator

Denotes access restriction placed on the allergy or intolerance record. Methods for accessing masked allergy records will be governed by each jurisdiction (e.g. court orders, shared secret/consent, etc.). The default confidentiality level is 'NORMAL'.

Provides support for additional confidentiality constraint to reflect the wishes of the patient.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

0-1Opt
uncertaintyCode : (ActUncertainty)

Business name: F:Confirmed Indicator

An indication of the level of confidence/surety placed in the recorded information.

The two valid codes are:

- U (stated with uncertainty) -Specifies that the author of the act affirms the uncertainty of the act statement. In other words, they know that parts of the act statement are not certain or are inferred. An example of this is an inferred prescription where some order data is inferred from a supply event (i.e. dispense).

- N (stated with no assertion of uncertainty) - Specifies that the act statement is made without any explicit expression of certainty/uncertainty. This is the normal statement, meaning that it may not be free of errors and uncertainty may still exist. In healthcare, N is believed to express certainty to the strength possible.

An allergy or intolerance record is always used in drug contraindication checking whether the record is U or N.

Helps other providers to make appropriate decisions in their management of allergy or intolerance contraindications.

Attribute is mandatory because an allergy or intolerance record must be tagged as either 'confirmed' or 'suspected'.

1Mand
value : (IntoleranceValue)

Business name: B:Agent

Indicates the substance to which the patient is allergic

Critical for identifying the allergy or intolerance. Because it is not used for SNOMED, this element is optional.

0-1Opt
subject : Subject21Mand
responsibleParty : ResponsibleParty0-1Req
author : Author1Mand
informant : Informant0-1Req
location : Location1Mand
support : Support0-20Req
subjectOf1 : Subject40-99Req
subjectOf2 : Subject10-1Opt
subjectOf3 : Subject30-1Req
REPC_MT000005CA.Location

Business name: *i:recorded at

Indicates the service delivery location where the allergy was recorded.

Indicates where records are likely kept for follow-up. May also be useful in understanding the context in which the allergy/intolerance was recorded. The location of entry should always be known, and is therefore mandatory.

typeCode : "LOC" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AP" (ContextControl)1Mand
serviceDeliveryLocation : ServiceDeliveryLocation1Mand
REPC_MT000005CA.MaterialKind

Business name: Agent Category

Category of material or agent to which the patient was exposed.

Allows exposed materials or agents to be collectively referenced.

classCode : "MAT" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "KIND" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
code : (ExposureAgentEntityType)

Business name: A:Exposed Material Type

Indicates the type of agent that the patient was exposed to which caused the adverse reaction. This includes Drug, Food, Latex, Dust, etc.

Allows different kinds of reaction agents to be distinguished. Coding strength is set to CWE because the exposure agent type may not always be codified. The attribute is populated because there is little point in communicating about the exposure to an agent if it is not known what the agent is, however it may not always be coded.

1Pop
REPC_MT000005CA.ObservationEvent

Business name: Reported Reactions

This is a recording of a patient reaction that is believed to be associated with the allergy/intolerance.

Helps providers to distinguish between proper allergies and intolerances. Allows the provider recording the allergy to assign appropriate severity to the allergy. May give insight on how to mitigate an intolerance that is likely to be triggered by administering a substance. (E.g. If a given drug typically causes nausea in the patient, an additional medication may be co-prescribed to manage the nausea.)

Value must be mandatory if not using SNOMED

Code must be fixed to DX if not using SNOMED

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: C:Reaction Record Id

An identifier assigned to the record of the adverse reaction.

Allows for direct referencing of an adverse reaction record which was previously recorded.

0-1Req
code : CD (ActCode)

Business name: Diagnosis Type

Indicates the type of diagnosis being captured.

If using SNOMED, this will contain the diagnosis. Otherwise it will be a fixed value of 'DX'.

Indicates that the observation is actually a diagnosis and is therefore mandatory. The datatype is CD to support SNOMED post-coordination.

1Mand
negationInd :

Business name: D:No reaction occurred

Indicates if there there was an adverse reaction when the patient was exposed to the agent to which an allergy/intolerance has been recorded.

Allows providers to confirm or eliminate specific agents as being the cause for the allergy/intolerance. E.g. If a reaction is recorded for Tylenol 3, but no reaction is recorded for regular Tylenol or for coffee, this suggests that the likely cause of the allergy is Codeine.

The attribute is mandatory because it is essential to know whether the reaction occurred or not.

1Mand
text :

Business name: G:Description

A free form description of the reaction.

Allows for flexibility in the recording and reporting of the reaction.

B.4

0-1Req
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL.LOW<TS.DATE>

Business name: F:Reaction Onset Date

The date on which the reaction occurrence began.

Indicates when evidence of the condition first appeared. May also provide information on the duration of the reaction.

0-1Req
value : (SubjectReaction)

Business name: B:Reaction

Specifies the kind of reaction, as experienced by the patient.

Ensures consistency in tracking and categorizing the reaction type. Helps ensure that only proper allergies are categorized as allergy. The attribute is optional because it will not be used for SNOMED. The attribute is CWE because not all possible types of reactions are expressible by coded values.

B.1

0-1Opt
subjectOf : Subject0-1Opt

Allows for the trail of responsibility for the action.

contextControlCode : "AP" (ContextControl)1Mand

REPC_MT000005CA.SeverityObservation

Business name: Allergy/Intolerance Severity Level

This is a ranking/ an assertion of the seriouness of the diagnosed/reported medical condition.

Allows providers to determine appropriate managements for contraindications involving such medical conditions.

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : "SEV" (ActCode)

.

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
value : (SeverityObservation)

Business name: C:Severity Level

Indicates the gravity of the allergy, intolerance or reaction in terms of its actual or potential impact on the patient.

Allows for sorting of allergy records. May influence whether contraindications must be managed. Because this concept is pre-coordinated with code for SNOMED, the association is optional.

REPC_MT000005CA.StartsAfterStartOf

Indicates the agent that is believed to have caused the adverse reaction.

Provides support for the agent identified as the allergen/intolerance source.

REPC_MT000005CA.Subject

Business name: has severity level

An indication of the severity of the reaction.

Allows providers to evaluate the significance of the allergy or intolerance. Because severity is communicated as part of the reaction code in SNOMED, this association is optional

Severity Observation must not be present if using SNOMED

typeCode : "SUBJ" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand

REPC_MT000005CA.Subject1

Business name: has

Indicates the severity of the allergy/intolerance.

Useful for determining severity of an allergy/intolerance contraindication and the management of same. Because allergy severity is communicated as part of the code for SNOMED, this associaiton is optional.

Not sent if Condition code is SNOMED

typeCode : "SUBJ" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
severityObservation : SeverityObservation1Pop
REPC_MT000005CA.Subject2

Business name: *a:suffered by

Indicates the person suffering from the allergy/intolerance.

Ties the condition to a particular patient record, and is therefore mandatory.

AllergyIntolerance.person

typeCode : "SBJ" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AP" (ContextControl)1Mand
patient : Patient1Mand
REPC_MT000005CA.Subject3

Business name: *c:includes

Indicates the various comments that providers have recorded about this allergy/intolerance.

Improves communication between providers by allowing a mechanism to exchange un-coded free-form information.

This association is mandatory as it indicates one of presence or absence notes.

typeCode : "SUBJ" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
subsetCode : "SUM" (ActRelationshipSubset)1Mand
annotationIndicator : AnnotationIndicator1Pop
REPC_MT000005CA.Subject4

Business name: *c:includes

Indicates the various comments that providers have recorded about this allergy or intolerance record.

Improves communication between providers by allowing a mechanism to exchange un-coded free-form information.

typeCode : "SUBJ" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
annotation : Annotation1Pop
REPC_MT000005CA.Subject6
typeCode : "SUBJ" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
observationEvent : ObservationEvent1Mand
REPC_MT000005CA.Support

Business name: *b:supported by

Indicates a particular type of reaction experienced by the patient or testing performed on the patient which provides evidence for the existence (or non-existence) of the allergy/intolerance.

May help ascertain the severity of the condition, and provide direction for management. Also helps demonstrate the distinction between allergies and intolerances

typeCode : "SPRT" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
Choice: records : Records1Pop
 »»  causalityAssessment : CausalityAssessment0-1Opt
 »»  allergyTestEvent : AllergyTestEvent0-1Opt
 
 

REPC_MT000006CA

REPC_MT000006CA.AdministrableMaterial

Business name: Exposed Material

A specific material or agent that to which the patient was exposed. Examples are: Codein (Drug), Peanut (Food), etc.

Allows the provider to zero in on specific culprits for the adverse reaction.

classCode : "ADMM" (RoleClass)1Mand
administerableMaterialKind : MaterialKind1Mand
REPC_MT000006CA.AnnotationIndicator
classCode : "ACT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
REPC_MT000006CA.Author

Business name: *f:authored by

Identifies the provider who reported the reaction.

Identifies responsibility for accuracy and relevance of the information. This association reflects primary responsibility, and is therefore mandatory.

AllergyIntolerance.authorizingProvider

ZPB1.3

AllergyIntolerance.authorizingPhysician

typeCode : "AUT" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AP" (ContextControl)1Mand
time : TS.FULLDATETIME

Business name: Create Timestamp

The date and time on which the adverse reaction record was created.

Identifies timing of adverse reaction for sorting and for audit purposes. Attribute is populated because the source of the data may not be through the 'record common observation' interaction.

1Pop
assignedPerson : AssignedPerson1Mand
REPC_MT000006CA.CausalityAssessment

Business name: Reaction Assessments

This is a recording of the exposures and causality assessment deemed to be related to the reaction.

Indicates both the product and how related they are determined to be to the reaction.

Value is mandatory if not using SNOMED

Code is fixed to RXNASSESS if not using SNOMED

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : CD (ActCode)

Business name: Assessment Type

Indicates the type of assessment being made

For SNOMED this will include the actual assessment. For non-SNOMED, this should be fixed to RXNASSESS.

Communicates the relatedness assessment of the exposure to the reaction and is therefore mandatory. For SNOMED this will communicate the full assessment. It is expressed as a CD to allow for SNOMED post-coordination.

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
value : (ObservationValue)

Business name: Relatedness Assessment

Indicates whether the reaction is deemed to be related to the exposure.

This attribute will not be populated if using SNOMED. Otherwise it should have a fixed value of "RELATED".

Creates the link between the exposure and the reaction. Because the details of the assessment will be communicated in the 'code' attribute for SNOMED, this element is optional.

0-1Opt
startsAfterStartOf : StartsAfterStartOf1Mand
REPC_MT000006CA.Consumable

Business name: involved

Indicates the specific substance involved in the incidence that caused the reaction.

Identification of offending substance is needed for management of the reaction.

typeCode : "CSM" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
administrableMaterial : AdministrableMaterial1Mand
REPC_MT000006CA.ExposureEvent

Business name: Exposures

Incidence of the patient's exposure to (or contact with) with some material that might have caused the adverse reaction.

Examples of exposures include: Administering a substance (drug, food, etc) to the patient, Patient coming into contact with an environmental material, etc.

Communicates the cause of the adverse reaction.

classCode : "SBADM" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: B:Incidence Identifier

Identifier of the exposure event that caused the adverse reaction. This could be an identifier for a prescription, immunization, or other active medication record.

Allows for drilling down to retrieve further information about the exposure

0-1Req
routeCode : (RouteOfAdministration)

Business name: C:Exposure Method

The method by which the patient was exposed to the substance.

Helps evaluate the cause of the reaction.

0-1Req
consumable : Consumable1Mand
REPC_MT000006CA.Informant

Business name: d:reported by

Indicates where the information that led to the recording of this information came from. The possible 3 sources of the information are: the patient, the patient's representative or a health-care provider.

The original source of the information can be important in evaluating its accuracy and importance.

typeCode : "INF" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AP" (ContextControl)1Mand
time : TS.FULLDATE

Business name: Reported Timestamp

The date on which the adverse reaction was reported.

Allows for establishment of timelines between onset date, reported date and recorded date, and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
Choice: party : Party1Pop
 »»  patient : Patient0-1Opt
 »»  responsibleParty : ResponsibleParty0-1Opt
 »»  assignedPerson : AssignedPerson0-1Opt
REPC_MT000006CA.Location

Business name: *i:recorded at

Indicates the service delivery location where the adverse reaction was recorded.

Indicates where records are likely kept for follow-up. May also be useful in understanding the context in which the adverse reaction was recorded. The location of entry should always be known, and is therefore mandatory.

typeCode : "LOC" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AP" (ContextControl)1Mand
serviceDeliveryLocation : ServiceDeliveryLocation1Mand
REPC_MT000006CA.MaterialKind

Business name: Agent Category

Category of material or agent to which the patient was exposed.

Allows exposed materials or agents to be collectively referenced.

classCode : "MAT" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "KIND" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
code : (ExposureAgentEntityType)

Business name: A:Exposed Material Type

Indicates the type of agent that the patient was exposed to which caused the adverse reaction. This includes Drug, Food, Latex, Dust, etc.

Allows different kinds of reaction agents to be distinguished. Coding strength is set to CWE because the exposure agent type may not always be codified. The attribute is populated because there is little point in communicating about the exposure to an agent if it is not known what the agent is, however it may not always be coded.

1Pop
name :

Business name: Exposed Material Name

Indicates the name of the agent identified by MaterialKind.code

Provides a human-readable name in circumstances where the agent is captured as code.

0-1Req
REPC_MT000006CA.Party
Implementations of REPC_MT000006CA.Party :
 »»  Patient
 »»  ResponsibleParty
 »»  AssignedPerson
REPC_MT000006CA.ReactionObservationEvent

Business name: Reported Reaction

This is a record of an adverse reaction considered relevant to the patient's clinical record.

Useful in tracking reactions when it is not known precisely what product they are associated with and whether the reaction is due to an allergy or intolerance, a drug interaction or some other cause. Effectively gives a 'heads up' to clinicians using the drug or combination of drugs.

Value is mandatory if not using SNOMED

Code is fixed to DX if not using SNOMED

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: C:Reaction Record Id

An identifier assigned to the record of the adverse reaction.

Uniquely identifies the specific reaction record and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
code : CD (ActCode)

Business name: Diagnosis Type

Indicates the type of diagnosis being captured.

If using SNOMED, this will contain the diagnosis. Otherwise it will be a fixed value of 'DX'.

Indicates that the observation is actually a diagnosis and is therefore mandatory. The datatype is CD to support SNOMED post-coordination.

1Mand
text :

Business name: G:Description

A free form description of the reaction.

Allows for flexibility in the recording and reporting of the reaction.

B.4

0-1Req
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL.LOW<TS.DATE>

Business name: F:Reaction Onset Date

The date on which the reaction occurrence began.

Indicates when evidence of the condition first appeared. May also provide information on the duration of the reaction.

0-1Req
confidentialityCode : (x_VeryBasicConfidentialityKind)

Business name: G:Adverse Reaction Masking Indicator

Communicates the intent of the patient to restrict access to their adverse reactions. Provides support for additional confidentiality constraint, giving patients a level of control over their information. Valid values are: 'NORMAL' (denotes 'Not Masked'); and 'RESTRICTED' (denotes 'Masked'). The default is 'NORMAL' signifying 'Not Masked'.

Allows the patient to have discrete control over access to their adverse reaction data.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

0-1Opt
value : (SubjectReaction)

Business name: B:Reaction

Specifies the kind of reaction, as experienced by the patient.

Ensures consistency in tracking and categorizing the reaction type. Helps ensure that only proper allergies are categorized as allergy. The attribute is optional because it will not be used for SNOMED. The attribute is CWE because not all possible types of reactions are expressible by coded values.

B.1

0-1Opt
subject : Subject21Mand
responsibleParty : ResponsibleParty0-1Req
author : Author1Mand
informant : Informant0-1Req
location : Location1Mand
subjectOf1 : Subject30-99Req
subjectOf2 : Subject40-1Req
subjectOf3 : Subject60-10Req
subjectOf4 : Subject10-1Opt
REPC_MT000006CA.ResponsibleParty

Business name: supervised by

Identity of the provider who is taking responsibility for the actions of the author.

Allows for the trail of responsibility for the action.

typeCode : "RESP" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AP" (ContextControl)1Mand
assignedPerson : AssignedPerson1Pop
REPC_MT000006CA.SeverityObservation

Business name: Allergy/Intolerance Severity Level

This is a ranking/ an assertion of the seriouness of the diagnosed/reported medical condition.

Allows providers to determine appropriate managements for contraindications involving such medical conditions.

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : "SEV" (ActCode)

.

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
value : (SeverityObservation)

Business name: C:Severity Level

Indicates the gravity of the allergy, intolerance or reaction in terms of its actual or potential impact on the patient.

Allows for sorting of reactions. May influence whether contraindications must be managed. Because SNOMED pre-coordinates this concept with code, the association is optional.

AllergyIntolerance.severity

1Mand

contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
exposureEvent : ExposureEvent1Mand
REPC_MT000006CA.Subject1

Business name: has

Indicates the severity of the allergy/intolerance.

Useful for determining severity of an allergy/intolerance contraindication and the management of same. Because severity is communicated as part of the reaction code in SNOMED, this association is optional

SeverityObservation must not be present if ReactionObservationEvent.code is using SNOMED

typeCode : "SUBJ" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
severityObservation : SeverityObservation1Pop

Business name: *a:suffered by

Indicates the person who suffered the adverse reaction.

Ties the condition to a particular patient record, and is therefore mandatory.

AllergyIntolerance.person

contextControlCode : "AP" (ContextControl)1Mand

Improves communication between providers by allowing a mechanism to exchange un-coded free-form information.

contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand

REPC_MT000006CA.Subject4

Business name: Notes Indicator

If true, indicates that there are notes associated with the allergy or intolerance.

Shows whether additional information is available on further drill-down. The association behaves as a mandatory attribute where the presence of the association indicates 'true' while the absence indicates 'false'.

typeCode : "SUBJ" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
subsetCode : "SUM" (ActRelationshipSubset)1Mand
annotationIndicator : AnnotationIndicator1Pop
REPC_MT000006CA.Subject6

Business name: caused by exposure to

Indicates the agent(s) that are suspected to have been involved in the adverse reaction.

Allows linking the reaction to one or more drugs so that they can be flagged in the future when prescribed or dispensed.

typeCode : "SUBJ" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
causalityAssessment : CausalityAssessment1Pop

Business name: *b:authored by

Identifies the provider who caused the condition to be recorded.

Identifies responsibility for accuracy and relevance of the information. This association reflects primary responsibility, and is therefore mandatory.

REPC_MT000007CA.ChronicIndicator

Business name: Chronic Indicator

If present, indicates that the recorded medical condition is deemed to be chronic.

Allows the recording provider the ability to designate certain conditions as chronic. This is especially useful in jurisdictions where the code scheme used for medical condition does not convey such information

This association behaves like a mandatory attribute where the presence of the association represents 'true' and the absence of the association represents 'false'

classCode : "LIST" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : "CHRON" (ActCode)1Mand

Business name: reported by

Indicates where the information that led to the recording of this medical condition came from. The possible 3 sources of the information are: the patient, the patient's representative or a health-care provider.

The original source of the information can be important in evaluating its accuracy and importance.

The date on which the medical condition was reported.

REPC_MT000007CA.Location

Business name: *recorded at

Indicates the service delivery location where the medical condition was recorded.

Indicates where records are likely kept for follow-up. May also be useful in understanding the context in which the medical condition was recorded. The location of entry should always be known, and is therefore mandatory.

typeCode : "LOC" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "OP" (ContextControl)1Mand
serviceDeliveryLocation : ServiceDeliveryLocation1Mand
REPC_MT000007CA.MedicalCondition

Business name: Medical Condition

A record of a patient's medical condition. Includes diseases, disabilities, pregnancy, lactation and other clinical conditions of interest.

Necessary component of a person's overall medication and clinical profile. Helps with contraindication checking.

Value is mandatory if not using SNOMED

Code is fixed to DX if not using SNOMED

classCode : "COND" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: A:Medical Condition Record Id

Unique identifier for medical condition record.

Allows for direct referencing of a medical condition record when querying or updating and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
code : CD (ActCode)

Business name: Condition Type

Indicates what kind of condition is being reported.

If SNOMED is used, the diagnosis will appear here. Otherwise, a fixed value of "DX" should be sent.

Identifies this observation as reporting a medical condition and is therefore mandatory. When using SNOMED, the actual condition may be post-coordinated into this attribute, thus CD is used.

1Mand
statusCode : (ActStatus)

Business name: D:Condition Status

A coded value that indicates whether the condition is still impacting the patient. 'ACTIVE' means the condition is still affecting the patient. 'COMPLETE' means the condition no longer holds

Essential to evaluating the relevance of the condition record. In some cases, it may not be known whether the condition still exists or not. Therefore the status is treated as 'populated'.

1Pop
effectiveTime : IVL<TS.DATE>

Business name: E:Condition Time Period

The date on which the condition first began and when it ended.

For ongoing conditions such as chronic diseases, the upper boundary may be unknown.

For transient conditions such as pregnancy, lactation, etc; the upper boundary of the period would usually be specified to signify the end of the condition.

Allows providers to evaluate the period of relevance for the medical condition.

0-1Req
confidentialityCode : (x_VeryBasicConfidentialityKind)

Business name: F:Condition Masking Indicator

Denotes access restriction placed on the medical condition record. Methods for accessing masked medical condition records will be governed by each jurisdiction (e.g. court orders, shared secret/consent, etc.).

The default confidentiality level is 'NORMAL'.

Provides support for additional confidentiality constraint to reflect the wishes of the patient.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

0-1Opt
value : (DiagnosisValue)

Business name: C:Condition

A code indicating the specific condition. E.g. Hypertension, Pregnancy.

This is the central piece of information in recording a condition. However because when using SNOMED the actual diagnosis will be sent in the 'code' attribute, this element is optional.

0-1Opt
subject : Subject21Mand
responsibleParty : ResponsibleParty0-1Req
author : Author1Mand
informant : Informant0-1Req
location : Location1Mand
subjectOf1 : Subject0-1Req
subjectOf2 : Subject50-99Req
subjectOf3 : Subject60-1Req

Allows for the trail of responsibility for the action.

typeCode : "RESP" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AP" (ContextControl)1Mand
assignedPerson : AssignedPerson1Pop

REPC_MT000008CA

REPC_MT000008CA.ConditionID
value : II

Business name: F:Condition Identifier

Identifier of the Condition record to be retrieved. This can pertain to an allergy/intolerance or medical condition record.

Identifies the specific condition record to retrieve and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
REPC_MT000008CA.ParameterList

Business name: Condition History Query Parameters

Defines the set of parameters that may be used to filter the query response

Root class for query definition

conditionID : ConditionID1Mand
patientBirthDate : PatientBirthDate1Mand
patientGender : PatientGender1Mand
patientID : PatientID1Mand
patientName : PatientName1Mand
REPC_MT000008CA.PatientBirthDate
value : TS.DATE

Business name: E:Patient Birth Date

Indicates the date on which the patient was born.

Used to confirm the identity of the patient for the query and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
REPC_MT000008CA.PatientGender
value : (AdministrativeGender)

Business name: D:Patient Gender

Indicates the gender (sex) of the patient.

Used to confirm the identity of the patient for the query and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
REPC_MT000008CA.PatientID
value : II

Business name: B:Patient ID

Identifier of the patient who is the subject of the condition history query. Filter the result set to include only those records pertaining to the patient with this Id.

Allows filtering of result set by patient Id. This is a mandatory field because a patient must be specified for the query to be valid

1Mand
REPC_MT000008CA.PatientName
value : PN.BASIC

Business name: C:Patient Name

The name of the patient who is the subject of the condition history query.

Filter the result set to include only those records pertaining to the patient with this name.

Allows filtering of result set by patient name. This is a mandatory field because a patient name must match the patient Id for the query to be valid.

1Mand
 
 

REPC_MT000009CA

REPC_MT000009CA.AdministerableMaterial

Business name: Exposed Material

A specific material or agent that to which the patient was exposed. Examples are: Codein (Drug), Peanut (Food), etc.

Allows the provider to zero in on specific culprits for the adverse reaction.

classCode : "ADMM" (RoleClass)1Mand
administerableMaterialKind : MaterialKind1Mand
REPC_MT000009CA.AllergyTestEvent

Business name: Allergy Tests

Indicates the specific allergy test that supports the recording of the allergy/intolerance.

Provides evidence for recording the allergy/intolerance.

Value must not be present when using SNOMED, mandatory otherwise

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: B:Allergy Test Record Id

An identifier for a specific instance of an allergy/intolerance test.

Allows an allergy/intolerance test record to be directly referenced.

0-1Req
code : CD (ObservationAllergyTestType)

Business name: A:Allergy Test Type

A coded value denoting the type of allergy test conducted.

Allows different kinds of allergy/intolerance tests to be distinguishable and is therefore mandatory. It uses the CD type to support SNOMED post-coordination.

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
effectiveTime : TS.DATE

Business name: D:Allergy Test Date

The date on which the allergy test was performed.

Allows providers to evaluate the currency of the test.

0-1Req
value : (AllergyTestValue)

Business name: C:Allergy Test Result

A code indicating result of the allergy test.

Allows other providers to evaluate the test. There is no point in associating an allergy test with unknown results with an allergy or intolerance however the element is optional because this information may be post-coordinated in the 'code' attribute using SNOMED.

0-1Opt
REPC_MT000009CA.Author

Business name: *f:authored by

Identifies the provider who reported the allergy or intolerance.

Identifies responsibility for accuracy and relevance of the information. This association reflects primary responsibility, and is therefore mandatory.

AllergyIntolerance.authorizingProvider

ZPB1.3

AllergyIntolerance.authorizingPhysician

typeCode : "AUT" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AP" (ContextControl)1Mand
time : TS.FULLDATETIME

Business name: Create Timestamp

The date and time on which the allergy/intolerance record was created.

Identifies timing of allergy/intolerance for sorting and for audit purposes. Attribute is populated because the source of the data may not be through the 'record common observation' interaction.

1Pop
assignedPerson : AssignedPerson1Mand
REPC_MT000009CA.Author3

Business name: *changed by

Identity of the health service provider responsible for the change in the allergy/intolerance status.

In an EHR integrated health services environment, it is important that other providers are able to query who is responsible for a given change. Also used by applications for auditing and sorting. The attribute is mandatory because the responsible provider should always be known.

typeCode : "AUT" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AP" (ContextControl)1Mand
time : TS.FULLDATETIME

Business name: Change Time

The date on which the change was made.

Gives other providers the frame of reference in evaluating any post-change issues with the allergy. Also used for sorting and audit purposes. Time of change is always known and thus the attribute is mandatory.

1Mand
assignedPerson : AssignedPerson1Mand
REPC_MT000009CA.CausalityAssessment

Business name: Reported Reactions

This is a recording of a patient reaction that is believed to be associated with the allergy/intolerance.

Helps providers to distinguish between proper allergies and intolerances. Allows the provider recording the allergy to assign appropriate severity to the allergy. May give insight on how to mitigate an intolerance that is likely to be triggered by administering a substance. (E.g. If a given drug typically causes nausea in the patient, an additional medication may be co-prescribed to manage the nausea.)

Value is required if not using SNOME code must be ‘RXNASSESS if not SNOMED

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : CD (ActCode)

Business name: Assessment Type

Indicates the type of assessment being made

For SNOMED this will include the actual assessment. For non-SNOMED, this should be fixed to RXNASSESS.

Communicates the relatedness assessment of the exposure to the reaction and is therefore mandatory. For SNOMED this will communicate the full assessment. It is expressed as a CD to allow for SNOMED post-coordination.

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
value : (ObservationValue)

Business name: Relatedness Assessment

Indicates whether the reaction is deemed to be related to the exposure.

This attribute will not be populated if using SNOMED. Otherwise it should have a fixed value of "RELATED".

Creates the link between the exposure and the reaction. Because the details of the assessment will be communicated in the 'code' attribute for SNOMED, this element is optional.

0-1Opt
subject : Subject61Mand
startsAfterStartOf : StartsAfterStartOf0-1Req
REPC_MT000009CA.Consumable

Business name: involved

Indicates the specific substance involved in the incidence that caused the reaction.

Identification of offending substance is needed for management of the reaction.

typeCode : "CSM" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
administerableMaterial : AdministerableMaterial1Mand
REPC_MT000009CA.ControlActEvent

Business name: Allergy/Intolerance Status Changes

This records the history of changes that have been made to the allergy/intolerance, including why the changes were made, who made them and when.

Provides a record of a patient's allergy changes, providing deeper clinical understanding, particularly of past clinical decisions.

classCode : "CACT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : (HL7TriggerEventCode)

Business name: A:Allergy/Intolerance Status Change Type

Identifies what kind of change occurred. Allergy/Intolerance change types are Revise, Reactivate and Complete.

This attribute is mandatory to ensure that change types are distinguishable.

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: B:Allergy/intolerance Status Change Effective Date

The date on which the various changes of an allergy/intolerance become valid and applicable.

Allows applications to sort and filter by time. The date on which a change is effective should always be known and thus is mandatory.

1Mand
reasonCode : (ControlActReason)

Business name: C:Allergy/Intolerance Status Change Reason

Denotes the reason the the allergy/intolerance was changed.

Ensures consistent terminology in capturing and interpreting reasons for change. Allows CWE because not all reasons will correspond to a pre-defined code.

0-1Req
responsibleParty : ResponsibleParty20-1Req
author : Author31Mand
REPC_MT000009CA.ExposureEvent

Business name: Exposures

Incidence of the patient's exposure to (or contact with) with some material that might have caused the adverse reaction.

Examples of exposures include: Administering a substance (drug, food, etc) to the patient, Patient coming into contact with an environmental material, etc.

Communicates the cause of the adverse reaction.

classCode : "SBADM" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: B:Incidence Identifier

Identifier of the exposure event that caused the adverse reaction. This could be an identifier for a prescription, immunization, or other active medication record.

Allows for drilling down to retrieve further information about the exposure

0-1Req
routeCode : (RouteOfAdministration)

Business name: C:Exposure Method

The method by which the patient was exposed to the substance.

Helps evaluate the cause of the reaction.

0-1Req
consumable : Consumable1Mand
REPC_MT000009CA.Informant

Business name: d:reported by

Indicates where the information that led to the recording of this information came from. The possible 3 sources of the information are: the patient, the patient's representative or a health-care provider.

The original source of the information can be important in evaluating its accuracy and importance.

typeCode : "INF" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AP" (ContextControl)1Mand
time : TS.FULLDATE

Business name: Reported Date

The date on which the allergy/intolerance was reported.

Allows for establishment of timelines between onset date, reported date and recorded date, and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
Choice: party : Party1Pop
 »»  patient : Patient0-1Opt
 »»  responsibleParty : ResponsibleParty0-1Opt
 »»  assignedPerson : AssignedPerson0-1Opt
REPC_MT000009CA.IntoleranceCondition

Business name: Allergy/Intolerance

A record of a patient's allergy or intolerance.

Necessary component of a person's overall medication and clinical profile. Helps with drug contraindication checking.

Value is not permitted when using SNOMED, mandatory otherwise

classCode : "COND" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: D:Allergy/Intolerance Record Id

Unique identifier for an allergy/intolerance record.

Allows for direct referencing of an allergy/intolerance record when querying or performing updates and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
code : CD (ObservationIntoleranceType)

Business name: A:Allergy/Intolerance Type

A coded value denoting whether the record pertains to an intolerance or a true allergy. (Allergies result from immunologic reactions. Intolerances do not.)

Allows for the separation of allergy and intolerance records. The type of condition is critical to understanding the record and is therefore mandatory. It is expressed as a CD to allow for SNOMED post-coordination.

1Mand
negationInd :

Business name: G:Allergy/Intolerance Refuted

An indication that the allergy/intolerance has been refuted. I.e. A clinician has positively determined that the patient does not suffer from a particular allergy or intolerance.

Allows providers to refute a previously confirmed or suspected allergy. Because it is essential to know whether the record refutes or affirms an allergy, this attribute is mandatory.

1Mand
statusCode : (ActStatus)

Business name: E:Allergy/Intolerance Status

"Identifies what kind of change occurred. Allergy/Intolerance change types are Revise, Reactivate and Complete

System must default the status to 'ACTIVE'.

Allows providers to evaluate the relevance of a recorded allergy/intolerance. The status has a default value of 'active' and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
effectiveTime : TS.DATE

Business name: I:Allergy/Intolerance Date

The date on which the recorded allergy is considered active.

Allows providers to evaluate the period of relevance for the allergy/intolerance record.

0-1Req
confidentialityCode : (x_VeryBasicConfidentialityKind)

Business name: H:Allergy/Intolerance Masking Indicator

Denotes access restriction placed on the allergy or intolerance record. Methods for accessing masked allergy records will be governed by each jurisdiction (e.g. court orders, shared secret/consent, etc.). The default confidentiality level is 'NORMAL'.

Provides support for additional confidentiality constraint to reflect the wishes of the patient.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

0-1Opt
uncertaintyCode : (ActUncertainty)

Business name: F:Confirmed Indicator

An indication of the level of confidence/surety placed in the recorded information.

The two valid codes are:

- U (stated with uncertainty) -Specifies that the author of the act affirms the uncertainty of the act statement. In other words, they know that parts of the act statement are not certain or are inferred. An example of this is an inferred prescription where some order data is inferred from a supply event (i.e. dispense).

- N (stated with no assertion of uncertainty) - Specifies that the act statement is made without any explicit expression of certainty/uncertainty. This is the normal statement, meaning that it may not be free of errors and uncertainty may still exist. In healthcare, N is believed to express certainty to the strength possible.

An allergy or intolerance record is always used in drug contraindication checking whether the record is U or N.

Helps other providers to make appropriate decisions in their management of allergy or intolerance contraindications.

Attribute is mandatory because an allergy or intolerance record must be tagged as either 'confirmed' or 'suspected'.

1Mand
value : (IntoleranceValue)

Business name: B:Agent

Indicates the substance to which the patient is allergic

Critical for identifying the allergy or intolerance. However, because the attribute is not used for SNOMED, it is optional.

0-1Opt
subject : Subject21Mand
responsibleParty : ResponsibleParty0-1Req
author : Author1Mand
informant : Informant0-1Req
location : Location1Mand
replacementOf : ReplacementOf0-1Req
support : Support0-20Req
subjectOf1 : Subject40-20Req
subjectOf2 : Subject30-99Req
subjectOf3 : Subject10-1Opt
REPC_MT000009CA.Location

Business name: *i:recorded at

Indicates the service delivery location where the allergy was recorded.

Indicates where records are likely kept for follow-up. May also be useful in understanding the context in which the allergy/intolerance was recorded. The location of entry should always be known, and is therefore mandatory.

typeCode : "LOC" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AP" (ContextControl)1Mand
serviceDeliveryLocation : ServiceDeliveryLocation1Mand
REPC_MT000009CA.MaterialKind

Business name: Agent Category

Category of material or agent to which the patient was exposed.

Allows exposed materials or agents to be collectively referenced.

classCode : "MAT" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "KIND" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
code : (ExposureAgentEntityType)

Business name: A:Exposed Material Type

Indicates the type of agent that the patient was exposed to which caused the adverse reaction. This includes Drug, Food, Latex, Dust, etc.

Allows different kinds of reaction agents to be distinguished. Coding strength is set to CWE because the exposure agent type may not always be codified. The attribute is populated because there is little point in communicating about the exposure to an agent if it is not known what the agent is, however it may not always be coded.

1Pop
REPC_MT000009CA.ObservationEvent

Value must not be present when using SNOMED, mandatory otherwise

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: C:Reaction Record Id

An identifier assigned to the record of the adverse reaction.

Allows for direct referencing of an adverse reaction record which was previously recorded.

0-1Req
code : CD (ActCode)

Business name: Diagnosis Type

Indicates the type of diagnosis being captured.

If using SNOMED, this will contain the diagnosis. Otherwise it will be a fixed value of 'DX'.

Indicates that the observation is actually a diagnosis and is therefore mandatory. The datatype is CD to support SNOMED post-coordination.

1Mand
negationInd :

Business name: D:No reaction occurred

Indicates that there was no adverse reaction when the patient was exposed to the agent to which an allergy/intolerance has been recorded.

Allows providers to confirm or eliminate specific agents as being the cause for the allergy/intolerance. E.g. If a reaction is recorded for Tylenol 3, but no reaction is recorded for regular Tylenol or for coffee, this suggests that the likely cause of the allergy is Codeine.

Because it is essential to know whether the record reflects a reaction that did or did not occur, this attribute is mandatory.

1Mand
text :

Business name: G:Description

A free form description of the reaction.

Allows for flexibility in the recording and reporting of the reaction.

B.4

0-1Req
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL.LOW<TS.DATE>

Business name: F:Reaction Onset Date

The date on which the reaction occurrence began.

Indicates when evidence of the condition first appeared. May also provide information on the duration of the reaction.

0-1Req
value : (SubjectReaction)

Business name: B:Reaction

Specifies the kind of reaction, as experienced by the patient.

Ensures consistency in tracking and categorizing the reaction type. Helps ensure that only proper allergies are categorized as allergy. The attribute is optional because it will not be used for SNOMED. The attribute is CWE because not all possible types of reactions are expressible by coded values.

B.1

0-1Opt
subjectOf : Subject0-1Opt

REPC_MT000009CA.ReplacementOf

Business name: e:replaces version

A complete representation of a previous version of the same allergy/intolerance record.

Allows exposing how an allergy/intolerance record has changed over time. Multiple previous versions may be accessed by chaining versions (C replaces version B replaces version A, etc.). Used when the content underwent more than just a status change.

typeCode : "RPLC" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
intoleranceCondition : IntoleranceCondition1Pop

This is a ranking/ an assertion of the seriouness of the diagnosed/reported medical condition.

Allows providers to determine appropriate managements for contraindications involving such medical conditions.

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : "SEV" (ActCode)

.

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
value : (SeverityObservation)

Business name: C:Severity Level

Indicates the gravity of the allergy, intolerance or reaction in terms of its actual or potential impact on the patient.

Allows for sorting of allergy records. May influence whether contraindications must be managed.

Because SNOMED handles this concept by pre-coordinating it into code, this association is optional.

REPC_MT000010CA

REPC_MT000010CA.Author

Business name: *d:authored by

Identifies the provider who caused the condition to be recorded.

Identifies responsibility for accuracy and relevance of the information. This association reflects primary responsibility, and is therefore mandatory.

AllergyIntolerance.authorizingProvider

AllergyIntolerance.authorizingPhysician

Business name: Create Timestamp

The date and time on which the medical condition record was created.

Identifies timing of the medical condition for sorting and for audit purposes. Attribute is populated because the source of the data may not be through the 'record common observation' interaction.

1Pop
assignedPerson : AssignedPerson1Mand
REPC_MT000010CA.Author3

Business name: *changed by

Identity of the health service provider responsible for the change in the medical condition.

In an EHR integrated health services environment, it is important that other providers are able to query who is responsible for status changes. Also used by applications for auditing. The provider responsible for a change should always be known and is therefore mandatory.

typeCode : "AUT" (ParticipationType)1Mand
time : TS.FULLDATETIME

Business name: Change Time

The date and time on which the change was made.

Gives other providers the frame of reference in evaluating any post-change issues with the medical condition. Also used for sorting and audit purposes. Time of change is always known and thus the attribute is mandatory.

1Mand
assignedPerson : AssignedPerson1Mand

REPC_MT000010CA.ControlActEvent

Business name: Medical Condition Status Changes

This indicates the history of changes that have been made to the medical condition record, including why the changes were made, who made them and when.

Provides an audit trail of a patient's medical condition changes.

classCode : "CACT" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : (HL7TriggerEventCode)

Business name: C:Medical Condition Status Change Type

Identifies what kind of change occurred.

This attribute is mandatory to ensure that change types are distinguishable.

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: A:Medical Condition Status Change Effective Date

The date on which the changes to the medical condition become valid and applicable.

Allows applications to sort and filter by time.

The effective date can be defaulted to change date, and thus is mandatory.

1Mand
reasonCode : (ControlActReason)

Business name: B:Medical Condition Status Change Reason

Denotes the reason the medical condition record was changed.

Ensures consistent terminology in capturing and interpreting reasons for change. Allows CWE because not all reasons will correspond to a pre-defined code.

REPC_MT000010CA.MedicalCondition

Business name: Medical Condition

A record of a patient's medical condition. Includes diseases, disabilities, pregnancy, lactation and other clinical conditions of interest.

Necessary component of a person's overall medication and clinical profile. Helps with contraindication checking.

Value is mandatory if not using SNOMED

Code is fixed to DX if not using SNOMED

classCode : "COND" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: A:Medical Condition Record Id

Unique identifier for medical condition record.

Allows for direct referencing of a medical condition record when querying or updating and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
code : CD (ActCode)

Business name: Condition Type

Indicates what kind of condition is being reported.

If SNOMED is used, the diagnosis will appear here. Otherwise, a fixed value of "DX" should be sent.

Identifies this observation as reporting a medical condition and is therefore mandatory. When using SNOMED, the actual condition may be post-coordinated into this attribute, thus CD is used.

1Mand
statusCode : (ActStatus)

Business name: D:Condition Status

A coded value that indicates whether the condition is still impacting the patient. 'ACTIVE' means the condition is still affecting the patient. 'COMPLETE' means the condition no longer holds

Essential to evaluating the relevance of the condition record. In some cases, it may not be known whether the condition still exists or not. Therefore the status is treated as 'populated'.

1Pop
effectiveTime : IVL<TS.DATE>

Business name: E:Condition Time Period

The date on which the condition first began and when it ended.

For ongoing conditions such as chronic diseases, the upper boundary may be unknown.

For transient conditions such as pregnancy, lactation, etc; the upper boundary of the period would usually be specified to signify the end of the condition.

Allows providers to evaluate the period of relevance for the medical condition.

0-1Req
confidentialityCode : (x_VeryBasicConfidentialityKind)

Business name: F:Condition Masking Indicator

Denotes access restriction placed on the medical condition record. Methods for accessing masked medical condition records will be governed by each jurisdiction (e.g. court orders, shared secret/consent, etc.).

The default confidentiality level is 'NORMAL'.

Provides support for additional confidentiality constraint to reflect the wishes of the patient.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

0-1Opt
value : (DiagnosisValue)

Business name: C:Condition

A code indicating the specific condition. E.g. Hypertension, Pregnancy.

This is the central piece of information in recording a condition. However because when using SNOMED the actual diagnosis will be sent in the 'code' attribute, this element is optional.

0-1Opt
subject : Subject21Mand
responsibleParty : ResponsibleParty0-1Req
author : Author1Mand
informant : Informant0-1Req
location : Location1Mand
replacementOf : ReplacementOf0-1Req
subjectOf1 : Subject0-20Req
subjectOf2 : Subject30-99Req
subjectOf3 : Subject50-1Req

REPC_MT000010CA.Subject5

Business name: Chronic Indicator

If true, indicates that the recorded medical condition is deemed to be chronic.

Allows the recording provider the ability to designate certain conditions as chronic. This is especially useful in jurisdictions where the code scheme used for medical condition does not convey such information

This association behaves like a mandatory boolean attribute where the presence of the association indicates 'true' and the absence of the association indicates false.

typeCode : "SUBJ" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
chronicIndicator : ChronicIndicator1Pop
 
 

REPC_MT000012CA

REPC_MT000012CA.AdministerableMaterial

Business name: Exposed Material

A specific material or agent that to which the patient was exposed. Examples are: Codein (Drug), Peanut (Food), etc.

Allows the provider to zero in on specific culprits for the adverse reaction.

classCode : "ADMM" (RoleClass)1Mand
administerableMaterialKind : MaterialKind1Mand
REPC_MT000012CA.CausalityAssessment

Business name: Reaction Assessments

This is a recording of the exposures and causality assessment deemed to be related to the reaction.

Indicates both the product and how related they are determined to be to the reaction.

If code is SNOMED, value is not permitted. Otherise code must be “RXNASSESS” and value must be “RELATED”

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : CD (ActCode)

Business name: Assessment Type

Indicates the type of assessment being made

For SNOMED this will include the actual assessment. For non-SNOMED, this should be fixed to RXNASSES.

Communicates the relatedness assessment of the exposure to the reaction and is therefore mandatory. For SNOMED this will communicate the full assessment. It is expressed as a CD to allow for SNOMED post-coordination.

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
value : (ObservationValue)

Business name: Relatedness Assessment

Indicates whether the reaction is deemed to be related to the exposure.

This attribute will not be populated if using SNOMED. Otherwise it should have a fixed value of "RELATED".

Creates the link between the exposure and the reaction. Because the details of the assessment will be communicated in the 'code' attribute for SNOMED, this element is optional.

0-1Opt
startsAfterStartOf : StartsAfterStartOf1Mand
REPC_MT000012CA.Choice
Implementations of REPC_MT000012CA.Choice :
 »»  Patient
 »»  ResponsibleParty
 »»  AssignedPerson
REPC_MT000012CA.Consumable

Business name: involved

Indicates the specific substance involved in the incidence that caused the reaction.

Identification of offending substance is needed for management of the reaction.

typeCode : "CSM" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
administerableMaterial : AdministerableMaterial1Mand
REPC_MT000012CA.ExposureEvent

Business name: Exposures

Incidence of the patient's exposure to (or contact with) with some material that might have caused the adverse reaction.

Examples of exposures include: Administering a substance (drug, food, etc) to the patient, Patient coming into contact with an environmental material, etc.

Communicates the cause of the adverse reaction.

classCode : "SBADM" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: B:Incidence Identifier

Identifier of the exposure event that caused the adverse reaction. This could be an identifier for a prescription, immunization, or other active medication record.

Allows for drilling down to retrieve further information about the exposure

0-1Req
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
routeCode : (RouteOfAdministration)

Business name: C:Exposure Method

The method by which the patient was exposed to the substance.

Helps evaluate the cause of the reaction.

0-1Req
consumable : Consumable1Mand
REPC_MT000012CA.Informant

Business name: d:reported by

Indicates where the information that led to the recording of this information came from. The possible 3 sources of the information are: the patient, the patient's representative or a health-care provider.

The original source of the information can be important in evaluating its accuracy and importance.

typeCode : "INF" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AP" (ContextControl)1Mand
time : TS.FULLDATE

Business name: Reported date

The date on which the adverse reaction was reported.

Allows for establishment of timelines between reaction onset date, reported date and recorded date, and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
Choice: choice : Choice1Pop
 »»  patient : Patient0-1Opt
 »»  responsibleParty : ResponsibleParty0-1Opt
 »»  assignedPerson : AssignedPerson0-1Opt
REPC_MT000012CA.MaterialKind

Business name: Agent Category

Category of material or agent to which the patient was exposed.

Allows exposed materials or agents to be collectively referenced.

classCode : "MAT" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "KIND" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
code : (ExposureAgentEntityType)

Business name: A:Exposed Material Type

Indicates the type of agent that the patient was exposed to which caused the adverse reaction. This includes Drug, Food, Latex, Dust, etc.

Allows different kinds of reaction agents to be distinguished. Coding strength is set to CWE because the exposure agent type may not always be codified. The attribute is populated because there is little point in communicating about the exposure to an agent if it is not known what the agent is, however it may not always be coded.

1Pop
name :

Business name: Exposed Material Name

Indicates the name of the agent identified by MaterialKind.code

Provides a human-readable name in circumstances where the agent is captured as code.

0-1Req
REPC_MT000012CA.ReactionObservationEvent

Business name: Reported Reaction

This is a record of an adverse reaction considered relevant to the patient's clinical record.

Useful in tracking reactions when it is not known precisely what product they are associated with and whether the reaction is due to an allergy or intolerance, a drug interaction or some other cause. Effectively gives a 'heads up' to clinicians using the drug or combination of drugs.

Value must be mandatory if not using SNOMED

Code must be fixed to DX if not using SNOMED

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: C:Reaction Record Id

An identifier assigned to the record of the adverse reaction.

Uniquely identifies the specific reaction record and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
code : CD (ActCode)

Business name: Diagnosis Type

Indicates the type of diagnosis being captured.

If using SNOMED, this will contain the diagnosis. Otherwise it will be a fixed value of 'DX'.

Indicates that the observation is actually a diagnosis and is therefore mandatory. The datatype is CD to support SNOMED post-coordination.

1Mand
text :

Business name: G:Description

A free form description of the reaction.

Allows for flexibility in the recording and reporting of the reaction.

B.4

0-1Req
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL.LOW<TS.DATE>

Business name: F:Reaction Onset Date

The date on which the reaction occurrence began.

Indicates when evidence of the condition first appeared. May also provide information on the duration of the reaction.

0-1Req
confidentialityCode : (x_VeryBasicConfidentialityKind)

Business name: G:Adverse Reaction Masking Indicator

Communicates the intent of the patient to restrict access to their adverse reactions. Provides support for additional confidentiality constraint, giving patients a level of control over their information. Valid values are: 'NORMAL' (denotes 'Not Masked'); and 'RESTRICTED' (denotes 'Masked'). The default is 'NORMAL' signifying 'Not Masked'.

Allows the patient to have discrete control over access to their adverse reaction data.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

0-1Opt
value : (SubjectReaction)

Business name: B:Reaction

Specifies the kind of reaction, as experienced by the patient.

Ensures consistency in tracking and categorizing the reaction type. Helps ensure that only proper allergies are categorized as allergy. The attribute is optional because it will not be used for SNOMED. The attribute is CWE because not all possible types of reactions are expressible by coded values.

B.1

0-1Opt
subject : Subject21Mand
informant : Informant0-1Req
subjectOf1 : Subject10-1Opt
subjectOf2 : Subject60-10Req
REPC_MT000012CA.SeverityObservation

Business name: Allergy/Intolerance Severity Level

This is a ranking/ an assertion of the seriouness of the diagnosed/reported medical condition.

Allows providers to determine appropriate managements for contraindications involving such medical conditions.

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : "SEV" (ActCode)

.

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
value : (SeverityObservation)

Business name: C:Severity Level

Indicates the gravity of the allergy, intolerance or reaction in terms of its actual or potential impact on the patient.

Allows for sorting of reactions. May influence whether contraindications must be managed.

Because SNOMED pre-coordinates severity into code, this association is optional

AllergyIntolerance.severity

contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
exposureEvent : ExposureEvent1Mand
REPC_MT000012CA.Subject1

Business name: has

Indicates the severity of the allergy/intolerance.

Useful for determining severity of an allergy/intolerance contraindication and the management of same. Because severity is communicated as part of code for SNOMED, this association is optional.

Not permitted for SNOMED

typeCode : "SUBJ" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
severityObservation : SeverityObservation1Pop

Business name: *a:suffered by

Indicates the person who suffered the adverse reaction.

Ties the condition to a particular patient record, and is therefore mandatory.

AllergyIntolerance.person
