contextControlCode : "AP" (ContextControl)1Mand
patient : Patient1Mand
REPC_MT000012CA.Subject6

Business name: caused by exposure to

Indicates the agent(s) that are suspected to have been involved in the adverse reaction.

Allows linking the reaction to one or more drugs so that they can be flagged in the future when prescribed or dispensed.

typeCode : "SUBJ" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
causalityAssessment : CausalityAssessment1Pop
 
 

REPC_MT000013CA

REPC_MT000013CA.AdministrableMaterial

Business name: Exposed Material

A specific material or agent that to which the patient was exposed. Examples are: Codein (Drug), Peanut (Food), etc.

Allows the provider to zero in on specific culprits for the adverse reaction.

classCode : "ADMM" (RoleClass)1Mand
administerableMaterialKind : MaterialKind1Mand
REPC_MT000013CA.AllergyTestEvent

Business name: Allergy Tests

Indicates the specific allergy test that supports the recording of the allergy/intolerance.

Provides evidence for recording the allergy/intolerance.

If code is SNOMED, value is not permitted, otherwise it is mandatory.

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: B:Allergy Test Record Id

An identifier for a specific instance of an allergy/intolerance test.

Allows an allergy/intolerance test record to be directly referenced.

0-1Req
code : CD (ObservationAllergyTestType)

Business name: A:Allergy Test Type

A coded value denoting the type of allergy test conducted.

Allows different kinds of allergy/intolerance tests to be distinguishable and is therefore mandatory. It uses the CD type to support SNOMED post-coordination.

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
effectiveTime : TS.DATE

Business name: D:Allergy Test Date

The date on which the allergy test was performed.

Allows providers to evaluate the currency of the test.

0-1Req
value : (AllergyTestValue)

Business name: C:Allergy Test Result

A code indicating result of the allergy test.

Allows other providers to evaluate the test. There is no point in associating an allergy test with unknown results with an allergy or intolerance however the element is optional because this information may be post-coordinated in the 'code' attribute using SNOMED.

0-1Opt
REPC_MT000013CA.CausalityAssessment

Business name: Reported Reactions

This is a recording of a patient reaction that is believed to be associated with the allergy/intolerance.

Helps providers to distinguish between proper allergies and intolerances. Allows the provider recording the allergy to assign appropriate severity to the allergy. May give insight on how to mitigate an intolerance that is likely to be triggered by administering a substance. (E.g. If a given drug typically causes nausea in the patient, an additional medication may be co-prescribed to manage the nausea.)

If code is SNOMED, value is not permitted otherwise code must be “RXNASSESS” and value must be “RELATED”

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : CD (ActCode)

Business name: Assessment Type

Indicates the type of assessment being made

For SNOMED this will include the actual assessment. For non-SNOMED, this should be fixed to RXNASSES.

Communicates the relatedness assessment of the exposure to the reaction and is therefore mandatory. For SNOMED this will communicate the full assessment. It is expressed as a CD to allow for SNOMED post-coordination.

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
value : (ObservationValue)

Business name: Relatedness Assessment

Indicates whether the reaction is deemed to be related to the exposure.

This attribute will not be populated if using SNOMED. Otherwise it should have a fixed value of "RELATED".

Creates the link between the exposure and the reaction. Because the details of the assessment will be communicated in the 'code' attribute for SNOMED, this element is optional.

0-1Opt
subject : Subject61Mand
startsAfterStartOf : StartsAfterStartOf0-1Req
REPC_MT000013CA.Consumable

Business name: involved

Indicates the specific substance involved in the incidence that caused the reaction.

Identification of offending substance is needed for management of the reaction.

typeCode : "CSM" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
administrableMaterial : AdministrableMaterial1Mand
REPC_MT000013CA.ExposureEvent

Business name: Exposures

Incidence of the patient's exposure to (or contact with) with some material that might have caused the adverse reaction.

Examples of exposures include: Administering a substance (drug, food, etc) to the patient, Patient coming into contact with an environmental material, etc.

Communicates the cause of the adverse reaction.

classCode : "SBADM" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: B:Incidence Identifier

Identifier of the exposure event that caused the adverse reaction. This could be an identifier for a prescription, immunization, or other active medication record.

Allows for drilling down to retrieve further information about the exposure

0-1Req
routeCode : (RouteOfAdministration)

Business name: C:Exposure Method

The method by which the patient was exposed to the substance.

Helps evaluate the cause of the reaction.

0-1Req
consumable : Consumable1Mand

Indicates where the information that led to the recording of this information came from. The possible 3 sources of the information are: the patient, the patient's representative or a health-care provider.

The original source of the information can be important in evaluating its accuracy and importance.

typeCode : "INF" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AP" (ContextControl)1Mand

The date on which the allergy/intolerance was reported.

REPC_MT000013CA.IntoleranceCondition

Business name: Allergy/Intolerance

A record of a patient's allergy or intolerance.

Necessary component of a person's overall medication and clinical profile. Helps with drug contraindication checking.

classCode : "COND" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: D:Allergy/Intolerance Record Id

Unique identifier for an allergy/intolerance record.

Indicates the allergy or intolerance record to be updated and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
code : CD (ObservationIntoleranceType)

Business name: A:Allergy/Intolerance Type

A coded value denoting whether the record pertains to an intolerance or a true allergy. (Allergies result from immunologic reactions. Intolerances do not.)

Allows for the separation of allergy and intolerance records. The type of condition is critical to understanding the record and is therefore mandatory. It is expressed as a CD to allow for SNOMED post-coordination.

1Mand
negationInd :

Business name: G:Allergy/Intolerance Refuted

An indication that the allergy/intolerance has been refuted. I.e. A clinician has positively determined that the patient does not suffer from a particular allergy or intolerance.

Allows providers to refute a previously confirmed or suspected allergy. Because it is essential to know whether the allergy or intolerance is being refuted or affirmed, this attribute is mandatory.

1Mand
statusCode : (ActStatus)

Business name: E:Allergy/Intolerance Status

A coded value that indicates whether an allergy/intolerance is 'ACTIVE' or 'COMPLETE' (indicating no longer active).

System must default the status to 'ACTIVE'.

Allows providers to evaluate the relevance of a recorded allergy/intolerance. The status has a default value of 'ACTIVE' and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
effectiveTime : TS.DATE

Business name: I:Allergy/Intolerance Date

The date on which the recorded allergy is considered active.

Allows providers to evaluate the period of relevance for the allergy/intolerance record.

0-1Req
confidentialityCode : (x_VeryBasicConfidentialityKind)

Business name: H:Allergy/Intolerance Masking Indicator

Denotes access restriction placed on the allergy or intolerance record. Methods for accessing masked allergy records will be governed by each jurisdiction (e.g. court orders, shared secret/consent, etc.). The default confidentiality level is 'NORMAL'.

Provides support for additional confidentiality constraint to reflect the wishes of the patient.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

0-1Opt
uncertaintyCode : (ActUncertainty)

Business name: F:Confirmed Indicator

An indication of the level of confidence/surety placed in the recorded information.

The two valid codes are:

- U (stated with uncertainty) -Specifies that the author of the act affirms the uncertainty of the act statement. In other words, they know that parts of the act statement are not certain or are inferred. An example of this is an inferred prescription where some order data is inferred from a supply event (i.e. dispense).

- N (stated with no assertion of uncertainty) - Specifies that the act statement is made without any explicit expression of certainty/uncertainty. This is the normal statement, meaning that it may not be free of errors and uncertainty may still exist. In healthcare, N is believed to express certainty to the strength possible.

An allergy or intolerance record is always used in drug contraindication checking whether the record is U or N.

Helps other providers to make appropriate decisions in their management of allergy or intolerance contraindications.

Attribute is mandatory because an allergy or intolerance record must be tagged as either 'confirmed' or 'suspected'.

1Mand
subject : Subject21Mand
informant : Informant0-1Req
support : Support0-20Req
subjectOf : Subject10-1Opt
REPC_MT000013CA.MaterialKind

Business name: Agent Category

Category of material or agent to which the patient was exposed.

Allows exposed materials or agents to be collectively referenced.

classCode : "MAT" (EntityClass)1Mand
determinerCode : "KIND" (EntityDeterminer)1Mand
code : (ExposureAgentEntityType)

Business name: A:Exposed Material Type

Indicates the type of agent that the patient was exposed to which caused the adverse reaction. This includes Drug, Food, Latex, Dust, etc.

Allows different kinds of reaction agents to be distinguished. Coding strength is set to CWE because the exposure agent type may not always be codified. The attribute is populated because there is little point in communicating about the exposure to an agent if it is not known what the agent is, however it may not always be coded.

1Pop
REPC_MT000013CA.ObservationEvent

If code is SNOMED, value is not permitted, otherwise it is mandatory and code must be “DX”

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: C:Reaction Record Id

An identifier assigned to the record of the adverse reaction.

Allows for direct referencing of an adverse reaction record which was previously recorded.

0-1Req
code : CD (ActCode)

Business name: Diagnosis Type

Indicates the type of diagnosis being captured.

If using SNOMED, this will contain the diagnosis. Otherwise it will be a fixed value of 'DX'.

Indicates that the observation is actually a diagnosis and is therefore mandatory. The datatype is CD to support SNOMED post-coordination.

1Mand
negationInd :

Business name: D:No reaction occurred

Indicates that there was no adverse reaction when the patient was exposed to the agent to which an allergy/intolerance has been recorded.

Allows providers to confirm or eliminate specific agents as being the cause for the allergy/intolerance. E.g. If a reaction is recorded for Tylenol 3, but no reaction is recorded for regular Tylenol or for coffee, this suggests that the likely cause of the allergy is Codeine.

Because it is essential to know whether the reaction occurred or not, this attribute is mandatory.

1Mand
text :

Business name: G:Description

A free form description of the reaction.

Allows for flexibility in the recording and reporting of the reaction.

B.4

0-1Req
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL.LOW<TS.DATE>

Business name: F:Reaction Onset Date

The date on which the reaction occurrence began.

Indicates when evidence of the condition first appeared. May also provide information on the duration of the reaction.

0-1Req
value : (SubjectReaction)

Business name: B:Reaction

Specifies the kind of reaction, as experienced by the patient.

Ensures consistency in tracking and categorizing the reaction type. Helps ensure that only proper allergies are categorized as allergy. The attribute is optional because it will not be used for SNOMED. The attribute is CWE because not all possible types of reactions are expressible by coded values.

B.1

0-1Opt
subjectOf : Subject0-1Opt

REPC_MT000013CA.SeverityObservation

Business name: Allergy/Intolerance Severity Level

This is a ranking/ an assertion of the seriouness of the diagnosed/reported medical condition.

Allows providers to determine appropriate managements for contraindications involving such medical conditions.

Indicates both the product and how related they are determined to be to the reaction.

moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : "SEV" (ActCode)

.

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
value : (SeverityObservation)

Business name: C:Severity Level

Indicates the gravity of the allergy, intolerance or reaction in terms of its actual or potential impact on the patient.

Allows for sorting of allergy records. May influence whether contraindications must be managed.

Because SNOMED pre-coordinates severity into code, this association is optional

An indication of the severity of the reaction.

Allows providers to evaluate the significance of the allergy or intolerance. Because severity is pre-coordinated into code when using SNOMED, this association is optional.

Not permitted for SNOMED, required otherwise

typeCode : "SUBJ" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand

REPC_MT000013CA.Support

Business name: *b:supported by

Indicates a particular type of reaction experienced by the patient or testing performed on the patient which provides evidence for the existence (or non-existence) of the allergy/intolerance.

May help ascertain the severity of the condition, and provide direction for management. Also helps demonstrate the distinction between allergies and intolerances

typeCode : "SPRT" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand

REPC_MT000014CA

REPC_MT000014CA.ChronicIndicator

Business name: Chronic Indicator

If present, indicates that the recorded medical condition is deemed to be chronic.

Allows the recording provider the ability to designate certain conditions as chronic. This is especially useful in jurisdictions where the code scheme used for medical condition does not convey such information.

The association behaves as a mandatory boolean where the presence of the association represents 'true' while the absence represents 'false'.

classCode : "LIST" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : "CHRON" (ActCode)1Mand
REPC_MT000014CA.Informant

Business name: b:reported by

Indicates where the information that led to the recording of this information came from. The possible 3 sources of the information are: the patient, the patient's representative or a health-care provider.

Allows for establishment of timelines between reported date and recorded date.

typeCode : "INF" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AP" (ContextControl)1Mand
time : TS.FULLDATE

Business name: Reported Date

The date on which the medical condition was reported.

Allows for establishment of timelines between onset date, reported date and recorded date, and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
Choice: party : Party1Pop
 »»  patient : Patient0-1Opt
 »»  responsibleParty : ResponsibleParty0-1Opt
 »»  assignedPerson : AssignedPerson0-1Opt
REPC_MT000014CA.MedicalCondition

Business name: Medical Condition

A record of a patient's medical condition. Includes diseases, disabilities, pregnancy, lactation and other clinical conditions of interest.

Necessary component of a person's overall medication and clinical profile. Helps with contraindication checking.

Value is mandatory if not using SNOMED

Code is fixed to DX if not using SNOMED

classCode : "COND" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: A:Medical Condition Record Id

Unique identifier for medical condition record to be updated.

Allows for direct referencing of a medical condition record when querying or updating and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
code : CD (ActCode)

Business name: Condition Type

Indicates what kind of condition is being reported.

If SNOMED is used, the diagnosis will appear here. Otherwise, a fixed value of "DX" should be sent.

Identifies this observation as reporting a medical condition and is therefore mandatory. When using SNOMED, the actual condition may be post-coordinated into this attribute, thus CD is used.

1Mand
statusCode : (ActStatus)

Business name: D:Condition Status

A coded value that indicates whether the condition is still impacting the patient. 'ACTIVE' means the condition is still affecting the patient. 'COMPLETE' means the condition no longer holds

Essential to evaluating the relevance of the condition record. In some cases, it may not be known whether the condition still exists or not. Therefore the status is treated as 'populated'.

1Pop
effectiveTime : IVL<TS.DATE>

Business name: E:Condition Time Period

The date on which the condition first began and when it ended.

For ongoing conditions such as chronic diseases, the upper boundary may be unknown.

For transient conditions such as pregnancy, lactation, etc; the upper boundary of the period would usually be specified to signify the end of the condition.

Allows providers to evaluate the period of relevance for the medical condition.

0-1Req
confidentialityCode : (x_VeryBasicConfidentialityKind)

Business name: F:Medical Condition Masking Indicator

Denotes access restriction placed on the medical condition record. Methods for accessing masked medical condition records will be governed by each jurisdiction (e.g. court orders, shared secret/consent, etc.).

The default confidentiality level is 'NORMAL'.

Provides support for additional confidentiality constraint to reflect the wishes of the patient.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

0-1Opt
value : (DiagnosisValue)

Business name: C:Condition

A code indicating the specific condition. E.g. Hypertension, Pregnancy.

This is the central piece of information in recording a condition. However because when using SNOMED the actual diagnosis will be sent in the 'code' attribute, this element is optional.

0-1Opt
subject : Subject21Mand
informant : Informant0-1Req
subjectOf : Subject0-1Req
REPC_MT000014CA.Party
Implementations of REPC_MT000014CA.Party :
 »»  Patient
 »»  ResponsibleParty
 »»  AssignedPerson
REPC_MT000014CA.Subject

Chronic Indicator must not be present if using SNOMED

typeCode : "SUBJ" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
chronicIndicator : ChronicIndicator1Pop
REPC_MT000014CA.Subject2

Business name: *a:suffered by

Identifies the person affected by the condition

Ties the condition to a particular patient record, and is therefore mandatory.

AllergyIntolerance.person

typeCode : "SBJ" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "OP" (ContextControl)1Mand
patient : Patient1Mand
 
 

REPC_MT000015CA

REPC_MT000015CA.IncludeNotesIndicator
value :

Business name: Include Notes Indicator

Indicates whether or not notes attached to the medical condition records are to be returned along with the detailed information.

Allows for the flexibility of omitting/including notes in the retrieval of information for medical condition data.

Because the attribute is boolean, it must explicitly indicate a 'TRUE' or 'FALSE', and thus it is mandatory.

1Mand
REPC_MT000015CA.MedicalConditionChangePeriod
value : IVL<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: G:Medical Condition Change Period

Filters the query response to only include medical conditions which have been created or modified within the date-range specified

Useful in retrieving incremental changes to the patient's record.

1Mand
REPC_MT000015CA.MedicalConditionStatus
value : (ActStatus)

Business name: G:Medical Condition Status

Indicates that the result set should be filtered to included only those medical condition records for the specified status.

Valid statuses include: ACTIVE or COMPLETE.

Allows for the selective retrieval of medical condition records based on the status of the record.

1Mand
REPC_MT000015CA.ParameterList

Business name: Medical Conditions Query Parameters

Defines the set of parameters that may be used to filter the query response

Root class for query definition

includeNotesIndicator : IncludeNotesIndicator1Mand
medicalConditionChangePeriod : MedicalConditionChangePeriod0-1Req
medicalConditionStatus : MedicalConditionStatus0-1Req
patientBirthDate : PatientBirthDate1Mand
patientGender : PatientGender1Mand
patientID : PatientID1Mand
patientName : PatientName1Mand
REPC_MT000015CA.PatientBirthDate
value : TS.DATE

Business name: E:Patient Birth Date

Indicates the date on which the patient was born.

Used to confirm the identity of the patient for the query and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
REPC_MT000015CA.PatientGender
value : (AdministrativeGender)

Business name: D:Patient Gender

Indicates the gender (sex) of the patient.

Used to confirm the identity of the patient for the query and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
REPC_MT000015CA.PatientID
value : II

Business name: B:Patient ID

Identifier of the patient who is the subject of the medical condition query. Filter the result set to include only those records pertaining to the patient with this Id.

Allows filtering of result set by patient Id. This is a mandatory field because a patient must be specified for the query to be valid

1Mand
REPC_MT000015CA.PatientName
value : PN.BASIC

Business name: C:Patient Name

The name of the patient who is the subject of the medical condition query.

Filter the result set to include only those records pertaining to the patient with this name.

Allows filtering of result set by patient name. This is a mandatory field because a patient name must match the patient Id for the query to be valid.

1Mand
 
 

REPC_MT000016CA

REPC_MT000016CA.IncludeNotesIndicator
value :

Business name: Include Notes Indicator

Indicates whether or not notes attached to the adverse reactions records are to be returned along with the detailed information.

Allows for the flexibility of omitting/including notes in the retrieval of information for adverse reactions data.

Because the attribute is boolean, it must explicitly indicate a 'TRUE' or 'FALSE', and thus it is mandatory.

1Mand
REPC_MT000016CA.ParameterList

Business name: Adverse Reactions Query Parameters

Defines the set of parameters that may be used to filter the query response.

Root class for query definition

includeNotesIndicator : IncludeNotesIndicator1Mand
patientBirthDate : PatientBirthDate1Mand
patientGender : PatientGender1Mand
patientID : PatientID1Mand
patientName : PatientName1Mand
reactionPeriod : ReactionPeriod0-1Req
reactionType : ReactionType0-1Req
REPC_MT000016CA.PatientBirthDate
value : TS.DATE

Business name: E:Patient Birth Date

Indicates the date on which the patient was born.

Used to confirm the identity of the patient for the query and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
REPC_MT000016CA.PatientGender
value : (AdministrativeGender)

Business name: D:Patient Gender

Indicates the gender (sex) of the patient.

Used to confirm the identity of the patient for the query and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
REPC_MT000016CA.PatientID
value : II

Business name: B:Patient ID

Identifier of the patient who is the subject of the adverse reaction query. Filter the result set to include only those records pertaining to the patient with this Id.

Allows filtering of result set by patient Id. This is a mandatory field because a patient must be specified for the query to be valid

1Mand
REPC_MT000016CA.PatientName
value : PN.BASIC

Business name: C:Patient Name

The name of the patient who is the subject of the adverse reaction query.

Filter the result set to include only those records pertaining to the patient with this name.

Allows filtering of result set by patient name. This is a mandatory field because a patient name must match the patient Id for the query to be valid.

1Mand
REPC_MT000016CA.ReactionPeriod
value : IVL<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: F:Reaction Period

The period in which the recorded adverse reaction occurred or was updated. I.e. Filters the result-set to those reactions whose onset occurred within the time-range specified by this parameter.

Allows the requester to specify the adverse reaction period of interest for retrieval of adverse reaction records. Useful to avoid run-away queries.

1Mand
REPC_MT000016CA.ReactionType
value : (SubjectReaction)

Business name: G:Reaction Type

Indicates that the result set be filtered to include only those allergy/intolerance records for which specific type of reaction was recorded.

Reaction types include: STEVEN JOHNSON, ANAPHYLAXIS, NAUSEA, etc

Allows the requester to retrieve only those allergy/intolerance records for which there was a specific type of reaction.

1Mand

moodCode : "RQO" (ActMood)1Mand

REPC_MT000017CA.ProcedureEvent

Business name: Professional Service

This is the information that is recorded and maintained on a consultative service provided to a patient. This service may or may not be related to a prescribed, dispensed or administered drug.

May be pertinent information with respect to a patient's drug therapy regime.

A_BillableClinicalService

classCode : "PROC" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : (ActProfessionalServiceCode)

Business name: B:Service Code

Identifies the specific service that has been performed. This is obtained from the professional service catalog pertaining to the discipline of the health service provider.

Allows the service to be sorted and filtered. Ensures consistency for analysis and reporting purposes and is therefore mandatory

PatientConsultation.category

D57

ZPS.5.1

ZPS.5.2 (experience handled as qualifier)

Claim.436-E1 (code system)

Claim.407-D7 (mnemonic)

Claim.459-ER (modifier)

Claim.418-DI (modifier)

DUR/PPS.474-8E (modifier)

A_BillableClinicalService

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
effectiveTime : IVL<TS.DATETIME>

Business name: C:Consultation Time and Length

The date and time on which the professional service was performed, as well as the duration of the service.

Allows the service-event to be located in a particular time. Because a time won't always be known, the attribute is only marked as "populated". The duration of the consultation may also be of clinical interest.

PatientConsultation.eventTime(Low)

patientConsultation.eventDuration(Width)

ZPS.4 (center)

ZPS.5.2(timing portion of code set)

Claim.457-EP

A_BillableClinicalService

Center date cannot be null But duration can be left unspecified if not known.

1Pop
confidentialityCode : (x_VeryBasicConfidentialityKind)

Business name: D:Professional Service Masking Indicator

Communicates the intent of the patient to restrict access to their professional service record. Provides support for additional confidentiality constraint, giving patients a level of control over their information. Valid values are: 'NORMAL' (denotes 'Not Masked'); and 'RESTRICTED' (denotes 'Masked'). The default is 'NORMAL' signifying 'Not Masked'.

Allows the patient to have discrete control over access to their medication data.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

0-1Opt
subject : Subject1Mand
inFulfillmentOf : InFulfillmentOf0-1Req
subjectOf : Subject20-1Req
REPC_MT000017CA.Subject

Business name: *a:provided to

Identity of the person who received the professional service.

Allows the content to be linked to the person's EHR. As a result, this association is mandatory.

PatientConsultation.personRepresentative

typeCode : "SBJ" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "OP" (ContextControl)1Mand
patient : Patient1Mand
REPC_MT000017CA.Subject2

Business name: c:includes

Indicates the various comments that providers have recorded about this professional service occurrence.

Improves communication between providers by allowing a mechanism to exchange un-coded free-form information.

typeCode : "SUBJ" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
annotation : Annotation1Pop
 
 

REPC_MT000018CA

REPC_MT000018CA.CommonObservationEvent

Business name: Patient Measurements

This comprises a single point-in-time measurement made about a patient.

Allows pertinent patient measurements to be recorded for clinical purposes.

Measurement Type with a ‘nullFlavor’value must have SubObservations Measurement Type without a ‘nullFlavor’ value must not have SubObservations.

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : CD (CommonClinicalObservationType)

Business name: A:MeasurementType

Identification of the type of measurement/observation that was made about the patient. Observation types include: height, weight, blood pressure, body mass, etc

Distinguishes what kind of information is being specified.

The attribute is CD to support SNOMED

1Pop
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
effectiveTime : TS.FULLDATETIME

Business name: C:Observation Timestamp

The dateand time at which the observation applies. E.g., if blood was drawn two days ago and White Blood Count (WBC) was done today, then WBC observation date should reflect the date of two days ago.

Allows providers to evaluate currency of the information. Because the date of observation/measurement determines the relevance of the information, this attribute is defined as 'populated'. Also allows tracking of observations over time.

OBS.010-04 NCPDP:Clinical.494-ZE NCPDP:Clinical.495-H1

1Pop
confidentialityCode : (x_VeryBasicConfidentialityKind)

Business name: D:Common Observation Masking Indicator

Communicates the intent of the patient to restrict access to their common observations. Provides support for additional confidentiality constraint, giving patients a level of control over their information. Valid values are: 'NORMAL' (denotes 'Not Masked'); and 'RESTRICTED' (denotes 'Masked'). The default is 'NORMAL' signifying 'Not Masked'.

Allows the patient to have discrete control over access to their common observation data.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

0-1Opt
value : PQ.BASIC

Business name: B:Observation Measurement Value

The amount (quantity and unit) that has been recorded for the specific type of observation. E.g. height in centimeters, weight in kilograms, etc.

Valid observation unit types are: kg, cm, mmHg, mmol/mL, L/min, C, 1/min, etc

Provides standard representation of the measurement. May be used in calculations.

OBS.010-02 (value) eScript:OBS.010-03 (unit) NCPDP:Clinical.595-H4 (value) NCPDP:Clinical.495-H3 (unit)

0-1Req
subject : Subject51Mand
component : Component0-2Req
subjectOf : Subject0-1Req
REPC_MT000018CA.Component

Business name: has

Indicates sub-measurements that combine to make up the overall measurement.

Needed for more complex observations such as blood pressure.

Participation must be either zero or 2, and nothing else

typeCode : "COMP" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "ON" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "true" 1Mand
subObservationEvent : SubObservationEvent1Pop
REPC_MT000018CA.SubObservationEvent

Business name: Component Measurements

Represents one of the two components (systolic and diastolic) of a blood pressure measurement.

Allows both parts to be captured as part of a single measurement.

The same Measurement Type may not be specified in both the SubObservationEvent and the CommonObservationEvent.

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
code : CD (CommonClinicalObservationType)

Business name: Blood Pressure Measurement Type

Distinguishes between the two types of blood measurement. This can either be code for SYSTOLIC or DYSTOLIC

Distinguishes between the two types of blood pressure measurements.

Code is mandatory to ensure that blood pressure observations are distinguishable. The attribute is CD to support SNOMED

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
value : PQ.BASIC

Business name: B:Blood Pressure Measurement Value

The amount (quantity and unit) that has been recorded for the blood pressure.

Provides standard representation of the blood pressure measurement. May be used in calculations. Attribute is defined as mandatory to ensure that a value is always supplied, if there is a blood pressure measurement.

1Mand
REPC_MT000018CA.Subject

Business name: *c:includes

Indicates the various comments that providers have recorded about this common observation.

Improves communication between providers by allowing a mechanism to exchange un-coded free-form information.

typeCode : "SUBJ" (ActRelationshipType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AN" (ContextControl)1Mand
contextConductionInd : "false" 1Mand
annotation : Annotation1Pop
REPC_MT000018CA.Subject5

Business name: *a:recorded for

Identity of the person being observed.

Allows the observation to be attached to the appropriate person's record. As a result, this association is mandatory.

typeCode : "SBJ" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "OP" (ContextControl)1Mand
patient : Patient1Mand

REPC_MT100001CA.Location

Business name: *performed at

Indicates where the professional service was performed or delivered.

Indicates where records are likely kept for follow-up. May also be useful in understanding the context in which the professional service was performed.

The location of entry should always exist, and is therefore mandatory.

This association behaves as a mandatory boolean attribute where the presence of the association indicates 'true' and the absence indicates 'false'.

REPC_MT100002CA

statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
REPC_MT100002CA.Author3

Business name: *b:recorded by

Identifies the provider responsible for the recording the patient measurement.

Only needs to be specified if the author of the annotation differs from the prescriber.

Allows tracking of who made the patient observation. This attribute is mandatory because the provider responsible for the observation must be known.

Annotation.requestingProvider

ZPB3.18 (id.root)

ZPB3.19 (id.extension)

ZPB3.15

typeCode : "AUT" (ParticipationType)1Mand
contextControlCode : "AP" (ContextControl)1Mand
time : TS.FULLDATETIME

Business name: Recording Datetime

The date and time on which the observation was recorded.

If not specified, the author time of the overall order will be assumed.

The date and time on which the observation was recorded. Identifies timing of observation for sorting and for audit purposes. Attribute is populated because the source of the data may not be through the 'record common observation' interaction.

Annotation.annotationDate

assignedPerson : AssignedPerson1Mand
REPC_MT100002CA.CommonObservationEvent

Business name: Patient Measurement

This comprises a single point-in-time measurement made about a patient.

Allows pertinent patient measurements to be recorded for clinical purposes.

Measurement Type with a ‘nullFlavor’ value must have SubObservations Measurement Type without a ‘nullFlavor’ value must not have SubObservations.

Annotation is only permitted if Annotation Indicator is not present and vice versa

classCode : "OBS" (ActClass)1Mand
moodCode : "EVN" (ActMood)1Mand
id : II

Business name: E:Observation Measurement Id

Unique identifier assigned to a record of observation measurement.

Allows observation measurement record to be directly accessed for "undo's", and thus the attribute is mandatory.

1Mand
code : CD (CommonClinicalObservationType)

Business name: A:Measurement Type

Identification of the type of measurement/observation that was made about the patient. Observation types include: height, weight, blood pressure, body mass, etc.

Distinguishes what kind of information is being specified. Code is mandatory to ensure that observations are distinguishable. The attribute is CD to support SNOMED.

1Mand
statusCode : "completed" (ActStatus)1Mand
effectiveTime : TS.FULLDATETIME

Business name: C:Observation Measurement Timestamp

The date to which the observation applies. E.g., if blood was drawn two days ago and White Blood Count (WBC) was done today, then WBC observation date should reflect the date of two days ago.

Allows providers to evaluate currency of the information. Because the date of observation/measurement determines the relevance of the information, this attribute is defined as 'populated'. Also allows tracking of observations over time.

1Pop

Communicates the intent of the patient to restrict access to their common observations. Provides support for additional confidentiality constraint, giving patients a level of control over their information. Valid values are: 'NORMAL' (denotes 'Not Masked'); and 'RESTRICTED' (denotes 'Masked'). The default is 'NORMAL' signifying 'Not Masked'.

Allows the patient to have discrete control over access to their common observation data.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

REPC_MT120001CA

REPC_MT120001CA.IncludeNotesIndicator
value :

Business name: Include Notes Indicator

Indicates whether or not notes attached to the professional service record are to be returned along with the detailed information.

Allows for the flexibility of omitting/including notes in the retrieval of information for professional service data.

Because the attribute is boolean, it must explicitly indicate a 'TRUE' or 'FALSE', and thus it is mandatory.

1Mand
REPC_MT120001CA.ParameterList

Business name: Professional Service Query Parameters

Defines the set of parameters that may be used to filter the query response.

Root class for query parameters.

includeNotesIndicator : IncludeNotesIndicator1Mand
patientBirthDate : PatientBirthDate1Mand
patientGender : PatientGender1Mand
patientID : PatientID1Mand
patientName : PatientName1Mand
professionalServiceCode : ProfessionalServiceCode0-10Req
servicePeriod : ServicePeriod0-1Req
REPC_MT120001CA.PatientBirthDate
value : TS.DATE

Business name: Patient Birth Date

Indicates the date on which the patient was born.

Used to confirm the identity of the patient for the query and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
REPC_MT120001CA.PatientGender
value : (AdministrativeGender)

Business name: Patient Gender

Indicates the gender (sex) of the patient.

Used to confirm the identity of the patient for the query and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
REPC_MT120001CA.PatientID
value : II

Business name: B:Patient ID

Identifier of the patient who is the subject of the patient drug contraindication query. Filter the result set to include only those records pertaining to the patient with this Id.

Allows filtering of result set by patient Id. This is a mandatory field because a patient must be specified for the query to be valid

1Mand
REPC_MT120001CA.PatientName
value : PN.BASIC

Business name: C:Patient Name

The name of the patient who is the subject of the drug contraindication query.

Filter the result set to include only those records pertaining to the patient with this name.

Allows filtering of result set by patient name. This is a mandatory field because a patient name must match the patient Id for the query to be valid.

1Mand
REPC_MT120001CA.ProfessionalServiceCode
value : (ActProfessionalServiceCode)

Business name: Professional Service Codes

Indicates that the result set is to be filtered to include only those records pertaining to the specified professional service code.

The service code may refer to a specific service or to a higher level classification professional service within the service hierarchy.

Allows for the retrieval of patient professional services pertaining to specific professional service or category of professional services.

1Mand
REPC_MT120001CA.ServicePeriod
value : IVL<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: Service Period

Indicates that the returned records should be filtered to only include those professional services rendered to the patient within the indicated time-period.

Allows the requester to specify the event period of interest for the retrieval of patient professional service records.

Useful for constraining run-away queries.

1Mand
 
 

REPC_MT120002CA

REPC_MT120002CA.IncludeNotesIndicator
value :

Business name: Include Notes Indicator

Indicates whether or not common observation record are to be returned along with notes that have been recorded against the measurement record.

Allows for the flexibility of omitting/including notes in the retrieval of information for common observation data.

Because the attribute is boolean, it must explicitly indicate a 'TRUE' or 'FALSE', and thus it is mandatory.

1Mand
REPC_MT120002CA.MeasurementEffectivePeriod
value : IVL<TS.FULLDATE>

Business name: G:Measurement Effective Period

Indicates the measurement period for which the request/query applies.

Filter the result set to include only those patient measurement that were taken within the specified period.

Allows the requester to specify the measurement period of interest for the retrieval. Useful for constraining run-away queries.

1Mand
REPC_MT120002CA.MeasurementType
value : CD (CommonClinicalObservationType)

Business name: F:Measurement Types

Indicates that only patient measurements of a specific type are to be included in the result set. If not specified, all measurement types will be included.

Allows for the retrieval of patient measurements based on a specific type of measurement or set of measurements.

1Mand
REPC_MT120002CA.ParameterList

Business name: Common Observation Query Parameters

Defines the set of parameters that may be used to filter the query response.

Root class for query definition

includeNotesIndicator : IncludeNotesIndicator1Mand
measurementEffectivePeriod : MeasurementEffectivePeriod0-1Req
measurementType : MeasurementType0-10Req
patientBirthDate : PatientBirthDate1Mand
patientGender : PatientGender1Mand
patientID : PatientID1Mand
patientName : PatientName1Mand
REPC_MT120002CA.PatientBirthDate
value : TS.DATE

Business name: E:Patient Birth Date

Indicates the gender of the patient.

Used to confirm the identity of the patient for the query and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
REPC_MT120002CA.PatientGender
value : (AdministrativeGender)

Business name: D:Patient Gender

Indicates the gender (sex) of the patient.

Used to confirm the of the patient for the query and is therefore mandatory.

1Mand
REPC_MT120002CA.PatientID
value : II

Business name: B:Patient ID

Identifier of the patient who is the subject of the patient measurement query. Filter the result set to include only those records pertaining to the patient with this Id.

Allows filtering of result set by patient Id. This is a mandatory field because a patient must be specified for the query to be valid

1Mand
REPC_MT120002CA.PatientName
value : PN.BASIC

Business name: C:Patient Name

The name of the patient who is the subject of the patient measurement query.

Filter the result set to include only those records pertaining to the patient with this name.

Allows filtering of result set by patient name. This is a mandatory field because a patient name must match the patient Id for the query to be valid.

1Mand
